<b>Welcome To Republic City</b> <br><b>Written By:</b> <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=1">Michael Dante DiMartino</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=2">Bryan Konietzko</a><br><b>Directed By:</b> <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=3">Joaqium Dos Santos</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=4">Ki Hyun Ryu</a><br><b>Storyboard By:</b> <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=9">Ian Graham</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=10">Kang Sung Dae</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=11">Kim Sung Hoon</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=12">Lee Dae Woo</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=13">Han Kwang Il</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=14">Kim Young Chan</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=15">Lesean Thomas</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=16">Alan Wan</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=17">Hyun Joo Song</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=18">Adam Lucas</a>, <a href="http://korra.avatarspirit.net/crew.php?id=19">Colin Heck</a><br><b>Animation By:</b> Studio Mir<br><b>Transcribers:</b> Avatar_Mom, Lavanya Six<br><br><br><br><i>[The introduction sequence is longer than normal, giving the past Avatars more time to demonstrate their element. Kyoshi bends earth and punches it to the left. The camera cuts to the tight. Roku strikes left and right, fire bursting from his hands. We cut back to the left to find an adult Aang, his jaw trimmed with a dark beard. He dances and kicks at stage center. We cut upwards. Korra sloppily waterbenders, soaking the camera. The screen whites out.</i><br><br><i>When it dims, an aged ink drawing fills the screen. It's Team Avatar from the original series, at the age we last saw them. From left to right: Sokka brandishes his space swords, Suki is dressed in her Kyoshi Warrior uniform, Toph is earthbending, Katara is waterbending, Zuko is firebending, and Aang is airbending. The camera pans rightward across the drawing before finally focusing on Aang. His eyes and arrow tattoos begin to glow white. Then they flash.</i><br><br><i>A standard Avatar world map appears. The camera zooms in, tilting and turning, and the map becomes partly three dimensional with regards to the mountains and volcanos. The camera approaches a spot in the Earth Kingdom's continental northwest. The screen whites out again, as if the camera is passing through clouds. When it comes through the other side, the view is one of a flyover shot of Republic City. The camera can see the whole width of the sprawling city. Then the camera shoots into the waters of Yue Bay, before coming up for a shot of the city's skyline. The camera races towards the skyline, only to veer off to the left, turning around to approach Aang's giant memorial statue. The camera keeps moving, but slows for a moment to linger on Aang's face. It shoots up vertically into a cloud-filed sky,  finally settling on a shot of the blazing sun.]</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> Earth... Fire... Air... Water.<br><br>When I was a boy, my father, Avatar Aang, told me the story of how he and his friends heroically ended the Hundred Year War.<br><br>Avatar Aang and Firelord Zuko transformed the Fire Nation colonies into the United Republic of Nations, a society where benders and non-benders from all over the world could live and thrive together in peace and harmony. They named the capital of this great land "Republic City".<br><br>Avatar Aang accomplished many remarkable things in his life, but sadly his time in this world came to an end. And like the cycle of the seasons, the cycle of the Avatar began anew.<br><br><br><br><u><b>Act I</b></u><br><br><i>(It's nighttime in the Southern Water Tribe, the sky filled with storm clouds and the air with snow. The camera pans down to reveal mountains along a coastline. In the background, a coastal city blazes with bright lights. Yet our interest is the three cloaked figure advancing up the hillside, the central figure holding aloft a lantern.</i><br><br><i>We cut to a view behind the trio as they reach the crest of their hilltop. Their purple cloaks stand out against the white snow. The trio pauses. Their new focus is shared by the camera; the hazy background sharpens. There are a few homes atop the hill.</i><br><br><i>We cut to a view of this landscape, with several igloos and tents dotting it, and the camera pans across it. Three tiny figures approach one igloo; it blazes with light.</i><br><br><i>We cut to the wooden door of that dwelling. Tonraq, a large muscular man in Water Tribe clothing, is holding aloft a lantern. He bows his head in respect to the cloaked figure in the foreground.)</i><br><br><b>Tonraq:</b> The White Lotus has honored my family by coming. Thank you.<br><br><i>(Tonraq turns and pushing open the door. Senna, his wife, is sweeping in the center of their home. Her robe is stained and their house is clearly in a state of disrepair. Senna halts her sweeping and bows.)</i><br><br><b>Senna:</b> Welcome.<br><br><i>(Her statement is puncuated by a decorative shield falling off the wall.</i><br><br><i>The cloaked figures pull of their hoods. Tonraq walks around them. Their leader, a short, hefty man with greying hair, speaks.)</i><br><br><b>White Lotus Leader:</b> We have investigated many claims, both here and in the Northern Tribe. All have turned out to be false.<br><br><i>(Tonraq comes over to Senna and puts an arm on her shoulder. The couple smiles at one another, then turns back to the trio.)</i><br><br><b>Senna:</b> Then you should be happy to know, your search has come to an end. <br><br><i>(Cut to a close-up view of the trio. They are clearly unimpressed with this declaration.)</i><br><br><b>White Lotus Leader:</b> What makes you so sure your daughter is the "one"?<br><br><i>(Cut back on the couple. Senna turns to the left and calls out.)</i><br><br><b>Senna:</b> Korra, please come in here.<br><br><i>(Cut back to the White Lotus trio. They're facing the camera, still looking bland, when a slab of rock flies past them. Their eyes shoot wide. They turn, startled, to the right. The camera zooms rightward, revealing a circular hole in the room's stone interior wall. Backlit by a bright light, a kid Korra strikes an action pose and then starts jumping around, bending the various elements.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I'm the Avatar, you gotta deal with it!<br><br><i>(We cut to Korra encroaching on the trio. They step back, their expressions still shocked, as Korra bends. A shot of the trio's leader getting the hem of his cloak set ablaze is followed by Korra putting out the small fire with a spot of bent water. We pan up from their feet to find the trio is still surprised. They look from the extinguished cloak fire to Korra, and the camera cuts to Korra still moving through the elements.</i><br><br><i>Finally, this young Korra blasts fire straight on into the camera, filling the screen, and when the red flames die away many years have passed. The Korra we see now is seventeen years old. She is dressed in red-toned protective gear atop her usual Water Tribe flavor clothes. In the background is her training grounds, set amid the snowy mountains of the South Pole. But all this passes in a blur, for Korra is in combat. She kicks flames at the camera and we cut to one of her training partners, also dressed in red, failing to block her attack. He's knocked off his feet and thrown backwards.</i><br><br><i>We cut to a new shot as that man rolls away under the camera. There are two more red-garbbed sparring partners, and past them, watching this battle unfold, are a handful of figures. Korra jumps into shot, turning to face her two remaining opponents. They simultaneously blast fireballs at her.</i><br><br><i>We cut to a shot overlooking the battle, with the camera hanging just behind the onlookers. We see now that of the five, three of them are the same trio of White Lotus officials from Korra's childhood, if with more white in their hair. </i><br><br><i>We cut to face Korra again, where, boasting a cocky expression, she easily disperse the double attack.</i><br><br><i>We cut to a side view of her two sparring partners. The one closest to the camera punches forward, blasting more fire, and then he moves leftward off-screen towards Korra. A cut back to Korra shows her dodging the incoming fireballs and advancing on her opponents. The next shot shows her two enemies continuing their attacks, with one man charging Korra and the other running to circle around. The first man attempts a mid-air spinning kick, but Korra rolls under the attack and unbalances the man with a kick to his foot. Off-balance, the man tumbles wildly through the air. He hits the ground hard but recovers. </i><br><br><i>Korra now finds herself between the two firebenders. </i><br><br><i>As the second man blasts her with fire, the first man charges her. Korra deals with both attacks simultaneously; dispelling the fire with her hands and kicking backwards at the first man. She immediately launches into the offensive, firing blasts at the second man.</i><br><br><i>We cut to a sideways shot of him taking the brunt of Korra's attack. It's too much. He grunts as he's overwhelmed and thrown backwards off his feet.</i><br><br><i>We cut to a shot of Korra's back as the first man charges on screen. He blasts her with fireball punches, but Korra's guard is too good. Nothing gets through her defense. A sideways shot of Korra shows her blocking fireballs from both sides of the screen. An especially large one overwhelms the camera, and when the flames die out we get a close-up shot of a determined Korra. She uses both arms and unleashes a ferocious attack at the camera, and we cut to a sideways shot of her and the second man to see its effect. Her target is rocketed off his feet and into the air. Smoking, he arcs over and hits the roof of the building the observers are standing in. Limp and groaning, he slides down the wooden roof and becomes tangled up in the railing at its edge. Directly below him, the five observes are staring up.</i><br><br><i>We cut to a sidewards view of the five, panning right-to-left. An elderly woman near the camera, her white hair styled in distinctive loopies, is impressed.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> She's strong.<br><br><i>(As the other two Lotus members and an elderly Fire Nation return their focus to the battlefield, the leader of the trio turns his head to look at Katara. His expression is one of severe disapproval, even annoyance.)</i><br><br><b>White Lotus Leader:</b> She lacks restraint.<br><br><i>(We cut back to the training grounds, with a sideways shot of the remaining duelist. He runs towards the right, continuously blasting fire with both hands. We cut back to Korra, smiling with wolfish enjoyment, as she runs to the left. The camera pulls in close on her face and the incoming flame adds an orange-ish tone to her skin. Her grin never falters. Cutting to an overhead view of the two, we see now that Korra is running head-on into a gigantic sustained fire plume. Cutting into the middle of the churning inferno, Korra presses her way into view, forcing aside the flames and moving towards the camera. Her expression is no longer wolfish. Instead, it is one of fixed, grim determination. </i><br><br><i>The camera cuts to the remaining duelist standing in the middle of the screen. Korra, having forced her way through his flames, seems about to grab hold of both his wrists. Instead, as the man freaks out at this sudden reversal, she takes advantage of his surprise to leap atop him, summersaulting off his left shoulder. We cut to a view of Korra spin through the air, the camera looking down as she is on the distraught man below, and hang with this for a few moments. Then we cut to a forward view of Korra hanging in the air; she unleashes a kick that spews flames at the man below, who throws his arms up to shelter himself. A close-up cut to Korra, expression still one of grim focus, flows into her unleashing jets of flames with both arms. As she gracefully lands, we cut to a shot of the smoldering duelist with the five onlookers in the background. The duelist collapses. </i><br><br><i>We cut back to Korra facing the camera. She throws both arms into the air and goes woo-hoo. A reaction shot of the adult onlookers shows that only Katara is pleased. The trio's leader, arms folded across his chest, is clearly peeved. The two other White Lotus members aren't impressed either, with the spectacled man raising an eyebrow. The finely dressed Fire Nation man, hands held behind his back, possesses a neutral expression. </i><br><br><i>We cut to an overhead shot of the five onlookers as Korra runs towards them and stops at the edge of the training field.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Woo hoo! Hey, why all the doom and gloom people? We should be celebrating! Three elements down, one to go. <br><br><i>(Cut to Korra facing the camera. Off to her left in the background, one of her sparring partners sits on the ground rubbing his head. Korra pulls off her safety helmet. She's ecstatic.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a close sideways view of Katara, the Fire Nation man, and the trio's leader. The camera moves pass Katara, focusing on both the Fire Nation man and the trio's leader as they speak.)</i><br><br><b>Firebending Master:</b> You're getting ahead of yourself as usual Korra. We haven't decided if you passed your firebending test yet.<br><b>White Lotus Leader:</b> Ever since you were a little girl, you've excelled at the physical side of bending, but completely ignored the spiritual side. The Avatar must master both.<br><br><i>(Cut back to Korra reacting. Her lips are pursed and her eyelids half-drawn. She's even less impressed then they were a moment ago. Shoulders slumping forward, she looks abashed for a moment, yet her cheerful attitude soon reasserts itself.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I haven't ignored it. It just doesn't come as easy to me. But that's why I should start training with Tenzin immediately. He's "Mister Spiritual."<br><br><i>(Cut back to overhead shot of the assembly. The trio's leader bodily turns toward Katara.)</i><br><br><b>White Lotus Leader:</b> Do you believe she's ready Master Katara?<br><br><i>(Cut to close-up of the five elders.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Yes. If anyone can teach her what she needs to learn, its Tenzin.<br><br><i>(Katara's answer provokes quiet shock and dismay from the group. Korra's firebending instructor's jaw drops. The two White Loti in the back row close their eyes and slightly bow their heads. Soon, the other two elders join them in bowing their heads to Master Katara's decision. Then they all open their eyes and raise their heads.)</i><br><br><b>White Lotus Leader:</b> Very well, Korra. It's time for you to begin your airbending training.<br><br><i>(Cut to Korra. She jumps for joy, then remembers she still has an audience. A reaction shot shows only Katara is remotely approving of the Avatar's behavior. Cutting back to Korra, she clears her throat and solemnly thanks them.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Yes! Finally! I mean... Thank you all for believing in me. <br><br><i>(Cut to Korra walking away from the group of elders. She can barely contain her excitement and quickly turns and runs off. We get a quick close-up of a smiling Katara.</i><br><br><i>A new scene, looking up a stone staircase. Korra practically flies down it and pushes through the gate at the bottom.  Cut to a large polar bear-dog sleeping curled up on its side, its back to the camera. The ground is covered in hay. A modest "dog house" igloo occupies the background. Naga, her tail wagging, stands and walks towards the camera. Cut to Korra hugging Naga and scratching her head. Naga licks her smiling, laughing mistress.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Naga, you should have seen it. I kicked some firebender butt, and I passed! Tenzin will be here in a few days.<br><br><i>(Cut to overhead shot of the training complex. Aside from the training grounds at its center, there are several industrial-looking bits along the walls. The front gate features grand double-doors decorated in a lion-turtle's head. The camera zooms in a tiny figure in the mid-ground. It's Korra atop Naga.</i><br><br><i>Cut to one of the towers beside the front gate. An Order of the White Lotus guard walks up to the edge of his tower. Cut down to Korra, standing in the shadow of the compound's walls, staring up at the guard. Cut back to the guard, who's clearly not keen on Korra's request. Cut back to Korra, now with crossed arms and a tired-looking expression.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Just taking Naga out for a stroll. Don't worry we're not going far.<br><br><i>(Cut back to the guard. Still not looking entirely convinced, he turns around. Cut to a wide shot of Korra before the gate as it opens. Cut to a close-up on Korra's face as the door peels open, the daylight illuminating her eager expression in the shadows. Cut to a backshot of Korra taking Naga through the still-opening gates. The camera follows her through them, out onto a vast polar landscape of icy plains. </i><br><br><i>Cut to a distant shot. In the background, now nothing more than a mere dot on the snowscape, bound Korra and Naga. The compound is little more the even more distant smudge. Yet in the foreground, atop a rocky hillside overlooking the plains below, are two White Lotus members, monitoring the Avatar below...</i><br><br><i>Cut to a sideways shot of Korra, her mount's reins in her hands. The camera pulls back as Naga picks up speed.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Naga go. That a girl. Go! Go! Go!<br><br><i>(Cut to a front-on shot of Korra riding Naga. She looks determined and content.</i><br><br><i>New scene. Another distant overhead shot of the Avatar's training pound, this time in the golden light of the evening. A sky-bison swoops onscreen from behind the camera, jostling it as it passes. The beast flies down toward the compound. Cut to a ground-level shot of Korra and Katara's backs as they stare up into the sky as the sky-bison comes in for a landing. The camera pans up, following their gaze, until it stops as the sky-bison passes overhead. Korra runs onscreen, smiling, and heads toward the sky-bison.</i><br><br><i>Cut to a shot of the sky-bison circling around the compound's main building, finally coming in for a landing. We can see several orange shapes atop the beast, as well as Korra and Master Katara waiting on the ground.)</i><br><br><b>Ikki:</b> Are we there yet? Are we there yet? Are we there yet? It looks like we are there. I know this is very familiar. Are we here yet? Are we here yet? Oh, please say we are here!<br><br><i>(Cut to a front-on shot of the sky-bison, where we see Tenzin's family for the first time. Meelo is gnawing on his father's head. Jinora and Ikki are perches at the edge of the saddle behind their father. To the back right, Pema sits. Tenzin himself, holding the reins, seems exhausted.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Yes, Ikki. As I have been telling you for the last 15 minutes, we are finally here. <br><br><i>(Ikki and Jinora leap out of the saddle, riding air scooters down their sky-bison's tail. Tenzin, with Meelo still clinging to his head, merely walks off the bison.)</i><br><br><b>Ikki:</b> Weee! Hehehe!<br><br><i>(Cut to Tenzin and Katara approaching one another. He raises one hand in a formal greeting as his girls cling to his sides and Meelo pulls at his ears. When he leans forward, a chuckling Katara takes Meelo off him.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Hello, Mother. I can't tell you happy I am to see you. Please, help me.<br><br><i>(Cut to Katara holding Meelo. He squirms and struggles.)</i><br><br><b>Meelo:</b> Unhand me strange woman!<br><br><i>(Cut to Tenzin.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> That's your grandmother, Meelo.<br><br><i>(Meelo hops over his grandmother's head and floats to the ground. Now with a serious expression, he runs off-screen. Katara is wide-eyed for a moment, but then her happy expression reasserts itself.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> It's so good to see all of you.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Jinora standing before Katara. The young girl is clutching her hands together and stooping slightly. She looks eager.)</i><br><br><b>Jinora:</b> Gran Gran, I have been reading all about your old adventures. I've been dying to ask you, what happened to Zuko's mom?<br><br><i>(Cut back to Katara, who begins to speak before Ikki jumps up in front of her, waving her arms.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Well, Jinora, it's an incredible tale...<br><br><i>(Cut to Ikki and Jinora. Ikki is jumping up and down. Jinora's expression cycles from annoyance at the interruption to resignation. Cut to a shot of Katara as Ikki's head bobs up and down in the foreground. Cut to a shot of the entire Tenzin clan. Ikki is still hopping and clapping her hands. Jinora slumps her head, despondent. In the background, a very pregnant Pema is struggling to slide down the sky-bison's tail. Tenzin goes over and helps her.)</i><br><br><b>Ikki:</b> Gran Gran, you look old. How old are you? And why is it so cold in the South Pole? Can we make a campfire and all hudle around it and tell scary stories, and make snowmen? And then can you make the snowmen move with waterbending and chase us? Wouldn't that be fun? Huh, wouldn't it?<br><b>Tenzin:</b> Pema let me help you. Careful now. Careful.<br><b>Pema:</b> Stop doting on me. I'm not helpless, I'm just pregnant.<br><br><i>(Cut to a sideways shot of Tenzin, his wife, and his mother. Pema and Katara hug, then the latter puts a hand on the former's belly.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> The baby's strong. I see another airbender in your future.<br><br><i>(A shot of Katara's hand on Pema's belly. We pan up to Pema's face. Katara's pronouncement causes Pema's expression to change from a pleasant one, to a surprised one, to finally a dismayed one. When Pema begins to voice her own desires, both Katara and Tenzin look surprised at what she says. While Tenzin continues to look rather 'blah' over Pema's words and begins to fiddle with his goatee, Katara just smiles. When Meelo calls from off-screen, an annoyed Pema looks toward the camera.)</i><br><br><b>Pema:</b> All I want is just one child like me. A nice non bender who doesn't blast wind in my face every 5 seconds.<br><br><i>(Cut to the three children playing in snow. Jinora ice skates off-screen, stage left, using her airbending. Ikki is making a snowman. Meelo, covered entirely in snow, whirls around with his airbending, blasting Pema with snow. Cut back to Pema, who shakes off the snow, looking annoyed and with a few more stray hairs. Cutting to a view of all three adults, an exhausted Pema points to Tenzin.)</i><br><br><b>Meelo:</b> Mommy look, I'm a snow bender!<br><b>Pema:</b> Were Tenzin and his siblings this crazy when they were kids?<br><br><i>(Cut to a close-up of Katara.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> Kya and Bumi certainly were, but Tenzin has always been rather serious.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> Mother, please. <br><br><i>(Cut to a close-up of a rather serious looking Tenzin. When he looks past Katara, the camera cuts to a shot of a smiling Korra behind Katara's left shoulder. Cutting back to Tenzin, we see him lightly surprised. With the sunset backing them all, Korra walks over to Tenzin and he puts his hands on her shoulders.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Korra? Look at you. So big and strong. You've grown into quite the young Avatar.<br><b>Korra:</b> Master Tenzin, I'm so glad you're here. I can't wait to get started.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close-up of Tenzin. He turns his head to the side, not able to meet Korra's eyes.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Yes, well... uh...<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of all four. Pema turns to Tenzin to talk, leaving Korra looking confused.)</i><br><br><b>Pema:</b> You're going to have to tell her sooner or later.<br><b>Korra:</b> What? Tell me what?<br><br><i>(Cut to a close-up of Katara, zooming in. She looks disappointed.)</i><br><br><b>Katara:</b> You're not staying are you?<br><br><i>(Tenzin, a hand still on Korra's shoulder, explains. Korra's reaction is one of confusion; this isn't how things are supposed to work.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> I'm afraid not. We're only visiting for the night, then I have to return to Republic City.<br><b>Korra:</b> But, no... you're supposed to move here. You're supposed to teach me. <br><br><i>(Tenzin puts both hands on Korra's shoulders.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> I'm sorry Korra, your airbending training is going to have to wait.<br><br><i>(Fade to black for commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><u><b>Act II</b></u><br><br><i>(We return with a nighttime overhead shot of the training compound. Several structures are illuminated by electric lights. Cut to the inside of some building. It's a dining hall decorated in the Water Tribe fashion. At the center of each table is an open pit spit roast, but there is no meat on any of them tonight, presumably in respect of Tenzin's vegetarianism. Korra, Tenzin, and the three White Lotus masters sit at the room's far table. The rest of the place is deserted.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> So how long until you are ready to teach me airbending? A week? A month? <br><br><i>(Cut to a close-up of Tenzin. Korra, sitting with a bowl of rice before her and some sort of stew off to the side, still looks dismayed. The camera cuts back and forth in their conversation.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> It could be much longer<br><b>Korra:</b> I don't understand. Why are you making me wait?<br><b>Tenzin:</b> I have a responsibility to Republic City. I am one of it's leaders, and the situation there is very unstable right now.<br><b>Korra:</b> But you also have a responsibility to teach me. Believe me I'd be happy to find another airbending master, but you're the only one. We're stuck with each other.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> I wish there were another way.<br><br><i>(Korra perks up.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Wait, there is! If you can't stay here, then i'll go back to Republic City with you. It's perfect!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the Loti trio's leader, sitting across from Korra. He slaps the table, jostling his dinner.)</i><br><br><b>White Lotus Leader:</b> Absolutely not! The city is far too dangerous. Avatar Aang tasked us with keeping you safe while you mastered the four elements.<br><br><i>(Cut back to Korra, leaning on the table, from an over-the-shoulder shot of the Lotus leader.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I get that. But I don't think keeping me locked up in this compound like a prisoner is what he had in mind.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of all three characters, with Tenzin in the center. When the airbender finishes speaking, Korra stands up.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> I know this is difficult to accept, but its not the right time for you to come to the city.<br><b>Korra:</b> Whatever.<br><br><i>(Cut to Tenzin and the trio's leader watching Korra's back as she walks out the nearest door. Cut back to a reaction shot of the two men. The White Lotus leader sighs. Tenzin, eyes closed, bows his head.</i><br><br><i>Cut to an outdoor shot the next morning. Katara, with her back to the camera in the foreground, waves to her family atop their sky-bison.)</i><br><br><b>Ikki:</b> Goodbye, Gran Gran!<br><b>Tenzin:</b> Oogi, yip yip!<br><br><i>(Oogi takes flight. Katara turns toward the camera and watches them fly off. Saddened, she rubs her eyes. Cut to a shot of Korra stop Naga at the edge of a precipice. As she watches the sky-bison flyby, Naga whines. Cut to a shot of Korra's back. We see now that she's looking out at a cloudy seascape. Again, the White Lotus is monitoring her from a distance. </i><br><br><i>Cut to a close-up on Korra's face. It's a bit later now; the gloamin, when the sun has set but the world still holds a bit of light in the deep purple of twilight's end. The junk has docked on a pier with electric floor lights. Also docked is a steamer ship, smaller and functional-looking rather than the gilded titanic steamer Korra stowed-away on earlier in the episode. Cut to three White Lotus men stand on the dock; behind them their steamer ship has lowered a gangplank. Cut to Korra looking at them. She's anxious, but sighs in acceptance. Cut to an overhead shot of them all as Korra, a tiny figure now, begins walking towards the White Lotus. Suddenly two gliders cut into shot. Cut to a shot of the gliders landing: Ikki first, then Jinora with Meelo riding piggyback. They collapse their gliders and rush over to Korra. Ikki and Meelo immediately hug her legs. Jinora holds back for a moment, then joins her siblings.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin's Kids:</b> Korra!<br><br><i>(Cut to a close-up on Ikki. She's excited. Cut to a view of the girls' backs. Korra, with a hand on each of their shoulders, kneels down.)</i><br><br><b>Ikki:</b> Are you coming to live with us on the island?<br><b>Korra:</b> No, I'm sorry Ikki. I have to go home now.<br><b>Ikki:</b> <i>(disappointed)</i> Oh...<br><br><i>(Cut to Tenzin. His expression shifts almost imperceptibly at his eyes; sadness, maybe. Cut to a rear shot of Tenzin and his children as they watch Korra go to meet the White Lotus. Cut to a shot of a sad Korra walking alongside Naga, one hand on her for support. When Tenzin speaks, Korra is shocked for a second before recomposing herself. She turned back toward Tenzin. He walks over to her. Cut to a shot of Tenzin and Korra's back. He puts a hand on her shoulder, and her expression is surprised. Then Korra's jaw drops from joy. </i><br><br><i>Cut to a side shot of both of them and Tenzin's children. As they cheer, Korra effortlessly scoops them and Tenzin up in her arms and lifts them into the air. Naga comes over and rubs her head against Korra's back. Cut to a close-up on Tenzin. He sighs, uncomfortable but patient.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Wait. I have done my best to guide Republic City towards the dream my father had for it, but you are right. It has fallen out of balance since he passed. I thought I should put off your training in order to uphold his legacy, but you are his legacy. You may stay and train airbending here with me. Republic City needs its Avatar once again.<br><b>Korra:</b> Yes! Thank you! You're the best!<br><b>Tenzin's Kids:</b> Yay!!<br><br><i>(New scene. A daytime exterior shot of City Hall, with a large cheering crowd in front of it. Cut to a shot of the crowd where photographers hold up old-style flash bulbs as they snap shots. Cut to a shot of an anxious Korra at a podium outfitted with five microphones. Cut to a shot from Korra's back of the crowd before her. Cut to several fast shots of reporters asking her questions.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Hello, I'm Korra, your new Avatar. <br><b>News Reporter 1:</b> Does this mean you've moved to Republic City?<br><b>News Reporter 2:</b> Were you trying to send a message to the Triads yesterday?<br><b>News Reporter 3:</b> Will you be fighting crime or the anti bending revolution or both?<br><b>News Reporter 4:</b> Will you be working with Chief Beifong and the police?<br><br><i>(Cutting back to Korra, she's struggling to say something coherent. Then she gathers herself and begins to talk more comfortably. Cut to a wide shot of Korra on the steps of City Hall as the reporters snap more photos. At her right is Tenzin. At her left are Naga and Chief Beifong.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Uh, yes, I am definitely here to stay, but honestly, I don't exactly have a plan yet. See I'm still in training... but... look, all I know is Avatar Aang meant for this city to be the center of peace and balance in the world, and I believe we can make his dream a reality. I look forward to serving you! I am so happy to be here. Thank you Republic City!<br><br><i>(Cut to a radio tuned to Korra's press conference. An Equalist sits behind the radio, chin resting on folded hands as he listens. There are footsteps and a hand reaches over to turn off the radio. The camera follows the hand back up to its owner, the Lieutenant.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(voice-over, through the radio)</i> Alright, that's all the questions the Av--<br><b>Lieutenant:</b> Amon, how do you want to handle this?<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of both the Lieutenant and Amon's backs. The camera reveals that we're seeing a basemen of some sort, with wires coming in through the wooden ceiling. Amon is standing in front of a map of Republic City, his hands clasped behind his back. Cut to close-up on Amon's hooded head. He half-turns to face the camera, his face masked.)</i><br><br><b>Amon:</b> So, the Avatar has arrived early. It looks like we'll have to accelerate our plans.<br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

Fire. Air. Water. <i>(Each of the latest four Avatars --Kyoshi, Roku, Aang, and Korra-- demonstrate the bending of their native element in front of the corresponding symbol.)</i> Only the Avatar can master all four elements and bring balance to the world. <i>(Aang's statue is visible in the Republic City's bay before the camera pans to show Korra standing in line with it.)</i><br><br><br><br><i>[Previously on "The Legend of Korra" sequence, including clips from "Welcome to Republic City".]</i> <br><br><b>Radio Broadcaster:</b> Republic City welcomes a new citizen into our arms, Avatar Korra! After years of seclusion in the South, this master of water, earth, and fire seeks to add airbending to her list of skills. And under the tutelage of Tenzin, Avatar Aang's son, she should go far. But will this cool, calm, collected master of air be able to tame this hot headed teen?<br><br><br><br><u><b>Act I</b></u><br><br><i>(It is morning over Republic City's bay. The camera pans down to show a Sky Bison descending past Air Temple Island's tower. Korra's voice starts as the scene shifts to show her reading a newspaper inside.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(excited)</i> -and in the final round, the Buzzard Wasps won with a decisive knockout. <i>(lowers the paper and looks across her table to Tenzin)</i> What do you say we go to the arena tonight, catch a few pro-bending matches?<br><br><i>(The camera shifts to a wider view, showing that Korra and Tenzin are seated together at one of several tables in a communal dining area. Air Acolytes of both genders are dressed in red and yellow robes, eating and drinking together.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> That sport is a mockery of the noble tradition of bending.<br><b>Korra:</b> Come on Tenzin. I've dreamed about seeing a pro-bending match since I was a kid, and now I'm just a ferry ride away from the arena. <i>(motions out the window behind her to the golden Pro-bending Arena across the bay)</i><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Korra, you're not here to watch that drivel, you're here to finish your Avatar training. So for the time being I want you to remain on the island.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(slumped, leaning her head on her hand with a dejected expression)</i> Is that why you're keeping the White Lotus sentries around, to watch my every move?<br><br><i>(The view pans out further to show one White Lotus sentry standing guard at a door in the background, while two more flank the camera's view in the foreground.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Yes. In order to learn Airbending I believe you require a calm, quiet environment, free from any distractions.<br><b>Korra:</b> Alright, you're the master.<br><br><i>(Korra turns around to look out of the window, a reluctant look on her face. The camera follows her gaze, zooming in on the standout edifice of the Pro-bending Arena.<br><br>The scene changes to an exterior covered pathway on Air Temple Island. Tenzin and Korra are walking along, while a lemur flies by them. Korra is wearing a classic Airbender outfit, but she has the sleeves rolled up to completely expose her arms.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> So, my mother informed me that you've never been able to Airbend before.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(stops abruptly and sighs, before motioning dramatically)</i> Yeah, but I don't know why, the other elements came so easily to me. But every single time I've tried Airbending... <i>(Korra sticks her tongue out and blows a raspberry, then puts a hand on her hip.)</i> Nothing.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(puts a hand on Korra's shoulder)</i> It's perfectly alright, we just need to be patient. <i>(starts casually pulling Korra's sleeves back down to their proper length)</i> Often the element that's most difficult for the Avatar to master is the one most opposite to the Avatar's personality. For Aang it was Earthbending.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(dejected)</i> Yeah, well, I'm about as opposite an Airbender as you can get.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(starting down the path again)</i> Let's begin your first lesson.<br><br><i>(The pair ascends a set of stone steps to arrive at the Airbending training area, where Ikki, Jinora, and Meelo are waiting in front of the stilled Airbending Gates. The gates are a cluster of large wooden panels- all decorated identically with the Airbending symbol- mounted on poles so that they stand straight up. Meelo is waving happily while Ikki is jumping excitedly with clasped hands. Jinora is simply standing at attention with her hands behind her back.)</i><br><br><b>Ikki:</b> Korra's gonna Airbend, Korra's gonna Airbend!<br><b>Korra:</b> What is that contraption?<br><b>Tenzin:</b> A time honored tool that teaches the most fundamental aspect of Airbending. Jinora, would you like to explain this exercise? <br><b>Jinora:</b> <i>(steps towards the Airbending Gates)</i> The goal is to weave your way through the gates and make it to the other side without touching them.<br><br><i>(The view pans across the wooden panels)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(smiles)</i> Seems easy enough.<br><b>Ikki:</b> <i>(speaking quickly)</i> Jinora forgot to say you have to make it through while the gates are spinning.<br><br><i>(Tenzin steps forward, and circles his bent arms in front of his body. The Air responds to his motions, and when he suddenly pushes his open palms forward, a large gust of wind erupts towards the Airbending Gates, setting them all spinning rapidly. The camera closes in on the many spinning panels, then returns to Tenzin, who now has a small green leaf in his hand. He holds it up towards the gates, and lets it go to ride the wind. As he speaks his lesson, the leaf is carried right into the twirling gates, but passes through without touching any of them.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> <I>(voice over)</I> The key is to be like the leaf. Flow with the movement of the gates. Jinora will demonstrate. <i>(As Tenzin continues the lesson, Jinora nimbly enters the Gates. She moves between the spinning panels in a circle-walking style, spinning and turning as needed to easily avoid every panel. With each step, she cycles which of her palms is held out in front of her.)</i> Airbending is all about spiral movements. When you meet resistance, you must be able to switch direction at a moments notice.<br><br><i>(Once she has emerged from the Gates, Jinora turns around, and thrusts out another gust of powerful Airbending, powering the spinning panels back to full speed.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Let's do this.<br><br><i>(Korra eagerly runs forward, but without any discernable stance or style. She runs headfirst into the closest panel, and hits it hard enough to ricochet into the next panel beside her. Tenzin winces, and Korra gives in to panic and breaks out into a full sprint that once again crashes into a Gate. She proceeds to do an impressive impersonation of a pinball in a machine as she stumbles out of control into a series of panels. She finally gets tossed out of the gate area completely and lands hard on her backside.<br><br>The camera shifts to show everyone looking at her. Tenzin's face gives nothing away, but Meelo is smiling and Ikki has a look of horror about her. With a groan, she gets back to her feet in the foreground, and with an angry look, runs back towards the Gates. She barely gets by the first pair of panels before she is again caught by one and sent careening around.)</i><br><br><b>Jinora:</b> <i>(shouting through cupped hands)</i> Don't force your way through!<br><br><i>(Korra gets hit by another panel.)</i><br><br><b>Ikki:</b> <i>(clenching her fists and motioning expansively)</i> Dance, dance like the wind!<br><br><i>(Korra gets hit by another panel.)</i><br><br><b>Meelo:</b> <i>(waving his arms with an undulating motion)</i> Be the leaf!<br><br><i>(Korra gets hit by another panel. She ricochets around a few more times, before stumbling back out of the Gate area. There are dark circles around her eyes, and she has a punch-drunk expression on her face. She collapses flat on her back in front of Tenzin and the kids. Tenzin gives a heavy sigh and shakes his head.<br><br>The scene shifts to a nighttime view of the whole Air Temple Island. Even in the low light, flying Sky Bison are visible in the air above the island. A cut reveals Korra practicing aggressive Airbending motions just outside the main Temple buildings.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Airbend. <i>(The view zooms out, to reveal that not only did the move have no effect, but her target is a newspaper strung up on a line so that a picture of Chief Lin Bei Fong is prominently displayed.)</i> What is wrong with me? Airbend. <i>(Korra tries again, and the view shifts to a close-up of a bored Naga. When the view returns to Korra, her eyes are wide and she is shaking with frustration. Finally, she punches a fireball at the newspaper and incinerates it.)</i> Ugh, maybe I'm just not cut out to be an Airbender, huh, Naga?<br><br><i>(Suddenly, the sound of a radio announcer carries through the night air, catching Korra's attention. She looks around and finds a lit-up guard shack a short distance behind her.)</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> Ladies and gentlemen I'm coming to you live from Republic City's pro-bending arena, where tonight the best in the world continue their quest for a spot in the upcoming championship tournament.<br><br><i>(The scene cuts to a close up of the radio in question, within the guard shack. The view changes to show three White Lotus sentries clustered around the radio, then pans upward to reveal Korra crouched on the shack's roof, settling in eagerly.)</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> Grab your snacks, and grab your kids, because this next match is gonna be a doozy.<br><br><i>(The scene fades into a time jump, revealing that Korra is still listening as she gazes with relaxation at the distant Republic City.)</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> This Mako's got moxy. He advances, fires two quick shots, <i>(cut to shot of the White Lotus sentries leaning with smiles over the radio)</i> Yomo is hammered back to zone three. <i>(cut to shot of Korra leaning with an identical expression)</i> The clock is winding down, can Yomo hold on? <i>(cut back to the guards, who are pressed closer together with wide eyes)</i> He's teetering on the edge of the ring now. <i>(cut back to Korra with a wide grin and clenched fists)</i> The Fire Ferrets line up to strike--<br><br><i>(The view briefly shows the radio's lit dial, but it goes dark as the announcer abruptly cuts off. Korra's expression falls and her irises shrink with disappointment. Back in the guard shack, the surprised White Lotus sentries turn around to find Tenzin standing behind them with the radio's unplugged power cord in his hand.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Korra, come down here, please.<br><br><i>(Korra peaks down from over the roof's awning. The White Lotus sentries finally notice her, and leap back with surprise as she flips herself down to the ground.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(frustrated)</i> You shut it off at the best part!<br><b>Tenzin:</b> I thought I made myself clear, I don't want you listening to this distracting nonsense.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(walking to Tenzin but motioning at the White Lotus sentries)</i> But it's their radio, and technically you said I couldn't watch a match, you didn't say anything about listening to one.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> You... <i>(growls)</i> You know what I meant. Anyway, shouldn't you... shouldn't you be in bed by now?<br><br><i>(Tenzin abruptly turns around, sending a wind through the shack as he snaps his cape in place.<br><br>The scene cuts to the morning. The camera shows the rocks at the base of Air Temple as Sky Bison fly by, and pans up to the Meditation Pavilion. In the gazebo on the edge of the cliff, Tenzin is crouched with eyes closed in a meditative position. Opposite him, Jinora, Ikki, Meelo, and Korra are seated in similar manners. Korra reaches around to scratch her backside. She goes back to meditating, but soon starts sniffling. After another moment, she peaks a look at the Airbender children beside her. Finally, she gets back to a whole full second of meditating before slumping forward and opening her eyes.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I think I'm doing it wrong.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(close up view, opening his eyes)</i> There's nothing to do. Let your mind and your spirit be free, for air is the element of freedom.<br><br><i>(Korra gives a sarcastic, thigh-slapping burst of laugher.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b>Is something funny?<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(crossly)</i> Yeah, you're telling me to embrace freedom but you won't even let me listen to the radio. And forget about leaving this island.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> Please, Korra. Look at Meelo, he is able to meditate peacefully.<br><br><i>(Korra looks next to her at Meelo, and a close-up reveals that his head is slumped, he's breathing heavily to inflate a bubble of snot out a nostril, and drool is leaking out of his open mouth.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Actually I think he's asleep.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> What? <i>(leans forward to look at Meelo)</i> Well at least he has the relaxing part down.<br><b>Korra:</b> Whatever. None of this Airbending stuff makes any sense to me.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> I know you're frustrated but these teachings will sink in over time. Then one day they'll just click.<br><br><i>(Korra takes a deep breath and goes back to meditating. She lasts three seconds before sighing and slumping forward.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Yeah, it's not sinking in yet. <i>(stands up and walks away)</i> I'm gonna go get a glass of lychee juice.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(sternly)</i> Korra, the meditations not over yet.<br><b>Ikki:</b> Daddy, can I have some lychee justice too? <i>(smiles and clasps her hands endearingly)</i><br><b>Tenzin:</b> No.<br><br><i>(Ikki pouts, Jinora sneaks a look out of one eye, and Meelo begins tottering in place.)</i><br><br><b>Meelo:</b> Ohhhhh.<br><br><i>(Meelo falls backward to sprawl across the ground, still asleep.)</i><br><br><i>(The scene cuts to night. White Lotus sentries are on station around the Air Temple. Korra peaks out of a second-story window, and drops to the ground once she ascertains that none of the guards will see her. She dashes for a nearby cliff, and keeps going straight over the edge. As she falls towards the bay, she sweeps her arms upward in a Waterbending motion. The bay water rises in a funnel to catch and ease her below the surface. Korra transitions into an undulating swim that quickly carries her towards Republic City. The camera pans up to reveal her target, the golden Pro-bending Arena. Floodlights arc through the sky as the camera zooms in rapidly.<br><br>Fade to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><u><b>Act II</b></u><br><br><i>(The scene starts with another look at Air Temple Island, and pans over to the Pro-bending Arena. The building rests on a wooden pier out in the bay, connected to the rest of Republic City by a long boardwalk path. Korra emerges from the waters right next to the Arena, and looks up at a series of tall windows on the building's upper stories. One of the windows is open, and Korra smiles with satisfaction. She spins in the water, creating a spiraling Waterbending funnel that shoots her straight through the window to land lightly on her feet. Shaking herself dry, she sets off down the hallway.<br><br>Korra stops when she finds an open doorway into a large gym. Among the equipment are punching bags, dumbbell weights, nets, pommel horses, and earth disks. Korra smiles and enters the gym without hesitation, looking around at everything. She is surprised by a voice from behind.)</i><br><br><b>Toza:</b> Hey! What are you doing in my gym? <i>(The camera shifts to reveal Toza. He is wearing a towel around his neck.)</i><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(friendly)</i> Uh, I was just looking for a bathroom and I got lost.<br><br><i>(As Korra and Toza converse in the foreground, a Pro-bender all done up in his uniform and pads walks by in the background. He catches sight of Korra, and comes to an interested stop.)</i><br><br><b>Toza:</b> <i>(pointing)</i> Ah, the old I had to pee excuse. <i>(The background Pro-bender, still unnoticed, runs a smoothing hand through his hair.)</i> You know, I'm sick and tired of you kids sneaking in and not paying. I'm taking you in to security.<br><br><i>(The background Pro-bender enters the gym and approaches the arguing pair with a smile. As he comes into focus, the face of Bolin is revealed.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(panicked)</i> No, wait!<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(waving to Korra)</i> There you are! I've been looking everywhere for you. It's all right, Toza, she's with me.<br><b>Korra:</b> Yeah, I'm with him.<br><b>Bolin:</b> So, you see, we're together.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(worried)</i> Well, not together together. More like friends.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(surprised and blushing with chagrin)</i> Right, friends. No, no, I didn't mean to imply-<br><b>Korra:</b> Oh, you implied it.<br><b>Toza:</b> <i>(throwing his hands up with exasperation)</i> Ah, I don't care what you are. I've got work to do. <i>(walks a short distance away and throws his towel to the floor. Korra's eyes follow him as he uses his Bending to lift and throw a special dumbbell with spherical canisters on each end instead of weights.)</i><br><b>Bolin:</b> Right this way, miss.<br><b>Korra:</b> And thank you sir. <i>(whispering and covering the side of her mouth conspiratorially)</i> Seriously, thanks.<br><br><i>(Bolin leads Korra out of view. The scene shifts to their arrival in another room. Korra looks around curiously.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> What do you think? Best seats in the house, huh?<br><br><i>(The camera zooms out to reveal that they're in a Pro-bender locker room, situated even with the main playing field and open on one side to offer a great view.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Whoa! Unbelievable! This place is even more amazing than I imagined.<br><br><i>(In the background, Mako and Hasook enter the room in their Pro-bending uniforms.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Name's Bolin by the way.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(distracted and looking around)</i> Korra.<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(whispering)</i> Psst, Bolin.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(going over to Mako)</i> Yeah?<br><b>Mako:</b> I told you. <i>(putting on a pair of padded gloves)</i> You have to stop bringing in your crazy fangirls in here before the matches. Get her out of here.<br><b>Bolin:</b> Ah, come on Mako. All right, look, I kinda promised her she could stay. But man I've got a good feeling there's something special about her. I know it.<br><br><i>(Bolin goes back to Korra, and guides her to over to face Mako.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b>Come here, I want you to meet my brother, Mako.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(smiling, impressed)</i> Mako? Wow, I heard you play on the radio. <i>(Korra holds out her hand to shake, but Mako walks right by her, putting his helmet on.)</i><br><b>Mako:</b> Come on, Bolin, we're up.<br><b>Korra:</b> Or I could meet him later.<br><b>Bolin:</b> Yeah, sorry about that, my brother just gets real... focused before the match. Okay, I've gotta go. Wish me luck. Not that I'll need it.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(laughs)</i> Good luck. Knock em' out.<br><br><i>(Korra offers a punching salute as the three Pro-benders emerge out into he arena. The view switches to an overhead view of the arena, and the lights all shut off expect for the spotlights shining down on the playing field itself. The porch is lit up, but the White Lotus sentries are all seated at a table outside under the night sky, listening to a radio positioned at the center.)</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> <i>(from radio)</i> Did I see that right? Hold on folks, we're just waiting for the referees official call, but I think this replacement player could be-<br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(walking up to the guards from behind)</i> Pardon me everyone-<br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> <i>(from radio)</i> No, there's no way.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> -have you seen Korra this evening? She's not in her room.<br><br><i>(One of the guards starts taking a long drink from a cup)</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> <i>(from radio)</i> You've gotta be kidding me, she's the Avatar folks, playing in a Pro-bending match. <i>(The drinking guards abruptly spits out her mouthful all over one of her comrades.)</i> Can you believe that?<br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(face reddening, eye twitching)</i> I'll get her myself!<br><br><i>(Tenzin turns around and stalks off with a swish of his cape and a trailing wind.<br><br>The scene cuts back to the Pro-bending Arena, where the referee steps forward to speak to the player and crowd.)</i><br><br><b>Pro-bending Referee:</b> <i>(raises hand)</i> The Avatar will be permitted to continue, so long as she solely bends water.<br><br><i>(The crowd cheers.)</i><br><br><b>Platypus Bears:</b> <i>(upset and gesturing)</i> Ohh, aww!<br><br><i>(The view cuts to the two teams all lined up for the latest round. The bell rings, and they once more go into action. The camera pans across the three Platypus Bears, who each launch an elemental attack as the camera focuses on them.)</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> This girl may be the Avatar, but she's no Pro-bender, and the Platypus Bears are intent on exploiting that weakness. <i>(The view follows Korra as she dodges and blocks another series of attacks, but this time she just sticks to water.)</i> Theyre giving her their best, and her best ain't good enough to stop it. <i>(Korra tries to block a fireball, but it pushes her back and off balance. An earth disk hits her immediately after, leaving her open for a line of water that upper-cuts back. Two buzzers sound as she passes into zones two and three.)</i> Annnd she's in the drink.<br><br><i>(Korra goes right over the back of the field and into the pool. The view follows her as she swims underwater to a platform where she can pull herself out of the artificial lake. She just gets hold of the edge of the platform and leans onto it when a shadow falls over her, surprising her. The camera turns around and pans up to reveal Tenzin.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(nervous)</i> Oh, hey Tenzin. I thought you didn't like coming to these matches, ha ha. <i>(climbs fully out of the pool and onto the platform)</i><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Once again you have flagrantly disobeyed my orders. You were to stay on the island. Let's go. <i>(turns around to lead Korra away)</i><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(clenching fists)</i> No, I'm kind of in the middle of something.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> I have tried my very best to get through to you by being gentle and patient, <i>(angry)</i> but clearly the only thing you respond to is force! So I am ordering you to come back to the temple, right now!<br><b>Korra:</b> <I>(also angry)</I> Why, so I can sit around and meditate at how bad I am at Airbending? You know, I'm beginning to think there is a reason I haven't been able to learn it. Because maybe I don't even need it!<br><b>Tenzin:</b> What? That is a ludicrous suggestion! The Avatar needs to learn Airbending; it is not optional!<br><b>Korra:</b> No, this <i>(motions back towards the playing field, while the sounds of Pro-bending are audible)</i> is what I need to learn: modern styles of fighting.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> Being the Avatar isn't all about fighting, Korra. When will you learn that?<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(turns around)</i> I have a match to go finish. <i>(Korra walks to the elevator that will take her back up to the playing field.)</i><br><b>Ring Announcer:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> The Platypus Bears win round two! <i>(The scene cuts back to the playing field, where Korra is ready to go with her teammates. The two teams are lined up and the bells rings.)</i> Round three!<br><br><i>(The Platypus Bear Waterbender fires off a pair of attacks. The view cuts over to Bolin, who throws an earth disk and then takes one of the water blasts with crossed arms. He's pushed back, but stays steady. He comes to a stop near Mako, who is throwing and blocking attacks.)</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> The Platypus Bears come out of the gate and quickly go after the Ferret brothers. <i>(Mako and Bolin are pushed up against the ropes at the edge of the field. They alternate trying to throw attacks between blocking, but they start getting hit too often to do anything but hunker down. They get hit by several strong streams of water, but stay on their feet.)</i> Theyre corralled in the corner, wedged in the edge of zone one, unable to come to the Avatar's rescue. <i>(The Platypus Bears' Firebender and Earthbender throw attacks at Korra. She dodges and blocks them with water whips, while Mako and Bolin take another strong hit of water.)</i> And boy does she need it. <i>(The view cuts to Tenzin, who is walking through the audience stands towards an exit. The crowd cheers, and Tenzin turns around in the exit tunnel to look at the ring. He sees Korra get hit and knocked back a zone by a strong blast of water, and he takes on a worried expression.)</i> Looks like the Avatar's Pro-bending debut is going to be cut short. <i>(Korra dodges a fireball and actually catches an earth disk in her hands that she throws away, but she is still pushed back. Tenzin sighs and face-palms.)</i> She's been pushed back to zone three, and the water is calling her name. <i>(Korra skids so that her feet are right up against the back edge of zone three. She teeters on the edge, ducking under an earth disk but nearly falling. She grits her teeth with determination, and steps back into the center of zone three.)</i> It's only a matter of time before- <i>(Korra starts circle-walking right in zone three, enabling her to easily step around the Platypus Bears' attacks. Her form is perfect, cycling her hands so that they alternate positions, and stepping easily to change direction instantly.)</i> Hold the phone, stop the presses, she's still in the game folks, and she's moving like an entirely different player. All of a sudden the Platypus Bears strikes are only striking air.<br><br><i>(The Platypus Bears focus exclusively on Korra, throwing attack after attack, but none of them so much as touch her, and she continues to calmly step around every disk, fireball, and water-stream. The view shifts and zooms in on Tenzin.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(quietly, stunned)</i> How about that.<br><br><i>(The view cuts back to the field, where a close up of the Platypus Bears shows them panting with exertion. They try to continue their barrage, but their movements are slow and lethargic, and the pace of their attacks has lessened considerably.)</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> The Platypus Bears have no juice left, <i>(The view cuts to other side of the field, where Mako and Bolin are still hunkered down with their arms crossed over their faces defensively. The latest stream of water doesn't even reach them, slowing midair and splashing to  the floor.)</i> but Mako and Bolin are still fresh and juicy. <i>(Bolin is surprised, but Mako immediately goes into action by jump-kicking out a wave of fire. He lands and pins the middle Platypus Bear with a series of weak attacks, and Bolin quickly joins him and throws an earth disk. The other team is pushed back, and the Waterbender is even knocked off his feet. Korra makes a spinning jump that catches an incoming stream of water and throws it right back. Mako throws three Fire attacks at his opposite number and knocks him out the back of the field. The Earthbender Platypus Bear gets hit by an Earth disk, and a water attack knocks him to zone two, then a fire attack keeps him tumbling straight over the edge. The Firebender takes a water hit and keeps his feet, but a second stream uppercuts him into the air and over the back edge. The camera watches from below as he falls into the pool. The bell rings, signaling the end of the round.)</i><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> Knockout.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(excited, pointing dramatically with both hands at the playing field)</i> Woohoo! <i>(looks around, realizes what he's doing, and quickly stands straight and adjusts his cloak before walking out of the arena)</i><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> <i>(voice over)</i> The Fire Ferrets come from way behind and steal the win! What an upset folks! <i>(The camera zooms out over the entire arena interior, then cuts to the score-keeping bulbs. They remaining bulbs light up red.)</i> The rookies, Avatar and tow, have nabbed a place in the championship tournament. I can not believe it!<br><br><i>(Korra looks around with joy, then the view cuts to Bolin, who is making exaggerated 'I can't hear you!' gestures at the crowd with his other hand on his hip. Korra walks over, and they laugh and high-five.)</i><br><br><b>Korra & Bolin:</b> Ah, ha, ha, yes!<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(walking over)</i> Korra, what can I say? You really came alive in that last round. The way you dodged their attacks, you are a natural. <i>(smiles)</i><br><br><i>(Bolin is waving to the audience in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Thanks, but I can't take all the credit. <i>(smiles wryly as her eyes shift to the side)</i> Someone else taught me those moves.<br><br><i>(The scene changes to Air Temple Island. A half-moon is lighting up the night sky. The windows on the main temple and tower are lit. The camera pans over to the Airbending Gates. The restored panels are being re-installed on their spinners by Air Acolytes while Tenzin watches. Korra walks up to him from behind.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b>I'm really sorry, about everything I said. <i>(puts a hand to her chest)</i> I was really frustrated with myself and I took it out on you. <i>(motions to Tenzin)</i><br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(turns around to fully face Korra)</i> I think I owe you an apology too. I was trying to teach you about patience but I lost mine.<br><b>Korra:</b> No hard feelings?<br><b>Tenzin:</b> Of course not. By the way you were really good out there tonight. <i>(points at Korra, and waves his finger playfully)</i> You moved just like an Airbender. <br><b>Korra:</b> Wait, <i>(leans forward)</i> you stayed and watched?<br><b>Tenzin:</b> I did. Pro-bending turned out to be the perfect teaching tool for you.<br><br><i>(Korra smiles, and Tenzin returns it.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(jogs away and waves)</i> I'll see you tomorrow for Airbending practice, bright and early. <i>(turns around as she jogs)</i> And, by the way, I kind of permanently joined the Fire Ferrets and we're playing in the tournament in a couple of weeks.<br><br><i>(Korra runs down the stairs and out of sight.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(wide-eyed, sighs)</i> Ugh.<br><br><i>(The view fades to an exterior shot of the Pro-bending Arena's tower. The golden facade still glows in the night, but one of the tall rectangular windows is open to a darkened interior. Mako is sitting at the window, looking out at the camera. The view zooms in on him, sitting quietly, then cuts to show that his line of sight corresponds to Air Temple Island.<br><br>The view cuts over to Korra's room. She is seen from the back, leaning out of a hexagonal window with her head resting on one of her hands. She is looking out at the glowing Pro-bending Arena. A cut to Korra's face reveals she is smiling with shining eyes.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

With her new teammates, Mako and Bolin, the Fire Ferrets earn a place in the championship tournament. But meanwhile and anti-bender revolution brews in Republic City. Who are the Equalists and what nefarious plan does the mysterious man behind the mask have in store for our hero? <br><br><br><br><u><b>Act I</b></u><br><br><i>(The story opens with a zooming shot of the Probending Arena in the day. The scene jumps within to the training room. The Fire Ferrets are all wearing Probending pads.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(catching a medicine ball)</i> What's the big idea with making me train this early in the morning? The morning is evil.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(catching the ball from Korra)</i> We're the rookies so we get the worst time slot in the gym.<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(catching the ball from Bolin)</i> And you're the rookiest of us all. We gotta get you up to speed if you want to survive in the tournament. Deal with it!<br><br><i>(Mako tosses the ball hard to Korra, who winces as she catches it and becomes annoyed.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> You deal with it!<br><br><i>(Korra tosses the ball back to Mako, who catches it, but he's knocked completely off his feet to land skidding on his back.<br><br>The camera shifts to show a satisfied Korra with her arms crossed, then pans over to the room's entrance, where Butakha is coming in.)</i><br><br><b>Butakha:</b> There are my little hard working street urchins. <i>(He walks over to the Korra and Bolin. Pabu is perched on Bolin's shoulder.)</i> It's an honor to finally meet you, Avatar. <i>(He puts a hand on Korra's shoulder as Mako joins the group.)</i><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(skeptical)</i> And you are...<br><b>Butakha:</b> <i>(sweeping his hat off his head in a showman's manner)</i> Butakha! I run this whole Probending shebang. <i>(Butahka replaces his hat and reaches into his coat for a stack of Republic City yuans. Korra walks away with an uninterested slump.)</i> Here's your winnings from last match. <i>(Butakha hands a grinning Mako the bills, but interrupts and wags a finger as Mako tries to take the money. As he continues to speak, Butakha continues to take back yuans off the top of the pile.)</i> Ah-ah! Not so fast. First, you owe me for the Avatar's new gear, ha, gym and equipment rentals for last month. Ah-ah! Rent on your apartment, and a personal loan for groceries.<br><br><i>(Mako turns an angry pout on Bolin, who shrugs in response.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> What? I'm a growing boy! <i>(rubbing stomach)</i><br><b>Butakha:</b> Oh! And one more small item of business. The Fire Ferrets need to ante up thirty thousand yuans for the Championship pot.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(leans forward and his eyes grow wide)</i> Thirty thousand yuans!?<br><b>Butakha:</b> Sorry, kids. You've got till the end of the week to come up with the dough, or else, you're out of the tournament.<br><br><i>(He pats Mako on the shoulder, then walks away. Korra approaches Mako and Bolin again.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> You wouldn't happen to have a secret Avatar bank account, over-flowing with gold, would you?<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(turns her pockets inside out to show that they're empty)</i> I got nothing. I've never really needed money. I've always had people taking care of me.<br><b>Mako:</b> Then I wouldn't say you have nothing. <i>(He picks up the medicine ball, and packs it into an equipment bag.)</i><br><b>Korra:</b> Sorry, I didn't mean...<br><b>Bolin:</b> No, it's alright. It's just... ever since we lost our parents, we've been on our own.<br><b>Korra:</b> I'm so sorry. I didn't know.<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(zips the bag and throws it over his shoulder)</i> So anyway, how are we going to come up with the money?<br><b>Bolin:</b> Oh! Oh! I got it! <i>(He kneels down and holds Pabu upright against the camera. The ferret's arms droop cutely as Bolin swings him back and forth between Korra and Mako.)</i> I've been training Pabu to do circus tricks. Now people would pay good money to see that.<br><b>Mako:</b> Come on, Bolin. We need serious ideas.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(quietly, lowering his gaze and bringing Pabu back in close to his body)</i> I was serious.<br><b>Mako:</b> Don't worry about it. I'll figure something out. I always do.<br><br><i>(Mako leaves as the other two watch him. The camera zooms in on Bolin's face, and he takes on a serious, determined expression.<br><br>The scene changes to Central City Station. The front of the station itself is in the background as the camera pans down over a very large statue of a young Zuko. The statue has one arm raised up, in which a real flame burns. Bolin is revealed to be sitting right in front of the statue, and when the camera shifts closer, it's clear that he's wearing circus-styling over his normal clothes, and has a ridiculously large handle-bar mustache on his face.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(gesturing dramatically)</i> Come one, come all! Come see Pabu, the Fantastic Fire Ferret as he crosses the ladder of peril! Gasp! Upside down. <i>(Pabu is standing on a cup next to a wooden plank suspended between two more cups. The ferret is grooming itself and misses Bolin's cue.)</i> Psst. <i>(Pabu leaps from the cup onto the plank and lands in a handstand. It walks easily across on just its front paws. Bolin coaches the ferret quietly but with excitement, gesturing for it to leap off at the end of the plank.)</i> Big finish, buddy. Stick the landing. <i>(Pabu jumps off the plank onto the sidewalk, landing on its right front paw and posing.)</i> Ta da! <i>(Several people walk by. The first one throws a single coin in the tin cup that Pabu started on, but the others ignore the scene.)</i> Thank you ladies and gentlemen! You are too kind. Seriously, too kind. You can come back here and put money in this, <i>(Bolin picks up the cup, and his faces droops as he shakes the single coin inside.)</i> Okay that's fine. That's fine. One yuan down, twenty-nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine to go.<br><br><i>(A red speedster Satomobile pulls up in front of Bolin. The window rolls down to reveal a man in a fancy blue jacket, Shady Shin.)</i><br><br><b>Shady Shin:</b> Hey, Bolin. Is that you?<br><b>Bolin:</b> Oh, hey there, Shady Shin.<br><b>Shin:</b> <i>(Gets out of the car and approaches Bolin.)</i> Heard you're a big time pro-bending player now. Not bad.<br><b>Bolin:</b> Uh, thanks.<br><b>Shin:</b> So listen, I've got an offer for you. Lightening Bolt Zolt is looking to hire some extra muscle.<br><b>Bolin:</b> Uh, I don't know, Shin. Mako told me to stay away from the Triple Threats.<br><b>Shin:</b> Pft, your brother ain't the boss o'you. It's just a little security work. Nothin' crooked.<br><br><i>(Shin reaches into his jacket and pulls out a stack of yuans, which he throws into Bolin's cup.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(wacky face)</i> Gasp!<br><b>Shin:</b> You game?<br><br><i>(The scene cuts to an industrial setting, where a man in a protective apron and mask is bending lightning into a large mechanical battery receiver. The camera shifts to show a line of such people, each finishing and immediately throwing another lightning bolt as needed. A steam whistle sounds, and the first figure lifts his mask to reveal Mako, who wipes sweat from his brow.<br><br>The scene changes again to the Probending Arena's exterior at sunset. The scene goes inside to Mako and Bolin's one-room apartment attic. Mako comes up the stairs and goes to sit down on a sofa. He has a bag in one hand.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Bo! I'm back! Picked up your favorite dumplings. <i>(sits down)</i> Ugh. Hey, I found some work down at the power plant. It's some decent money. <i>(He takes a dumpling from the bag and eats it, then talks with his mouth full.)</i> Bolin? You here, bro? Huh. <i>(He looks out the window behind him at Air Temple Island, and smirks.)</i> I bet the little lovebird is making a house call.<br><br><i>(Evening has progressed and the sky has darkened as the scene changes to Air Temple Island's exterior Airbending Training Area. Jinora and Ikki are using their Bending to power the Airbending Gates, while Korra circle-walks through the spinning panels. She steps and spins through the obstacle course, smoothly avoiding the panels.)</i><br><br><b>Jinora:</b> Good! Light on your feet!<br><br><i>(Korra gets through the Gates, and jumps down to where Jinora and Ikki are standing. She leans to rest her hands on her knees, and pants for breath. Ikki and Jinora shift to look behind the Avatar, where Mako is coming up the path.)</i><br><br><b>Ikki:</b> Ooo, he's cute.<br><b>Jinora:</b> <i>(smiling)</i> Korra, is that the handsome firebender boy that drives you crazy?<br><br><i>(The perspective shifts so that Korra is directly facing the camera, and Mako is walking towards the camera. Korra takes on an outraged, embarrassed expression as the girls keep talking.)</i><br><br><b>Ikki:</b> Does he drive you crazy in a bad way? Or does he drive you crazy like you like him? <i>(Leans forward and clasps her hands hopefully.)</i><br><br><i>(Korra suddenly Earthbends the ground beneath the girls, flinging them up and off screen. She quickly turns to face Mako, who has finally reached her. Korra raises a hand and tries to innocently clear her throat. As she starts talking, a giggling Jinora and Ikki land lightly in the background with their Airbending.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Ahem. Oh, hey, Mako.<br><b>Mako:</b> Have you seen Bolin?<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(dryly)</i> Nice to see you to. And no, I haven't seen him since practice. Think somethings wrong?<br><b>Mako:</b> I don't know. <i>(looks off sceen)</i> Bolin has a knack for getting into stupid situations. Sigh See you later.<br><br><i>(Mako turns to leave, but Korra hurries to follow him.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Wait! I could, uh, help you look for him.<br><b>Mako:</b> Nah, I got it.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(grabs Mako's arm)</i> Hey, Cool Guy. Let me help you. We can take Naga.<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(turns to face Korra)</i> Who's Naga?<br><b>Korra:</b> My best friend! And a great tracker.<br><br><i>(The scene is now Republic City at night. The atmosphere is murky, with the city's color's washed out. A few windows provide light as Korra and Mako, riding one-behind-the-other on Naga's back, travel down the street.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Your best friend is a polar bear dog. Somehow that makes perfect sense.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(teasing)</i> I'll take that as a compliment, city boy.<br><br><i>(Naga brings them to Central City Station, to the same spot where Bolin had been sitting in front of Zuko's statue. The flame glows warmly in the dark. Mako looks around, and sees the sidewalks filled with people.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Well, this is his usual hangout. <i>(Mako slides down off Naga. He goes over to a group of children playing around a lamppost. Two of the children are pushing at each other, while a third crouches just behind one of them, causing the defeated child to trip. All the children laugh, including Skoochy.)</i> You guys seen my brother around here today?<br><b>Skoochy:</b> Perhaps. My memory is a little, foggy. <i>(He rubs his nose with his thumb and approaches Mako.)</i> Maybe you can help, clear it up. <i>(He raises a hand and motions towards himself greedily.)</i><br><b>Mako:</b> You're good, Skoochy. Huh. A real pro.<br><br><i>(Mako reaches into his pocket and pulls a bill out that he slaps into Skoochy's hand. Korra's jaw drops, and she leans forward for a closer look, before straightening and putting her hands on her hips grumpily.)</i><br><br><b>Skoochy:</b> <i>(slips the money into his vest)</i> Yeah, I seen him.<br><b>Mako:</b> When?<br><b>Skoochy:</b> 'Bout noon.<br><b>Mako:</b> What was he doing?<br><b>Skoochy:</b> He was performing some kind of monkey-rat circus. And then...<br><br><i>(Skoochy motions for more money. Mako and Korra trade glances before Mako gets another yuan out of his pocket and gives it to Skoochy.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> And then what? Why'd he leave?<br><b>Skoochy:</b> <i>(leaning toward Mako and covers his mouth with his hand so no one else can see)</i> Shady Shin showed up and flashed some serious cash. Bo took off with him in his hot rod. The Triple Threats, the Red Monsoons, the Agni Kais, all the triads are muscling up for something real big. Now that's all you're getting outta me!<br><br><i>(Skoochy runs off. The other kids follow.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> What's he talking about?<br><b>Mako:</b> Sounds like there's a turf war brewing. And Bolin's about to get caught right in the middle of it.<br><br><i>(Fade to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><u><b>Act II</b></u><br><br><i>(Two trolleys pass at a crossing in the Republic City streets, pulling away to reveal Korra and Mako, back on Naga.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> So where are we headed?<br><br><i>(Naga runs along, passing over a bridge.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> The Triple Threat Triads' headquarters. Hopefully Bolin's there and nothing's gone down yet.<br><b>Korra:</b> Triple Threat Triad? I beat up some of those yahoos when I got into town. Why would Bolin get tangled up with-- <i>(Naga barks and surges forward, prompting some animal off screen to squeal.)</i> Whoa, Naga!<br><br><i>(Naga runs towards the camera as Korra tries to bring him under control, then Pabu runs across the foreground. Naga pursues the fire ferret around a street corner, finally forcing it up a lamppost and onto a street sign.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> That's Pabu!<br><b>Korra:</b> No, Naga! Pabu's a friend, not a snack.<br><br><i>(Naga calms, and Pabu comes back down the lamppost. The camera closes in on the ferret as it leans towards Naga, touching noses with the her. Both Mako and Korra are amused at the display.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(loses his smile)</i> We gotta hurry.<br><br><i>(The scene changes to another Republic City street, and pans down to the Triple Threat Triad's hideout. Mako and Korra approach the front door.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(stepping warily across the porch)</i> Something's not right. There are usually thugs posted out front. We better be cautious. <i>(Mako pauses at the door, and moves to press against the wall beside it. He motions Korra to join him, but she nonchalantly goes right up to the door and kicks it open. Mako looks at her in surprise, then follows her in. The room is abandoned, and some of the furniture is turned over.)</i> Bolin? You in here?<br><br><i>(A motor sounds from outside the building, surprising Mako and Korra.
