Cut back to Mako and Korra as Mako begins to walk off)</i> We can't <i>(Mako turns to look at Korra)</i> just leave him here.<br><b>Tarrlok:</b> Go. <i>(They turn towards the cell with surprise. Cut to a side view shot of the scene as Tarrlok stands up.)</i> Amon can't know <i>(walks towards the cell bars)</i> anyone spoke with me. <i>(Cut to a close up frontal shot of Tarrlok)</i> Defeat him. <i>(He grabs the bars with both hands and the camera zooms in slowly)</i> Put an end to this sad story. <br><br><i>(Cut back to Korra and Mako as Korra looks a little sad but nods and her expression changes to resolve. Cut to a side view shot of the scene as the pair runs off screen. Cut to the hatch to the attic as Korra and Mako descends while Tarrlok watches them. The door shuts and dust flies around. Tarrlok remains standing still, looking at hatch.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

Cut to a shot from inside as Korra enters between two frozen trees. The area is like a network of ice tunnels. Cut to a close up of Korra as she looks around, then to a low shot from behind of her feet as descends a short slope. Tree branches and roots protrude from the ice. Korra continues on away from the camera down the tunnel. Cut to a medium shot of Korra as she makes a turn down a different path, then cut to an overhead shot of her. A dark spirit in the shape of a snake slithers above Korra. Cut to a low shot from behind Korra and tilt up as she turns around at the sound of the spirit's hissing. Cut to Korra's point of view of the path behind her. The camera pulls back and zooms in a moment before two spirit snakes fly towards the camera. Cut to a close up of Korra and briefly zoom out as she gasps and looks surprised. She runs away as the snakes chase after her. They wrap around Korra's legs and trip her. Korra rolls over the ground as the snakes wrap their bodies around her. One snake coils upward and lunges down to bite Korra. Korra raises her fist and shoves it down the snake's throat. The snake's throat swells up a moment before it bursts into flame and is shot back by Korra's fire blast. Korra sits up and does a circular kick with both legs while doing a hand stand, creating a whirlwind with airbending which blows the other snake off her. The two snake spirits regroup and go after Korra again. Korra uses waterbending to push two ice walls out of her way. She jumps between them, then creates a new ice wall which the snakes collide into. Korra stands up as the spirits are trapped on the other side, then slither away. Korra turns around and walks forward. Cut to an overhead shot to show Korra inside a domed area, with an ice floor with a glowing center. Korra walks towards the center.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> The spirit portal. Amazing.                     <br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot of Jinora, Ikki, and Meelo asleep in their room, with Ikki and Meelo in one and Jinora in the other. Cut to a close up of Jinora as she slowly wakes up and gives a small gasp. Cut to a shot from the side of Jinora walking past statues with faint light shining through windows. Cut to a close up from the side of Jinora as she stops and gasps at what is ahead of her. Cut to a shot of the bottom of an old, wooden statue and tilt up to its face. It appears to be a man encircled by a spirit.)</i><br><br><b>Jinora:</b> What Avatar is this? <br><br><i>(The scene cuts to the icy floor above the spirit portal at the south pole. Korra walks forward and we see what appears to be her reflection.)</i>     <br><br><b>Korra:</b> The light in the dark.<br><br><i>(The camera rotates its angle and zooms out to reveal it isn't her reflection, but that the shot is from under the ice and looking up at Korra standing above. Cut to a shot of Korra's feet as she takes a stance. Cut to a low angle shot of her as she raises her arm and punches downward at the floor. A whirlwind forms around her, but there is no effect. Korra blinks for a moment as she gets up, unsure as to why nothing happened. She takes a few steps back and blasts the ice with a large torrent of fire with both hands. She continues the stream of fire for a few seconds before stopping. The dust clears and the ice shows no damage.)</i>     <br><br><b>Korra:</b> Why isn't it opening?<br><br><i>(Cut to a medium shot of Korra. She looks up and gasps as several dozen spirit snakes slither on the outside of the ice dome towards the top. The camera tilts up to the top where the spirits are converging. Cut to a shot from the outside showing the snakes all attempting to break through the ice. Cut to an overhead shot of Korra as she continues to attack the ice floor with air blasts.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Come on, portal. Open!<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the snakes breaking through the top of the dome. They merge together into one giant snake, its head poking through the hole in the top. It snarls and quickly moves downward. The giant snake spirit attacks Korra in the back, ensnaring her. Its mouth transforms back into smaller snakes which wrap around Korra. She gasps as we see the bodies of the snakes start to form a net. Korra is lifted up, and she continues trying to break the ice with fire blasts. She is stopped when the spirit snakes wrap around her arms. Korra struggles as she is lifted higher and the spirits continue to tighten their hold on her. Korra grunts and her eyes glow as she enters the Avatar state. She manages to free her arms and falls back towards the floor, but her legs are still trapped and she hangs. The spirits create more tendrils that wrap around Korra while she tries to reach for the portal below. Korra struggles, and manages to tap the floor. A glowing ring ripples out from the center, and the area grows darker, save for the glowing sphere underneath. There is a hum, then the ice cracks, and a pillar of spiritual energy explodes from beneath. Korra is knocked to the side as the dark spirits are hit with the energy. Cut to a long, wide shot of the South Pole and the Everstorm as the pillar of light shoots upward into the storm clouds. It reaches above toward the stars where it splits and forms the Southern Lights, which spread across the sky. Cut to Korra looking upward.)</i>                     <br><br><b>Korra:</b> The spirits dancing in the sky.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Jinora looking at the wooden statue as the statue begins to glow. Cut to a close up of Jinora as she gasps in awe. Cut back to a shot of the pillar of light as energy spirals within it and tilt down to the rest of the group in the foreground. Cut to a close shot of Bolin and Mako watching.)</i><br>      <br><b>Mako:</b> I can't believe it.        <br><b>Bolin:</b> It's <i>beautiful</i>.<br><br><i>(Bolin wipes a tear from his eye. Cut to a shot of Unalaq smiling. Cut to a wide, far shot of Tonraq riding over the snow while the lights shine in the background. Cut to a shot in front of him. He turns to look behind and sees the lights. Cut to a shot from behind as Tonraq stops. He stands up and turns around, smiling.)</i>           <br><br><b>Tonraq:</b> She did it.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Korra emerging from the fog, slowly walking towards the camera. Cut to a close shot of Bolin, with Eska and Desna behind him. Bolin smiles excitedly when he sees Korra.)</i>          <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Hey Korra, you're back! Hey, Korra's back! Wha- huh?<br><br><i>(Bolin runs towards Korra and gives her a hug. However, he is separated from her when a wall of ice forms between them, with his head trapped within a groove at the top. He is turned around and the camera pans right as he is made to face Eska, with Desna by her side.)</i>               <br><br><b>Eska:</b> Why are you initiating physical contact with another woman? <br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Bolin's face as he looks nervous and frightened, gulping and whimpering softly. Cut to a shot of Korra walking towards Unalaq, who is in the foreground. In the background, we see Eska turn the ice wall Bolin is in back into water, and he falls to the ground.)</i>      <br><br><b>Korra:</b> Everything you said was true.               <br><b>Unalaq:</b> Avatar Korra, you have taken the first step in bringing balance back to the South and soon, the whole world.        <br><br><i>(Mako runs up to Korra and hugs her, lifting her up and spinning her around.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> You never cease to amaze me. <br><b>Korra:</b> Thanks. By the way, I'm <i>really</i> sorry for being a total pain. Things were really stressful and confusing. It's hard being the Avatar.  <b>Mako:</b> It's harder being the Avatar's boyfriend.<br><br><i>(Mako gently nudges Korra, and she chuckles and they hug once more. The scene cuts to a shot of the ground at dawn. We see sled tracks over the hills and the camera tilts up towards the group riding up a hill. Cut to the front of the group as they reach the top of a mountain. Cut to a shot from Behind Unalaq, Korra, and Mako. The camera tilts up as they look down at the bay of the Southern Water Tribe's city. Large battleships are entering the harbor. Cut to a close shot of Northern Water Tribe soldiers marching past the camera. Cut to a shot from the front of the ships and pan right with the sun shining behind them, light glistening on the water. Cut to Korra dismounting Naga and watching.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> What are all your Northern troops doing here?<br><b>Unalaq:</b> Opening the spirit portal was only the first step in getting the Southern Water Tribe back on its righteous path. There's more difficult work to be done before our two tribes are truly united.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Korra as she looks in surprise at Unalaq, then turns away and looks down sadly.)</i>           <br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

I haven't been spending enough time with them I wish I could be as good a father as Dad was to us.           <br><b>Kya:</b> Tenzin, your problem is you're <i>exactly</i> like Dad. He was so focused on saving the world and doing his duty - don't laugh - that he never had time for us.             <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Dad was under a lot of pressure.          <br><b>Bumi:</b> He always had time for you though, <i>(pinches Tenzin's cheek)</i> his precious little airbender. <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Dad loved us all equally. Besides, it all happened a long time ago. Why are we even talking about this?           <br><b>Kya:</b> Because you seem to have some grandiose delusion that we had a perfect, happy-go-lucky childhood. Guess what? <i>We</i> didn't.              <br><b>Tenzin:</b> We need to keep moving if we want to find Ikki before dark. <i>(continues walking down the trail)</i>          <br><b>Kya:</b> See what he's doing there, Bumi? Classic airbender technique; Cutting and running when things get tough!     <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Ugh.             <br><b>Bumi:</b> Yeah, did Dad teach you that move? <br><br><i>(The scene cuts to a shot of Korra riding Naga over the top of a hill from the front. The bay and the tall tower in the middle of it cn be seen in the background. The camera zooms out to an over the shoulder shot of Mako.)</i>   <br><br><b>Mako:</b> How was your day, sweetie?  <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(dismounts)</i> Oh, fabulous. My tribe's about to go to war and I'm supposed to stop it, but will anyone listen to me? No! And I didn't ask for my father's help. Can't he just let me be the Avatar?<br><b>Mako:</b> Uh... do you want advice, or am I just supposed to listen? I'm still not clear on that.<br><b>Korra:</b> Ugh. I'm sorry. My Dad just gets me all worked up.<br><b>Mako:</b> How about you take a break from all this Avatar stuff and we go out for a quiet dinner? Just the two of us.       <br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Korra as she smiles. The shot dissolves into another closeup of Korra, only now she is in a restaurant and frowning. Pan left to Mako, also frowning, then cut to a close shot of Eska and Desna, who are seated across from them. Pan left to Bolin, who is smiling and clasping his hands.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(laughs)</i> Isn't this fun, huh? We never get to spend enough time together, just the... five of us. So fun.<br><br><i>(Eska and Desna silently glance at each other)</i>             <br><br><b>Eska:</b> Excuse us while we retrieve more sustenance.<br><br><i>(Eska and Desna both leave in unison. Bolin waits until they're gone and his smile vanishes.)</i>        <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> You guys gotta save me.       <br><b>Mako:</b> I thought you were breaking up with her. What happened to ripping off the leech?       <br><b>Bolin:</b> I tried! But anytime I bring up the subject, she threatens to freeze me in a block of ice and feed me to dolphin-piranhas!      <br><b>Mako:</b> So it was more like you tugged at the leech.    <br><b>Bolin:</b> Yes, over and over and over, but it won't come off. Why didn't you warn me your cousin had the power to reach into my heart and crush my soul with her bare hands?<br><b>Korra:</b> Uh... 'cos I thought it was pretty obvious?<br><b>Bolin:</b> No, no, not to me, it wasn't. I'm very bad at reading people. You should know that by now. Oh, man. Oh... Do something, Avatar!      <br><br><i>(Bolin hangs his head sadly. The scene cuts to Tenzin, Kya, and Bumi walking down a path at night, with Tenzin holding a lantern.)</i><br><br><b>Bumi:</b> You know, this reminds me of a search-and-rescue mission I commanded years ago, in the mountains outside of Ba Sing Se.         <br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(sighs)</i> Here we go.           <br><b>Bumi:</b> For five days, we scoured that beast of a mountain, fighting our way through blizzards, sandstorms, and <i>three</i> typhoons. Finally, we found the men huddled in a cave, seconds from death. <i>(music swells, and Tenzin grows more annoyed)</i> With no time to lose, I piled all twelve of those poor souls on my back and single-handedly carried them down the mountain to safety.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> And how exactly is that supposed to help us find Ikki!? <br><br><i>(Kya walks on ahead of her brothers.)</i><br><br><b>Bumi:</b> It was supposed to <i>inspire</i> you. Clearly, you know nothing about being a leader of men. That's probably why the Avatar fired you.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> I'm sick of your far-fetched tales. <i>Three</i> typhoons?         <br><b>Bumi:</b> Well, I may have thrown in an extra typhoon or two for dramatic effect, but-      <br><b>Kya:</b> Quit arguing and bring that lantern over here. I found footprints!       <br><br><i>(Tenzin is surprised for a moment. He jogs over and holds the lantern up. Cut to a shot of footprints on the ground, and tilt up to show them leading down the trail beside a waterfall and high above a large pond.<br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Come on!           <br><b>Bumi:</b> No, follow me! This will get us down <i>fifty</i> times faster.        <br><br><i>(Bumi begins hopping down stones along the edge of the waterfall.)</i><br><br><b>Kya:</b> Bumi, it's pitch black and the rocks are slippery. You're gonna hurt yourself.   <br><b>Bumi:</b> Come on, you wimps! If I can do it, it should be no problem for a couple of benders.    <br><b>Kya:</b> Fine.                  <br><br><i>(Kya jumps into the middle of the waterfall and uses waterbending to slow her descent. Tenzin follows her, hopping along the cliffside and using airbending to slow his descent. Bumi watches them and growls as they reach the bottom far more quickly than him.)</i><br><br><b>Kya:</b> You were right, Bumi! That <i>was</i> faster!        <br><b>Tenzin:</b> At least fifty times faster, by my calculations.          <br><br><i>(Tenzin and Kya both laugh.)</i><br><br><b>Bumi:</b> Oh, Tenzin's the funny guy now.          <br><b>Tenzin:</b> If you need an airlift down, just say the word.          <br><b>Bumi:</b> Bah, I don't need your help. I've got everything under control. Ahh!              <br><br><i>(Bumi slips and falls, hitting and rock and going through tree branches on the way down before landing in the water, making a large splash.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Bumi!<br><br><i>(The scene cuts to Korra riding up to her house on Naga at night. She dismounts and goes inside. Cut to a shot of Senna sitting on their couch.)</i>             <br><b>Korra:</b> Did Dad send you to talk to me?         <br><b>Senna:</b> Your father doesn't know I'm here. Korra, what's going on between you two?<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(sits next to Senna)</i> Ask Dad.              <br><b>Senna:</b> I've tried, but he won't talk about it. Honey, it breaks my heart to see our family being torn apart like this.   <br><b>Korra:</b> You want to know what's been going on? I found out Dad's been lying to me my whole life. Unalaq told me everything; How Dad and Tenzin kept me trapped down here while I trained. How dad got banished from the North.<br><b>Senna:</b> So, the truth is out.     <br><b>Korra:</b> You knew. And you never said anything.  <br><b>Senna:</b> We were trying to keep our family together, to give you a <i>normal</i> childhood.       <br><b>Korra:</b> I never wanted a normal childhood. All I ever wanted to be was the Avatar but everyone keeps holding me back, even my own parents! Unalaq's the only one who believes in me.<br><b>Senna:</b> That's not true, Korra.       <br><b>Korra:</b> No? Then why is everyone in the South turning against me, when all I'm trying to do is help them?          <br><b>Senna:</b> The problems between the North and the South started <i>long</i> before you were born. You can't expect to undo them in a day.               <br><b>Korra:</b> So I should just sit back and let the water tribes go to war?              <br><b>Senna:</b> No, but this situation might be out of your control. Varrick's been plotting rebellion against Unalaq. He asked your father to join, and-       <b>Korra:</b> <i>(stands)</i> Dad is part of a rebellion?  <br><b>Senna:</b> I don't know, but I don't want you getting caught in the middle of it.      <br><b>Korra:</b> It's too late, Mom. I'm already in the middle of it.      <br><br><i>(Korra turns and runs outside. She mounts Naga and Senna follows after her.)</i><br><br><b>Senna:</b> Korra!            <br><br><i>(Korra rides off. Cut to a shot of a chandelier in the Southern Water Tribe palace and tilt down to the floor. We see Korra running down the hall.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Uncle! <i>(stops and looks to see three soldiers defeated, unconsious and tied to a pillar)</i> Oh, no. Uncle?                        <br><br><i>(Korra continues forward. Cut to a shot of her rounding a corner and sliding to a halt as she sees something. She presses herself back against the wall and peers around the corner. Cut to her point of view as she sees masked rebels guarding another hall. Out of the hall comes a tall and muscular rebel, carrying Unalaq over his shoulder. Cut to a close up profile of Unalaq showing him unconscious. Cut to a shot and focus on the leader, whose mask only reveals his eyes.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Dad?<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Korra as her eyes widen in surprise and fear, and move the camera in closer to her face. Cut to commercial.)</i>              <br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(Fade in to a far shot of the kidnappers. Korra steps into the foreground. Cut to  close up of her.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Dad, don't do this.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of the kidnapper presumed to be Tonraq, and zoom out to show the rebel leader at his side.)</i>      <br><br><b>Rebellion Leader:</b> Turn around Avatar, and pretend you didn't see anything.               <br><b>Korra:</b> No. Leave Unalaq and go. I'll tell him I tried to stop you but you escaped. We can still avoid a war.         <br><b>Rebellion Leader:</b> No, we can't.                    <br><br><i>(The leader swings his arms and hammers the floor with his fist, creating an ice wall that travels towards Korra. She rolls to the side, and the wall separates her from the rebels as they make their escape. Korra punches through the ice wall, demolishing it, and chases after them. As the rebels run down the stairs, Korra bends an ice slide onto the railing and grinds down it on her feet. She launches herself off the end of the rails, corkscrewing in midair before landing in front of the rebels.)</i><br><br><b>Rebellion Leader:</b> Get him out of here!     <br><br><i>(The kidnapper runs with Unalaq towards the exit. Korra attempts to chase after him, but another ice wall is bended in front of her, knocking her back a bit.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> We're all part of the same tribe! I don't want to hurt you.                <br><br><i>(The rebels begin flinging water at Korra. Korra dodges to the side and rolls between two pillars. She jumps to avoid another jet of water and grabs a tapestry hanging overhead. Korra runs to the right, avoiding a stream of water that is turned into a large ice crystal. The rebel leader throws more streams of water at Korra, hitting the pillars as she runs behind them. The rebels move in closer to her. Korra runs up the side of a pillar and leaps off, dodging more attacks. The scene goes into slow motion as Korra throws the tapestry over two of the rebels. They stagger off balance a moment before Korra jumps and uses airbending to wrap the tapestry around them, knocking the rebels over. Korra then runs towards the camera and past it as she rushes down the other rebels. The remaining two throw more water at Korra, who does a cartwheel and a flip to avoid it. She lands between them and dodges a punch thrown by the leader as she grabs the lasso on his belt. Korra uses a sidekick to knock back the other rebel as he tries to tackle her. The leader punches twice at Korra, but she weaves out of the way, spinning her body around and wrapping the lasso around his arm. Korra uses the lasso to pull him off balance, then uses his momentum to swing him around in a large circle, throwing him into a pillar and knocking him out. Korra quickly runs around the pillar with the rope, trapping the leader there. Cut to a shot from outside the palace as Korra makes it to the exit. The camera quickly zooms out to show her at the top of a tall flight of stairs.)</i> <br><br><b>Korra:</b> Dad, stop!  <br><br><i>(The kidnapper rides past the camera on a snowmobile, with Unalaq strapped behind him. Korra runs down a few steps before jumping off the side of the stair case. Cut to a shot looking down the street as the snowmobile rides away from the camera. Korra steps into the foreground and waterbends an ice ramp in front of the snowmobile which loops to the side. The kidnapper and Unalaq fall off the snowmobile which crashes into the ground. Korra runs forward. Cut to a shot from the front of Korra as she stops in front of the kidnapper on the ground. The kidnapper groans and begins to sit up, and Korra approaches him.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Why did you do this, Dad? <i>(pulls the kidnapper's mask off to reveal it's not Tonraq)</i> What? Who are you? Where's my father?          <br><b>Kidnapper:</b> He wouldn't help us. He's a traitor, just like you.                <br><br><i>(The camera tilts up to Unalaq on the ground, now regaining consciousness and getting up. Cut to a close up of a rebel's wrists as handcuffs are placed on them. Cut to a wider shot of the handcuffed kidnappers surrounded by soldiers. The camera pans left to Unalaq and Korra.)</i><br><br><b>Unalaq:</b> Thank you for saving my life.            <br><b>Korra:</b> I'm just glad I got here in time.       <br><b>Unalaq:</b> <i>(to soldiers)</i> Find Varrick. I want him to freeze in prison with the rest of these traitors.<br><br><i>(The leader of the soldiers nods and he and his men leave with the prisoners.)</i>         <br><br><b>Korra:</b> Wait, you can't just lock them away. That will only make the South angrier.          <br><b>Unalaq:</b> You want them to go free?   <br><b>Korra:</b> No... but let them stand trial for what they did. Every Water Tribe citizen deserves that right.      <br><b>Unalaq:</b> Very well. I will respect the Avatar's wishes in this matter.     <br><b>Korra:</b> Thank you, Uncle.       <br><br><i>(The scene cuts to a high angle shot of Tenzin, Kya and Bumi. Kya is healing Bumi's head with waterbending as he sits against a rock.)</i><br><br><b>Kya:</b> I told you those rocks were slippery. You're lucky you didn't kill yourself.       <br><b>Bumi:</b> You done with the lecture, Mom?     <br><b>Kya:</b> Oh, grow up. You haven't changed <i>one</i> bit since we were kids. You're still trying to prove you can do everything a bender can. Well, you can't. Deal with it.<br><b>Bumi:</b> And you're not our mother, you don't get to tell me what I can and can't do. Deal with <i>that</i>. Ugh!<br><br><i>(Kya raises the healing water above Bumi's head as she turns around and crosses her arms, letting the water drop on his head and soak him.)</i><br><br><b>Kya:</b> Good luck healing yourself with your special non-bending powers.       <br><b>Bumi:</b> <i>(shakes the water off his head)</i> Hey back me up here, Tenzin.             <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Kya's right. You're the oldest of us, but you always acted like the youngest. <i>I</i> had to become the responsible one.<br><b>Kya:</b> You think <i>you're</i> the responsible one? Where were you after Dad died and Mom was all alone? Because <i>I</i> was the only one who packed up and moved my <i>whole</i> life to be with her.         <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Sure, after years of flitting around the world, trying to find yourself. It was time for you to settle down somewhere. You two have <i>no idea</i> how it feels to have the future of an entire culture on your shoulders.<br><b>Bumi:</b> Oh, boo-hoo. Must've been real hard for you, flying around the world with Dad, riding elephant-koi all day.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> Oh, so that's what this is all about.          <br><b>Kya:</b> That's what it's <i>always</i> been about. You think you're some <i>savior</i> who has to carry on Dad's legacy.          <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Who else is going to do it?  <br><b>Kya:</b> How about all of us?     <br><b>Bumi:</b>Yeah, we're Aang's kids too. <br><b>Kya:</b> We never should have come on this vacation.           <br><b>Bumi:</b> I couldn't agree more.    <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Well, I didn't want you to come in the first place. <i>(touches forehead in exasperation)</i> I can't be around you two right now. Go back to the temple and see if Ikki returned. I'll keep looking out here.<br><b>Bumi:</b> Fine.             <br><b>Kya:</b> Fine.             <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Fine.<br><br><i>(Kya and Bumi leave in one direction while Tenzin goes in the other. Cut to an overhead shot and slowly zoom out as they go their separte ways. Cut to a wide shot of Korra's parents' house in the morning. Korra rides on a galloping Naga towards the house. Cut to a close shot from the inside of the house of the door opening and Korra walking into the door frame. Cut to a shot of Tonraq and Senna seated and eating as they look up. Cut to an over the shoulder shot of Korra with her parents in the foreground. Korra looks to the side hesitantly.)</i>             <br><br><b>Korra:</b> Is it okay if I come in?      <br><b>Senna:</b> Of course. We heard what happened, are you okay?          <br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Korra as she frowns and tears start to form in her eyes. They run down her cheeks as she closes them shut and she runs towards Tonraq and hugs him around the neck.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I'm so glad you weren't there. I don't know what I would have done.     <br><b>Tonraq:</b> I had no idea how far Varrick was willing to go. My brother and I have our differences but I would <i>never</i> attack him.  <br><b>Korra:</b> I'm sorry for thinking you had anything to do with the rebels, and for all the pain I've caused you and Mom.    <br><b>Tonraq:</b> I'm the one who should apologize. After I saw The Southern Lights return, I was <i>so</i> proud of you. I never should have held you back.     <b>Senna:</b> When your father and I found each other, all we wanted was to live a simple life and raise a family. But then we discovered you were the Avatar, and simple was over. We knew one day the world would need you, and you wouldn't need us anymore.            <br><b>Korra:</b> Mom, Dad, of course I still need you.   <br><br><i>(The family shares a group hug. Footsteps are heard and we cut to a close shot of Unalaq's feet as she steps inside. Cut to Korra, Tonraq, and Senna as they break the hug and turn to look at Unalaq.)</i><br><br><b>Tonraq:</b> We weren't expecting you.<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Unalaq standing in the doorway with Korra and her parents in the foreground. Waterbending soldiers begin to emerge from behind Unalaq and take battle stances at his sides.)</i>   <br><br><b>Unalaq:</b> Tonraq, Senna, you are under arrest and will stand trial.      <br><b>Tonraq:</b> Trial? For what?          <br><b>Unalaq:</b> For conspiring to <i>assassinate</i> me.<br><br><i>(Cut to the shot of Korra, Tonraq, and Senna and quickly zoom in as they all react in shock.               <br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

LTD<br><b>Transcribers:</b> Icy_Ashford, Yong Wing<br><br><br><br><i>["Previously on The Legend of Korra" sequence, including clips from "Civil Wars: Part 1."]</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> Tensions between the Northern and Southern Water Tribes have reached a breaking point. After Chief Unalaq's troops took over the South, Varrick incited an uprising but Korra stopped the rebels from abducting her uncle. Enraged by the insurrection, Unalaq arrested the rebels and Korra's parents, accusing them of conspiring to assassinate him. Will Korra be able to save her parents and prevent civil war?     <br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b>    <br><br><i>(The scene opens with a shot of the sky, panning down to an establishing shot of Tonraq's and Senna's igloo and a Water Tribe police van waiting outside. Four Northern soldiers flank the van and the entrance to the igloo. Korra and Unalaq look on as Tonraq, handcuffed, walks himself into the back of the police van. Senna is also handcuffed, and she briefly looks over her shoulder sadly at Korra before following her husband into the van. Korra's expression is equally sad, but also conflicted. She turns to face her uncle as the soldiers shut the doors to the back of the van, get in the front, and drive off.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> You're making a mistake.      <br><b>Unalaq:</b> I wish it hadn't come to this. But your parents held meetings with the rebels, right here in their home.       <br><b>Korra:</b> I can't believe you're doing this to your own family.    <br><b>Unalaq:</b> Rest assured, I've appointed Judge Hotah to oversee the trial. He is the most fair and honorable man I know.       <br><b>Korra:</b> Uncle, my parents had <i>nothing</i> to do with the men who attacked you.           <br><b>Unalaq:</b> I'm sure you're right. So we should have nothing to worry about.         <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(glances away uncertainly)</i> I hope so.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide, establishing shot of the Southern Water Tribe, with snowy peaks in the background and a tower in the foreground. Cut to a wide shot of the inside of a decorative lounge, with animal heads mounted on the walls, a fur rug, and even a stuffed platypus-bear standing on its hind legs. Mako is sitting on a couch by a spacious window while talking to Asami, who is standing with her arms crossed. Bolin is reclining on the other end of the couch with Pabu napping on his chest.)</i>           <br><br><b>Asami:</b> Where's Varrick? We should've closed our deal an hour ago.          <br><b>Bolin:</b> Would you relax? This place is great, and the best part about it? Eska doesn't know I'm here.<br><br><i>(Cut to Northern soldiers opening the double-doors to the room, flanking Eska and Desna as they enter the room.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b>  <i>(jumps to his feet, startled)</i> Ee-yah. I wasn't hiding. Hey, hey-hey, hey.          <br><b>Eska:</b> I'm not on the hunt for you. Currently.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot of the characters' exchanges as Northern soldiers search the premises.)</i>              <br><br><b>Desna:</b> We search for Varrick. Our father wishes him to stand trial.         <br><b>Asami:</b> What did he do?           <br><b>Eska:</b> He is a traitor to the Water Tribe, along with our aunt and uncle. <br><b>Asami:</b> What?             <br><b>Mako:</b> Korra's parents were arrested?<br><b>Desna:</b> Yes. Your powers of deduction are impressive.         <br><b>Bolin:</b> Yeah, he's a cop.<br><br><i>(The Northern soldiers all approach Eska and Desna.)</i>       <br><br><b>Northern Soldier:</b> Varrick's not here.      <br><b>Eska:</b> Very well. Desna, let us continue our search elsewhere. <i>(authoritatively, as Desna and the soldiers exit)</i> Boyfriend! Bow to me when I exit.     <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(cowed, bowing low to the floor)</i> Yes, yes, my sweet koala-otter.      <br><b>Eska:</b> <i>(smirks)</i> You are so cute when you grovel. <i>(she exits)</i>               <br><b>Asami:</b> Don't let her treat you that way, stand up for yourself.     <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(stands)</i> I tried to break up with her, but Mako gave me terrible advice. Thank you, Mako. <i>(pouts)</i>        <br><b>Mako:</b> Wait, how are your girl problems my fault?          <br><b>Asami:</b> Bolin, you need to be honest with her. Tell her how you really feel.  <br>      <b>Varrick:</b> <i>(muffled)</i> Honesty is for fools, kid!<br><br><i>(Everyone's eyes go wide, as they glance around for the source of the voice.)</i>      <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Varrick?              <br><b>Varrick:</b> <i>(muffled)</i>  If you want to ditch this girl, then make yourself scarce. Disappear, like I did!     <br><b>Asami:</b> Where are you?        <br><b>Varrick:</b> Somewhere Unalaq will never find me. <i>(his head emerges from the maw of the stuffed platypus-bear)</i> Inside Ping-Ping! How we doin'?      <br><b>Mako:</b> The coast is clear. You can come out.           <br><b>Varrick:</b>  No way, mister. Not until I know it's absolutely, 157% safe. <i>(another hand bearing a teacup, which Varrick eagerly takes, emerges out of the maw over his shoulder)</i> Ahh! Thank you, Zhu Li.     <br><b>Asami:</b> Your assistant's in there too?<br><b>Varrick:</b> Zhu Li never leaves my side. <i>(sips his tea, then spits it out in disgust)</i> Yuck! Pyugh! Pyuck! You forgot the honey!      <br><b>Zhu Li:</b> <i>(muffled)</i>  <i>(camera pans to the bear's center mass)</i> Sorry, sir. There isn't any in here.    <br><b>Varrick:</b> <i>(camera pans back to Varrick's face)</i> No honey? Oh, thank goodness.<br><br><i>(Cut to a cave entrance, which Tenzin walks toward as the lemurs fly off.)</i>       <br><br><b>Ikki:</b> <i>(distant, echoing)</i> Juniper Lightning Bug, paws off the table! <i>(Cut to inside the cave, where Ikki is having a tea party with four baby flying bisons with a flat rock serving as a table)</i> This is going to be a civilized breakfast. Close up on the money on the ground as hands seize fistfuls of it. Cut to a wide shot of Bolin and the stuffed bear hurrying up the ramp onto Varrick's ship. Cut to a close angle on the ship's controls as the bear's paws slides switches forward and grabs a handle. Still inside the bear, Varrick has the ship running and begins steering. Bolin turns and sees Mako, Korra, and Asami climb up onto the steering deck.)</i> <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(to Korra)</i> Where's your dad?       <br><b>Korra:</b> On a ship headed North. <i>(to Varrick)</i> Think we can catch up to it?  <br><b>Varrick:</b> Sure, once you get us past our friends from the North.   <br><br><i>(Cut to a shot through the window - then an aerial shot - of the Northern Water Tribe's blockade of the harbor.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> If only we had a plane to get me close to those ships. I could waterbend them out of the way.         <br><b>Varrick:</b> A plane? Well, why didn't you say so?     <br><br><i>(Cut to an angle on a red button as the bear's paw presses down on it. Cut to a darkened hangar from a low angle as doors above fold open and a biplane with its wings folded upwards is raised on a hydraulic platform onto the main deck. Once on deck, the wings fold out fully. Cut to everyone looking at the plane on deck from inside the steering deck. Varrick's bear suit is now seated and wearing a captain's cap.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Um, why do you have a plane on your boat?          <br><b>Varrick:</b> In case the boat sinks, of course.              <br><b>Asami:</b> But there's no runway, how are we supposed to take off?<br><b>Varrick:</b> <i>(realizing she has a point, he shouts to Zhu Li - apparently still inside the suit with him)</i> Zhu Li! Take a note, build runway.        <b>Zhu Li:</b> <i>(muffled)</i> Yes, sir.           <br><b>Korra:</b> I have an idea.           <br><br><i>(Cut to a low shot of the plane's propeller spinning. Cut to Asami in the cockpit, putting her pilot's goggles on. Cut to a panning wide shot of the plane as all three of its propellers spin, with Korra and Mako standing on the lower opposite wings and holding on. Korra gives Asami a thumb's up. Cut to a low shot of the plane's wheels as they move forward.)</i> <br><br><b>Korra:</b> Now!             <br><br><i>(Holding onto the wing with one hand, she blasts a jet of fire behind her with her other hand. The camera quickly moves across to the other wing, where Mako is also blasting a jet of fire behind him. Cut to a shot that pans down very quickly from directly above the plane to directly behind it as the jets of fire give it a huge speed boost. The plane zooms up two planks serving as ramps and then disappears over the edge of the bow. Seconds pass, and then the plane flies back into view at a further distance, heading for the blockade. Cut to a shot of Varrick's ship, plowing ahead. Cut to a wide shot of the blockade as Varrick's plane flies into view toward the blockade with Varrick's ship going in the same direction below. Cut to a full-frontal shot of the plane, with the sunset behind it and Korra and Mako no longer blasting fire for propulsion. Cut to a close-up of Korra's face, her eyes closed. When her eyes snap open, they are glowing white. The camera moves around her into a side shot as she moves her arms in circular motions, then thrusts them forward and raises them slowly. <br><br>Cut to an overhead shot of a mass of water rising into a mound below, panning down to a wide shot as it picks up speed and more mass while rolling toward the blockade. Cut to an overhead shot as the mound of water slams into Northern ships, forcing them aside to make way for Varrick's ship. Cut to Northern sailors onboard one of the ships, stumbling and falling as their ship rocks violently. Cut to a close-up from the side of Korra's face as her eyes stop glowing, cracking a victorious smile. Cut to a shot of Varrick's ship cruising past the blockade ships while a Northern guardsman and a captain watch from the crow's nest of their ship. The guardsman watches through a spyglass. Cut to a circular shot through the spyglass's perspective of Bolin hugging the platypus-bear with a captain's cap steering the ship. Cut back to the guardsman and captain, both astounded.)</i><br><br><b>Northern Guardsman:</b> Captain, you are never gonna believe this.       <br><br><i>(Cut to the plane flying past the blockade as Varrick's ship cruises past the camera. The scene dissolves to a close-up of Korra's face as she looks around, then spots a ship off in the distance.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> There! My dad's on that ship! <br><br><i>(The plane flies out of frame, then reappears heading in the direction of the distant ship. Cut to two Northern guardsmen conversing on the deck before looking up and seeing the plane overhead. Cut to a shot from behind of the plane going into a dive toward the ship.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Jump!              <br><br><i>(Mako, Asami, and Korra all leap from the plane into the water. The plane tumbles into the water for a few flips before exploding. Cut to the guardsmen onboard watching the plane blow up in the water. Cut to Korra, Asami, and Mako swimming underwater, with a massive air pocket Korra is bending around their heads. The camera pans up to the ships above water, as a massive swirling of water snakes out and over the deck, dropping the trio onto the ship. Korra runs forwards with tentacles of water trailing from her arms. Cut to a wide shot of unsuspecting Northern guardsmen still watching over the ship's side as Korra runs up behind them, leaps into a spinning movement, and lashes her tentacles at them, throwing them all overboard. Cut to him struggling against the ice confining everything below his neck as Korra and Mako walk up to him.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Where are the prisoners?      <br><br><i>(Close on the man's face contorted in terror. Cut to an overhead shot of the ship. Cut to Korra and the others leading Tonraq and the defendants from the trial, all in prison uniforms now, down a hallway. Korra looks around for a way out.)</i><br><br><b>Tonraq:</b> Korra, this is crazy. You promised me you wouldn't do anything rash. <br><b>Korra:</b> I had to. I'll explain later.       <br><br><i>(Cut to Northern guardsmen at the edge of the ship's side, sending water attacks downward. Cut to a wide shot of Korra and company on a plank extending out toward Varrick's approaching ship. Mako fends off the water attacks with fire blasts as everyone leaps onto the deck of Varrick's vessel. Mako and Korra are the last to leap. Korra sends one last fire blast in the guardsmen's direction. Cut to a wide shot of the Northern ship as Varrick's boat turns tail and speeds right past the camera. They all turn when they see Tenzin approaching with Ikki beside him. Peema stands up and runs toward Ikki.)</i><br><br><b>Pema:</b> Sweetie! You're okay! <i>(hugs Ikki)</i> Oh, I was so worried! <i>(sternly, to Jinora and Meelo)</i> Do you have something you wanna say to your sister?  <br><b>Meelo:</b> Ikki, I'm glad you're back.  <br><b>Jinora:</b> Yeah, sorry we made fun of you.       <br><b>Ikki:</b> Thanks. <i>(excited)</i> Wanna play air ball?      <br><b>Jinora:</b> Sure!             <br><b>Meelo:</b> <i>(pumps his fist in the air)</i> Yeah!               <br><br><i>(Ikki, Jinora, and Meelo run off out of frame, as Tenzin approaches Bumi and Kya slowly.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> I wanted to apologize for how I acted yesterday. I've worked so hard to celebrate Dad's legacy that I may have overlooked the parts of him that were less than ideal.      <br><b>Kya:</b> And we're sorry for dumping our frustrations with Dad out on you.           <br><b>Bumi:</b> Yeah, you didn't deserve that.<br><b>Kya:</b> <i>(reaches into her pocket, pulls out a photograph)</i> I thought you two might wanna see this. Mom gave it to me before we left.         <br><br><i>(Close on a black-and-white photograph of an adult Aang and Katara, with Bumi and Kya as young children, and a baby Tenzin. All of those old enough are smiling. The camera zooms in on this image.)</i><br><br><b>Bumi:</b> That is one good-looking family, huh?       <br><br><i>(Cut to the smiling faces of Kya, Bumi, and Tenzin reacting to the photo.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> That's one happy family.      <br><br><i>(Cut to an establishing shot of Varrick's ship, under cover of night. Korra is talking to her father and his men on the main deck.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> So once I knew the truth, I couldn't sit by and do nothing.         <br><b>Tonraq:</b> <i>(calm, but furious)</i> My own brother betrayed me. And our entire tribe!     <br><b>Rebel Leader:</b> What's our next move?     <br><b>Tonraq:</b> I've been running from my past for too long. It's time to put my brother in his place.          <br><br><i>(Cut to an overhead shot as the rebel leader places his fist over his heart in a pledge of allegiance. The other men follow suit.)</i><br><br><b>Rebel Leader:</b> You have our support, Chief Tonraq.          <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(also places her fist over her heart)</i> Mine too. I'll be proud to fight alongside you, Dad.  <br><b>Tonraq:</b> No, Korra.          <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(eyes widen with disappointment)</i> But you said the South doesn't stand a chance against Unalaq's forces. I can help.           <br><br><i>(The camera pans slowly around the two of them as they talk, flanked by Tonraq's men.)</i><br><br><b>Tonraq:</b> The best way for you to help is by getting the President of the United Republic on our side. The South can give Unalaq a good fight for a while, but we'll need the United Forces in order to win this war.       <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(glances down sadly, then looks up at Tonraq with firm determination)</i> All right, I'll get you all the help you need. <i>(she hugs her father)</i> I love you, Dad.        <br><b>Tonraq:</b> <i>(close-up of his smiling face)</i> I love you too.           <br><br><i>(The scene dissolves to Tonraq waterbending a platform of ice the rebels and he are standing on to shore. Once the ice touches land, they all hop off. Tonraq looks back toward Varrick's ship in the far distance. Cut to Mako, Korra, Asami, and Bolin watching through the ship's window.)</i> <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> I really need to thank you, Korra.             <br><b>Korra:</b> For what? I started a civil war.     <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(smiling, making gestures with his arms)</i> Exactly! Now Eska and I are officially broken up.       <br><b>Varrick:</b> Oh, looks like we have company!<br><br><i>(Everyone turns at the sound of Varrick's voice. Cut to Varrick, still inside the bear but with his torso and arms also extending out of the dead animal's mouth. Varrick is holding a spyglass to his eye.)</i><br><br><b>Varrick:</b> And not the <i>fun</i> kind!      <br><br><i>(Cut to everyone joining Varrick by the larger window. Cut to a wide shot from behind of them all, as a massive wave is seen far off in the distance.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> What is that?     <br><br><i>(Bolin takes the spyglass and looks through it. Cut to a circular shot through the spyglass's perspective of a person riding a massive wave they are also waterbending. From this same perspective, the camera zooms in to reveal that it's Eska. Her hair is disheveled, her face contorted is in rage, and her makeup is running down her cheeks.)</i><br>    <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>That</i> would be my darling Eska. <i>(cut to Bolin pleading with Varrick in a frightened tone)</i> Quick question: Is this thing fast enough to get away from my crazy waterbending ex-girlfriend?   <br><b>Varrick:</b> <i>(grins)</i> Why do you think I built this boat?          <br><br><i>(Cut to Varrick's ship turning tail and speeding off into the distance.)</i><br><br> <br><br>[End Credits]<br>

After Korra discovered that Chief Unalaq betrayed her and her father, she turned against him, sparking civil war. The Southern Rebels rallied around Tonraq, but they are vastly outnumbered. So Korra is headed to Republic City to seek aid. But will she be able to convince President Raiko to send troops to help the South?         <br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b> <br><br><i>(The episode opens up to an overhead shot of the docks in Republic City in the day time and the camera slowly zooms in. Thanks for starting a war.      <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(defensive)</i> I <i>didn't</i> start a war! <i>(Mako turns his head towards his girlfriend when she speaks)</i> Well, <i>(looks down as her posture slackens)</i> I did, <i>(looks back up as she gets defensive again)</i> but it's more complicated than you're making it seem.   <br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(turns her head towards Mako)</i> Mako, <i>(the firebender turns his attention to Lin)</i> I want you back on the beat. <i>(Cut to a close up of Lin)</i> There's going to be a Southern Water Tribe peace march tonight. I need you there to make sure things don't get out of hand.  <br><br><i>(Cut to a view from behind Lin which looks at all of the people standing on the docks)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> I'm all yours.        <br><b>Korra:</b> I'll go too. The people of the South <i>need</i> to see that the Avatar is on their side in the fight against the Northern invaders. <br><br><i>(Cut to a view from behind Mako's and Korra's waists with Lin in between the couple.)</i><br><br><b>Lin:</b> Great. That should calm them down.  <br><br><i>(Lin turns and walks away. Camera pulls back to show Mako's and Korra's heads as the former turns towards his girlfriend.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Maybe you should sit this out. <i>(Korra turns towards him)</i><br><b>Korra:</b> What?             <br><b>Mako:</b>  I just think having you there blatantly supporting one side will only make things worse. We'll get him on board.     <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(raises both arms up)</i> Whatever. <i>(turns and starts to walk off the docks)</i> I gotta go to work.       <br><b>Asami:</b> I better go check on my factory. <i>(Asami follows after Mako)</i>     <br><b>Korra:</b> I'm going to find out about this peace march. <i>(Korra walks off and Naga follows after her master)</i>     <br><b>Varrick:</b> And I am dying for a pedicure! <br><br><i>(He turns towards Zhu Li and lingers on her for a brief moment before touching her nose with his finger and turning away to walk off with Zhu Li following close behind.)</i>         <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> So, uh... what should I be doing?     <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(Cut to Mako's back as he walks away)</i> I don't know, Bolin. Figure something out. <br><br><i>(Camera zooms out to show Varrick stopping and turning back to Bolin. Cut to Bolin who looks off to the side with an expression of sadness on his face. Varrick slides in comically and places a hand on Bolin's shoulder.)</i>     <br><br><b>Varrick:</b> Say, kid, have you ever seen Republic City at <i>night</i>? <i>(Varrick raises his arm out to emphasize on his words and Pabu slinks into Bolin's tunic.)</i>     <br><b>Bolin:</b> Sure, I live here.      <br><b>Varrick:</b> <i>(brings his face close to Bolin's and his voice drops to a suspicious whisper)</i> Have you <i>really</i> seen it?      <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(looks away briefly, a little unsure but he returns his gaze back to Varrick quickly)</i> Y- no?            <br><b>Varrick:</b> <i>(chuckles heartily)</i> That's what I thought, come on.      <br><br><i>(With a hand on Bolin's shoulder, the duo begin to walk towards the camera.<br><br>Cut to a map of the Southern Water Tribe with a blue pointer on it.)</i>      <br><br><b>Northern General:</b> <i>(off screen)</i> Tonraq and the rebels <i>(the pointer is being lifted up and pressed down on one of the countour markings on the map)</i> are holed up here in the hills outside of town.     <br><br><i>(The pointer moves off screen and camera angle changes to a full view of Unalaq with both of his hands on the desk looking at the general.)</i>   <br><br><b>Unalaq:</b> Leave them. Cut to Mako's back view as he pursues the crooks but the building to his right suddenly explodes with fire from the higher floors down to the ground floor in sequence, shattering the windows. Mako stops in his tracks and we cut to a profile shot of him as he firebends the flames away.<br><br>Cut to the entrance of the cultural center as the rooftops explode. View changes to Korra who is looking back at the sudden disruption, her mouth is agape. Cut to an overhead view of the crowd as they look at the explosion with shocked expressions on their faces. The perspective changes to Lin who has a look of disbelief on her face, probably remembering the attacks Amon did to the city months ago. The police officers behind her are astonised too.<br><br>Cut to a Satomobile containing two Fire Nation crooks seated inside and one of their accomplices runs up to it, stopping as he spots Mako who has caught up to them in the background. View changes to a close up of Mako as he punches two shots of fire with his fist along with a roundhouse kick of fire towards the vehicle. Cut to the accomplice outside the car as he intercepts the flames and sends a volley back at Mako but an attack from Mako hits him in the chest and knocks him backwards. Cut to a sideview shot of the crook as he rolls to his knees and loses his hold of the electrical device as it bounces on the ground. Cut to an overhead shot as the Satomobile makes a hasty getaway around the corner but Mako is too far behind to apprehend them.<br><br>Cut to a close up of the device on the ground and we can see that it looks like a remote control with a red button and antenna at the top and a grey lever at the side. Cut to Tenzin who looks at his son with tenderness)</i>             <br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(softly)</i> I know. <br><br><i>(Scene changes to the outside of the Republic City Police Headquarters and the camera slowly zooms in.)</i>              <br><br><b>Raiko:</b> <i>(off screen)</i> How did this Cultural Center attack happen right under <i>your</i> nose? <i>(Cut to a close up of Raiko looking visibly annoyed)</i> And why haven't you arrested the Northerners responsible? <i>(Cut to a side view shot of Raiko and Lin standing face to face. If you don't get any results soon, <i>(Cut to the office area outside Lin's room as footsteps sound)</i> I'm going to find someone who can. <i>(Mako enters the frame and addresses two men seated together near Lin's office)</i>    <br><b>Mako:</b> I got a break in the bombing case. <i>(Cut to the back view of one of the men and Mako happily walks to their desks)</i> I I.D.'d the guy I saw at the scene.       <br><b>Lu:</b> <i>(The shorter of the two men with a long moustache addresses Mako by waving a hand up)</i> That's great, <i>(deliberately butchering Mako's name)</i> May-ko.      <br><b>Gang:</b> Yeah, <i>(swivels his chair to the side and points to Lin's office)</i> you better run that in to Bei Fong right now.      <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(uncertain)</i> You think?          <br><b>Lu:</b> <i>(patronizing)</i> Sure, <i>(spreads both arms out towards Mako)</i> you're gonna be a hero.    <br><br><i>(Mako looks at the picture for a second and then walks off screen to Lin's office. Lu and Gang share a secret victory handshake when Mako knocks on the door and we can hear it opening soon after. Lu and Gang turn their attention towards the Chief, waiting for drama.)</i><br><br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(off screen)</i> What makes a rookie beat cop think he can interrupt my meeting with the President?! <i>(Lu and Gang chuckle quietly while Lu has his face on the table, stifling his laughter)</i><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(off screen)</i> I'm sorry. I just- um, I found something out about the bombing.<br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(Lu and Gang keep laughing)</i> Well, give it to Lu and Gang, you moron. Now get out!  <br><br><i>(We can hear the door slam shut and Mako walks into screen again while both childish men put on nonchalant expressions.)</i>        <br><br><b>Lu:</b> <i>(mock apologizing)</i> Sorry, was she busy? <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(Mako ignores Lu and throws the photograph onto Gang's table and addresses him)</i> This is the guy I saw sneaking out of the building right before the explosions. The photograph of the suspected criminal falls on top of the book and Gang's hand enters the screen to push the drawer shut.<br><br>Cut to a side view angle of Mako talking to Gang.)</i> <br>           <br><b>Mako:</b> Did you learn anything about that remote control I found at the scene? That's gotta be the key to finding out who's really responsible.       <br><b>Lu:</b> Listen, <i>(leans his body forward and raises his hand to make a point)</i> kid, it was the Northern Water Tribe, okay? <i>(leans back in his seat)</i><br><b>Gang:</b> Yeah, give it a rest, super cop.        <br><br><i>(Mako turns and walks off screen. Cut to him taking a seat at his desk as he crosses his arms with irritation. The sound effect of a door opening is heard. The firebender turns his head to the side and perspective changes to a shot from Mako's side to reveal the President stepping out of Lin's office with his two bodyguards behind him. Raiko walks down the pathway and Mako stands up. Cut to an over the shoulder shot from behind Mako as Raiko stops in front of Mako's desk and turns towards him. His bodyguards follow suit.)</i>      <br><br><b>Raiko:</b> I've heard good things about you. You've made some big triad busts for a rookie.          <br><b>Mako:</b> Thank you, sir.           <br><b>Raiko:</b> And you're dating the Avatar, right?          <br><b>Mako:</b> Yes, sir.           <br><b>Raiko:</b> I'm concerned that <i>(Cut to a close up of Mako)</i> she might be getting some bad advice from Varrick. <i>(Perspective returns back to the President as the camera slowly pans to the side and serious music plays in the background)</i> You wouldn't happen to know if they're plotting anything that might compromise the security of Republic City, <i>(View returns back to Mako as he looks torn)</i> would you, officer? <i>(Mako looks to the side uneasily. Cut back to a close up of Raiko as he looks serious.)</i> Let me remind you that you've sworn an oath. You're a man of the law before anything else. <i>(Cut to a shot from behind Raiko and his guards looking at Mako)</i>      <br><b>Mako:</b> Yes, sir.           <br><b>Raiko:</b> Well, keep up the good work.   <br><br><i>(The President turns and starts to walk off screen with his bodyguards following shortly behind him. The music swells and Mako looks down and sighs.)</i><br>      <br><b>Mako:</b> Wait. <i>(Cut to a profile shot focusing on Mako with the President in the blurry background nearing the doors to the office.)</i> There's something you should know.        <br><br><i>(Camera focuses on the President now as Raiko turns to the side. Fade to black for commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b> <br><br><i>(Episode returns to a shot of a fleet of United Republic of Nations ships docked at the harbor.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(off screen)</i> Thank you for seeing me, General Iroh. <i>(Cut to an over the shoulder view from behind Korra looking at Iroh)</i>         <br><b>Iroh:</b> What can I do?        <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(Camera switches angles and focuses on Korra now)</i> The South needs military support before Unalaq wipes them out completely. But the President is refusing to give the order. <i>(Iroh turns away from Korra and puts a hand on his chin in thought)</i> So I decided to come to you directly.    <br><b>Iroh:</b> I see. Well, suppose I were to take the fleet South on some routine training maneuvers. And let's say we were to "accidentally" run into a hostile Northern blockade. <i>(He turns back to Korra)</i> We'd have no choice but to defend ourselves, wouldn't we? <br><b>Korra:</b> I guess you wouldn't. Thank you.              <br><b>Raiko:</b> <i>(Camera zooms out to reveal Raiko walking out from one of the ship's doors behind them)</i> Swapping old war stories? <i>(Korra turns to the side as Raiko stops next to her)</i>  <br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(salutes)</i> Mr. President. <i>(positions his arms behind his back to stand at attention)</i>       <br><b>Raiko:</b> I hope you're not planning to take any military action without an <i>order</i> from your commander-in-chief.  <br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(Cut to a close up of Iroh looking shocked)</i> Of course not, sir.      <br><b>Raiko:</b> <i>(View changes to the President as he speaks sternly)</i> Good, because if a single vessel leaves this harbor without my say-so, you'll be <i>court-martialed</i>. Am I clear?           <br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(camera angle returns back to Iroh as he looks serious)</i> Crystal, sir.         <br><b>Raiko:</b> <i>(Cut to a side view shot of the trio as Raiko turns to the Avatar)</i> Your activities <i>(Raiko crosses his arms while Korra has her arms akimbo)</i> here are bordering on insurrection. The Avatar does not command the military of the Republic. <i>(Points to Korra warningly as the Avatar looks to the side irritably)</i> <i>Don't</i> go behind my back again. <i>(Raiko turns towards Iroh)</i> As you were, General Iroh. <br><br><i>(The President walks off-screen and Korra glares daggers at Raiko. Cut to an over the shoulder shot from behind Korra as Raiko and his bodyguards slam the door to the ship shut. Korra turns towards Iroh)</i> <br>        <br><b>Korra:</b> I hate that guy!          <br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(Cut to Iroh looking apologetic)</i> I'm sorry, my hands are officially tied.  <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(View changes back to Korra as her expression softens slightly)</i> I understand. <i>(looks to the side, defeated)</i> Thanks anyway.        <br><b>Iroh:</b> <i>(Camera returns back to Iroh as he gets optimistic)</i> But you should talk to the Fire Lord. My mother and grandfather have always been good friends to the Avatar and the Southern Water Tribe. I'm sure they'll be willing to help.     <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(Cut back to Korra as she gives a smile)</i> Thank you, General.  <br><br><i>(Scene changes to someone's point of view as he forms the shape of a frame with his two hands. Spotlights shine on him and the camera points towards Bolin.)</i><br><br><b>Varrick:</b> Ah, Nuktuk is never cold.   <br><br><i>(View changes to Bolin as the sound of footsteps is heard. Ginger walks into the frame.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Ooh. <i>(attempts to act suave)</i> Hey, Ginger.          <br><b>Varrick:</b> <i>(Cut to Varrick as Ginger stands beside him and flips her hair. No one knew about it except for us and Asami.    <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(happily)</i> And Mako. <i>(Korra's mouth is agape)</i>        <br><b>Korra:</b> Mako? <i>(She turns towards Bolin angrily)</i>            <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(confused)</i> What? <i>(gives a reassuring smile)</i> There's no way Mako would have told. <i>(Korra turns away from the earthbender and we can see she is still visibly angry)</i> Right?                  <br><br><i>(The Avatar runs off screen.<br><br>Scene changes to a close up of Poki the lemur as he purrs and blinks. Training makes me tired. <i>(waves an arm to his lemur)</i> Come on, Poki. <br><br><i>(He runs off screen and Poki flies behind him. The camera trembles and shakes. cut to the dark spirit as it roars and opens its arms apart. It swipes a tendril towards Korra. Cut to Korra as she jumps and dodges the attack before increasing the length of the water spout to make it taller. One of the tendrils swipes at the water column and Korra is left hanging in the air. cut to under water as the Avatar falls harshly into the water. A split second later, her eyes glow to indicate that she has activated the Avatar State.<br><br>Cut to the surface of the water and Korra rises up with a bubble of water under her feet. Cut to a wide angle back shot of Korra as she moves her arms around and a helix of water forms around the dark spirit in an attempt to calm it. The helix starts to glow green. Cut to a close up of Korra in the Avatar State as she continues to move her arms in circles above her head. View returns back to the previous angle and we can see the dark spirit's body slowly turning green from the bottom up.<br><br>The spirit slowly sinks down into the water and the green energy is about to cover its head before it breaks out of the trance, stands up, and roars. Cut to a profile shot of Korra out of the Avatar State and she looks up at the spirit uncertainly. Perspective returns back to the dark spirit as it growls and opens its mouth before diving downwards. View returns back to Korra as she brings both of her knuckles together before firebending towards the monster. Camera zooms out rapidly and the spirit is undeterred by the flames and proceeds to seemingly swallow Korra whole before disappearing into the ocean quickly. A huge swell of water forms on the surface from the aftermath of the force. <br><br>Cut to an aerial shot of Desna and Eska watching the tide dissipate. Cut to a frontal shot of the siblings as they exchange a look before swinging their hands backwards to 'ski' away, leaving tiny waves behind them. Camera zooms out to a wide overhead shot of the water and focuses on the ripples where the dark spirit disappeared.)</i> <br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
