Unalaq has been defeated and the Northern fleet is returning home. The Water Tribes will <i>always</i> be allies, but the Southern Tribe is now independent! And the Southern Council of Elders has appointed my father, Tonraq, to be your new Chief! <i>(the crowd cheers as Tonraq steps forward and waves)</i> I've realized that even though we should learn from those who came before us, we must also forge our own path. So that is why I've decided to keep the portals open. <i>(we see Bum-Ju on Bumi's shoulder and he chirps)</i> Humans can now physically enter the Spirit World and spirits will be <i>free</i> to roam our world. I will no longer be the bridge. Humans and spirits must <i>learn</i> to live together. My mission will always be to use Raava's light spirit to guide the world toward peace and balance. Harmonic Convergence has caused a shift in the planet's energy, I can feel it. Things will never be the same again. We are entering a new age.<br><br><i>(Cut to a wide shot of the palace. The camera tilts up to the aurora in the sky, and we see various spirits flying above. Bum-Ju chirps and flies past the camera.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
<b>A Breath of Fresh Air</b><br><b>Written By:</b> Tim Hedrick<br><b>Directed By:</b> Melchior Zwyer<br><b>Storyboard By:</b> Melchior Zwyer, Hyunjoo Song, Sol Choi<br><b>Animation By:</b> Studio Mir<br><b>Transcriber:</b> Icy_Ashford<br><br><br><br><i>[Previously on "The Legend of Korra" sequence, including clips from "Light in the Dark".]</i>                    <br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> The World has entered a new age. Harmonic Convergence created an energy shift the likes of which has never been felt before. And after two weeks, Republic City continues to recover from Korra's epic battle with Unavaatu. Vines have sprouted up all over, creating pockets of wilds the spirits have come to call home. What other changes are in store for our city?          <br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b>                       <br><br><i>(Episode opens to an aerial view of Air Temple Island. Cut to a close up of Bum-Ju and it turns and flies away. Running footsteps are heard and Bumi is seen chasing after the bunny spirit.)</i>       <br><br><b>Bumi:</b> Come back, Bum-Ju!   <br><br><i>(Switch to a side view shot of a tree and Bum-Ju hovers on top of a branch extending outwards. Bumi climbs up the tree trunk and onto the branch. Bum-Ju thrills and camera cuts to a desperate looking Bumi.)</i> <br> <br><b>Bumi:</b> If you don't <i>(pulls out a small pink sweater)</i> wanna wear the sweater I made you, that's fine. I'm <i>sorry</i> I got mad.  <br><br><i>(Return back to the previous shot as Bumi eases himself forward, reaching out to Bum-Ju but the spirit flies out of his reach. The branch begins to bend downwards from Bumi's weight.)</i>    <br><br><b>Bumi:</b> Bum-Ju, I'm running out of tree. <i>(looks to Bum-Ju)</i> Can we go down now? <i>(the tree branch splits, leaving a little sliver of wood stuck to the tree trunk. Bumi slides down the branch and grasps the end of it. Cut to an overhead shot of Bumi and we can see a strip of sand below, quite a distance away from his position.)</i> Bum-Ju, a little help?   <br><br><i>(The branch starts to fully break, lowering Bumi as it does. Bum-Ju thrills and bites the back of Bumi's military coat but his arms slip out of the coat, causing him to fall.)</i><br><br><b>Bumi:</b> Ah! Ahh!    <br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of Bumi as he thrusts his palms out and he bends a gust of air. He opens his eyes and is surprised. Switch to a profile shot of Bumi hovering a little above the sand with his airbending and Bum-Ju slowly descends to Bumi with his coat.)</i>      <br>    <br><b>Bumi:</b> <i>(to Bum-Ju)</i> Look! I'm airbending. <i>(the airbending stops and he falls to the ground flat on his face)</i> Ow! Wow, that still hurt a lot.   <br><br><i>(Scene changes to a water droplet falling onto a leaf in the forest. Camera pans right to show Korra with a glider staff in hand walking under a bunch of roots followed by Tenzin. Jinora runs after them and a group of spirits appear behind the girl. Cut to an overhead shot of the forest to reveal trees growing out of some buildings.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> How are we ever gonna clear away all these vines?  <br><br><i>(Cut back to the ground and Korra twirls her staff behind her before thrusting her palm out, bending out a big cloud of fire towards some vines. The spirits behind Jinora suddenly disappear. The vines retreat and we cut to the inside of a doorway that was previously covered in vines. However, the tendrils of the plants creep back to the doorway more forcefully than ever. Cut to an exasperated Korra and Jinora can be seen comforting her spirit friends in the background.)</i> <br>       <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(frustrated)</i> Ugh! <i>(Jinora and Tenzin turn towards her)</i> I don't get it! I can vanquish Vaatu, <i>(walks away off-screen)</i> but not a bunch of stupid vines?<br><b>Tenzin:</b> I'm sure you'll find a way.          <br><b>Jinora:</b> Why do you wanna get rid of them? You changed the World. We're connected with the spirits again. The wilds are their home. <br><br><i>(Cut to Korra approaching a bunch of vines hanging down and we can see light from behind them.)</i><br>      <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(smiles wryly at Jinora)</i> I don't think the people who used to live here are as excited about it as you are.           <br><br><i>(Korra uses her glider stick to push aside a curtain of vines, revealing bright sunlight. Shot changes the outside to reveal that the Spirit Wilds have sprung up in the middle of a neighbourhood in Republic City.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I gotta <i>(Korra releases the wings on her glider)</i> go face the press and tell them I still don't have a way to get rid of the vines. <i>(Korra starts to run off to gain momentum)</i> This should be fun.       <br><br><i>(View changes to the back of Tenzin's and Jinora's heads as they watch Korra take off to the air with her glider.<br><br>Location changes to City Hall that is covered in vines as well. There seems to be a press conferencing going on.)</i><br><br><b>Male Reporter #1:</b> Mr. President, are you concerned that your <i>(switch to a close up to the podium where Raiko is standing. Lin along with her police force stand guard beside and behind him)</i> approval ratings are now nearly as low as the Avatar's? <i>(cut to a close up of the reporter with a feathered hat and he speaks with his hand raised in the air)</i> Have you seen today's headline? It says, "Raik-Oh-No. Polls pan, Prez plans!"    <br><br><i>(View switches to the president.)</i> <br><br><b>Raiko:</b> I'm not concerned with snappy put-downs in the press. I'm facing this calamity just like <i>every</i> other citizen. <i>(cut to a profile shot of the president as he points to a vine coming out of City Hall)</i> There's a tree growing right through my <i>office</i>. You think I'm not doing everything I can to get rid of it?  <br><br><i>(Korra flies in on her glider from the side and the president turns his attention towards her. Korra creates a cloud of air to cushion her landing, messing up Raiko's hair and his glasses. Raiko looks peeved by her entrance. There's murmuring amongst the reporters from Korra's appearance.)</i>  <br><br><b>Reporter in Crowd:</b> A few questions, please!       <br><b>Male Reporter #2:</b> Avatar Korra! <i>(the President pushes his glasses back into place)</i> Do you regret the way <i>(Raiko pushes a hand up to smooth his hair back)</i> you handled the Unalaq crisis? <br><br><i>(View returns to the reporters as a camera flash goes off. A female reporter in a navy blue hat raises her hand.)</i><br><br><b>Female Reporter #1:</b> Why are you forcing the integration of spirits in Republic City?           <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(places a hand on her chest)</i> Listen, I've been trying everything I can think of  to get rid of these vines, but-              <br><b>Male Reporter #3:</b> <i>(interrupts)</i> Why can't you fix this?      <br><br><i>(Cut to a reporter with a camera in hand.)</i> <br><br><b>Male Reporter #4:</b> Are the vines here to stay?  <br><br><i>(Cut to another female reporter.)</i><br><br><b>Female Reporter #2:</b> Is this part of  your New World Order?    <br><br><i>(Switch to a close up of Korra.)</i>  <br><br><b>Korra:</b> Look! Harmonic Convergence was just a couple weeks ago. I just need a little more time to get everything back to normal.         <br><b>Raiko:</b> <i>(speaks suddenly)</i> The Avatar <i>(camera pans left to the podium)</i> has put us all in a very difficult position, <i>(Korra looks confused)</i> but my administration-     <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(irritably interrupts)</i> Oh! I'm sorry. <i>(Raiko turns to her)</i> Did I put you <i>(walks to the President)</i> in a difficult position by fighting <i>(cut to a close up profile shot of Raiko as Korra gets in his face)</i> the giant force of Pure Evil that was going to destroy the whole World? <i>(grabs Raiko by the chin)</i> Maybe your administration <i>(moves his chin up and down slightly)</i> could've handled that! <i>(Raiko and Korra glare angrily at each other)</i>    <br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(separates Korra and Raiko apart)</i> That's all! No more questions! <br><br><i>(The President storms back into City Hall and Lin gives Korra a look. Switch to a profile shot of Korra as the reporters stream past her. Asami walks up to her friend.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> This is a disaster.      <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(reassuringly)</i>  Don't worry, we'll figure something out.   <br><b>Korra:</b> Easy for you to say. <i>(Asami is a little appalled)</i> You don't have my poll numbers. Eight percent approval? Who were they asking?      <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(comforts Korra)</i> You can't take that to heart. People are just frustrated.   <br><b>Korra:</b> I don't blame them. I should be able to fix this. I'm the Avatar.         <br><br><i>(Cut to Ikki and Meelo playing with Pabu in the courtyard on Air Temple Island. Bumi runs into screen to his nephew and niece. He stops, panting to catch his breath.)</i><br><br><b>Bumi:</b> You are not gonna believe what just happened. Where's your father?      <br><b>Ikki:</b> <i>(hollers)</i> Daaad! <br><br><i>(Cut to a set of doors opening to reveal Tenzin.)</i>            <br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(looks around worriedly)</i> What is it? What's wrong?     <br><br><i>(He runs forward and camera angle changes to the walkway leading out to the courtyard. Tenzin is followed by Jinora, Pema with Rohan carried on her back, and Kya.)</i>     <br><br><b>Bumi:</b> <i>(excitedly runs to his brother)</i> The most amazing, wondrous, fantastical thing just occurred. Okay, Bum-Ju and I had <i>(punches his fist together)</i> a little fight. I made him <i>(does a knitting action with his hands)</i> this sweater, and he didn't seem to like it. And I'll admit it might need work, but it was my first attempt at knitting. So I was <i>(rests his hands on his chest)</i> a little hurt.   <br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Tenzin who isn't amused.)</i>  <br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(deadpans)</i> Hilarious. <i>(turns around and walks away)</i> Time for dinner, everyone.      <br><br><i>(Switch back to Bumi with his niece and nephew standing by his side.)</i><br><br><b>Bumi:</b> No! Check this out. <i>(brings his arms up to his waist)</i> I can airbend! <i>(thrusts his palms out but nothing happens and he repeats it a few times)</i> Yeah, wait. <i>(Ikki and Meelo look disappointed)</i> Seriously. I was doing it. <i>(Bumi does punching movements again but Ikki and Meelo just walk off)</i> Oh, hold on. I just... Maybe if I... <i>(kicks his leg up)</i> No.           <br><br><i>(Cut to food on the dinner table.)</i><br><br><b>Bumi:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> I swear I'm not making it up! <br><br><i>(Camera pans across the dinner table as Bumi makes several offensive motions with his arms. Bolin can be seen nonchalantly eating his food beside the ex-commander.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(frowns)</i> Stop waving your arms around at the table. It's not funny anymore.  <br><br><i>(Camera zooms out to a full view of the dining room as Korra and Asami walk in.)</i>   <br><br><b>Bumi:</b> <i>(crosses his arms)</i> It's <i>not</i> a joke.          <br><br><b>Korra:</b> What's up with him? <i>(sits down beside Bolin)</i>     <br><b>Bolin:</b> Bumi says he airbended earlier, but he can't now. <i>(Korra looks surprised)</i> Oh, and I guess he's not very good at knitting either. I gotta say, I love being a part of this family. <i>(cut to a shot of Tenzin with a vein pulsing on his head)</i> You got the grumpy dad, <i>(cut to Bumi trying to airbend)</i> the wacky uncle. <i>(cut to slightly stressed Pema with Rohan wailing in her arms)</i> The put-upon Mom, <i>(switch to Tenzin's three older children and Meelo tries to entertain his sisters by shoving chopsticks in his mouth to look like a beaver)</i> crazy kids. <i>(view returns back to Bolin and Korra with Asami in the background)</i> This is great. <i>(Jinora takes a bite from her bowl of rice)</i>         <br><b>Asami:</b> Where's Mako?         <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(puts his rice bowl down)</i> Oh, you mean the brooding teenager? He's staying at the police station.     <br><b>Korra:</b> Still?            <br><b>Bolin:</b> I told him Tenzin invited us to stay here since our apartment is a vine habitat now, but he said <i>(runs a hand into his fringe and pushes it up to look like Mako's hairdo)</i> he had to focus on work.   <br><br><i>(Bolin uses his hand to returns his hair back to normal and camera pans left to Bumi with his hands outstretched towards a napkin.)</i>      <br> <br><b>Bumi:</b> Oh! Did you see that? I think the napkin moved!       <br><b>Kya:</b> <i>(dryly)</i> You blew on it.           <br><b>Bumi:</b> Wait! <i>(puts a hand on his chin in thought)</i> Maybe I can only do it when my life is in danger. Bolin, <i>(gets into a bending stance with his arms)</i> bend a giant boulder at me.           <br><b>Bolin:</b> Yeah, I don't think that's a good idea.  <br><br><i>(Camera pans out to a full view of the dining table and we can see Tenzin with his hands on his face.)</i>     <br><br><b>Pema:</b> If you're gonna be bending giant boulders, you can do it outside.     <br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(slams both hands on the table)</i> No one is bending giant boulders! <i>(Meelo stands up)</i>         <br><b>Meelo:</b> <i>(slams a hand down on the table)</i> Look alive, <i>(a plate is thrown up from the force)</i> Uncle Bumi!<br><br><i>(Meelo grabs the plate and tosses it. Camera follows the plate and we cut to Bumi as he shuts his eyes and moves his hands in front of him protectively. A bubble of air surrounds the plate.)</i>       <br><br><b>Bumi:</b> Ah! <i>(opens his eyes)</i> I told you! <br><br><i>(Camera cuts to Kya and Meelo with their jaws dropped. View changes to Bolin, Korra, Ikki, Jinora, and Asami who are all equally astonished. Cut to Tenzin and his wife. Rohan looks happy and entertained.)</i>          <br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(in awe)</i> Unbelievable. You're actually an airbender.  <br><br><i>(Switch to a full view of the dining room again as Bumi continues to balance the spinning plate within the swirling bubble of air.)</i><br><br><b>Bumi:</b> Wait until I tell Mom. She's gonna love this.     <br><br><i>(Bumi stops airbending and the plate falls and shatters on the dining table. Everyone looks down at fragmented plate. Cut to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode returns to a shot of the Republic City police station at night. Cut to a phone ringing on a desk in the station. The table moves up and we can hear someone bumping into it from under the table.)</i> <br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Ow! <br><br><i>(A hand reaches up to find the phone on the table and Mako pushes himself into view a few moments later, his hair is all messed up and he's in his pajamas. He rubs his head for a second before picking up the phone.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Police. <i>(change to a view from the other side of Mako's desk and we can see a mattress under the table)</i> He what? Slow down. Okay, I'm on my way.      <br><br><i>(Scene changes to the camera facing the door. We can see a wrecked shelf with broken glass off to the side. The door slides open to reveal Mako in his police uniform.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(walks in and looks around)</i> What the heck <i>(view changes to the back of Mako's head looking into the shop and we can see the shopkeeper trying to tidy up his shop littered with debris)</i> did all this?   <br><b>Shopkeeper:</b> <i>(throws his mop aside and runs up to Mako)</i> It was my brother. He's out of control!      <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(pulls out a notepad from his side pouch)</i> Okay, just tell me what happened. <i>(pulls out the pencil)</i>         <br><b>Shopkeeper:</b> We were arguing about the books, <i>(Mako jots down on the notepad)</i> and Daw was yelling at me, and all of a sudden things started flying around! He was creating this storm like...             <br><b>Mako:</b> Like what?          <br><b>Shopkeeper:</b> Well, like he was airbending.     <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(raises an eyebrow)</i> Sir... That's impossible. There are only <i>five</i> airbenders in the entire World, and your brother is not one of them.       <br><b>Shopkeeper:</b> I know what I saw. He was freaking out, yelling, "What's happening to me?!" Then, <i>(gestures to the back of the shop)</i> he ran into the back room and locked himself in.       <br><br><i>(Switch to the back room's door as Mako walks up to it and knocks.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Police. Open up.          <br><b>Daw:</b> <i>(off-screen, voice muffled from being inside the room)</i> Go away!              <br><b>Mako:</b> Get out here, Sir, or I'm knocking this door down. <i>(cut to a frontal shot of Mako's face as he gets serious)</i> One... Two... <br><br><i>(A gust of air comes into view and Mako is slammed backwards a few feet by the door. He falls to the ground with the door on top of him. Cut to Daw who is perspiring and shaking.)</i>            <br><br><b>Daw:</b> Ah! <i>(clutches his head)</i> I'm so sorry!  <br><br><i>(He runs off, past Mako on the floor, and out of the door. Daw accidentally jumps up with airbending, still screaming in fright. Mako sits up and pushes the door off him. His face is red from the impact.)</i>        <br><br><b>Shopkeeper:</b> <i>(runs and squats down next to Mako)</i> I told you! Airbending! <i>(Mako rubs his face and sighs)</i>          <br><br><i>(Scene changes to the next morning with Kya looking at Bumi attempting to airbend in the courtyard on Air Temple Island. Switch to a full view of the courtyard as everyone spectates. Bumi tries valiantly to airbend but nothing happens.)</i><br><br><b>Bumi:</b> Ugh! I can't figure this thing out! <br><br><i>(Cut to a close up profile shot of Korra and Tenzin.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Do you think being in the Spirit World during Harmonic Convergence could have given him bending?     <br><b>Tenzin:</b> I suppose it's <i>possible</i>.     <br><b>Ikki:</b> <i>(cut to Ikki seated on the ground)</i> Maybe Uncle Bumi is just a late bloomer.     <br><br><i>(Return back to Bumi and his sister. Kya stretches her arms forward and moves it in the air in front of Bumi.)</i><br><br><b>Kya:</b> I have been noticing a change in your aura lately.  <br><b>Bumi:</b> And you didn't tell me?    <br><br><i>(Bumi steps off and continues to do airbending movements. Kya is disappointed by his behavior. From behind her, Lin and Mako walk in. Both cops stare at Bumi's antics.)</i>   <br><br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(walks to Tenzin and turns around to continue looking at Bumi)</i> Invisible spirit monster attack?     <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Lin! You won't believe this. Bumi just started airbending. <br><br><i>(Lin and Mako raise their eyebrows and they look at each other. They then turn around to face Tenzin.)</i> <br><br><b>Lin:</b> I'm afraid he's not the <i>only</i> one.     <br><b>Tenzin, Korra, and Asami:</b> <i>(simultaneously)</i> What?              <br><b>Mako:</b> I got a call last night about a guy who just started <i>airbending</i> out of nowhere.      <br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(walks towards the cops)</i> You mean there's another one? Where is he now?        <br><b>Mako:</b> He... blew a door down on me and got away. We've got an all-points bulletin out on him right now. <i>(Lin and Mako start to walk off)</i>     <br><b>Korra:</b> Wait, <i>(Mako stops in his tracks)</i> we'll help you look for him. Where should we start?     <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(rubs the back of his neck)</i> Oh, well, <i>(walks to Korra)</i> you know, you should... <i>(awkwardly)</i> You should leave it to the police. It's... police business, you know. It's, um... official.   <br><br><i>(Switch to a view of Tenzin, Asami, and Korra looking at Mako with incredulous looks.)</i>   <br><br><b>Korra:</b> Okay. <i>(Tenzin sticks out his tongue and comically slides off-screen)</i> How are you doing? You know you're welcome to stay here instead of sleeping at the police station.     <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(still awkward)</i> No, <i>(gives a forced smile)</i> I'm fine. I should just... get... <i>(glances at Korra and Asami nervously)</i> going. So! As you were... <i>(salutes)</i> Ladies. <br><br><i>(Mako walks off stiffly. Asami and Korra share a look.<br><br>Location changes to an area near the docks where Korra and Asami walk up to Asami's Satomobile.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> This is so exciting! <i>(cut to a close up of the car as Korra walks to the passenger's seat.)</i> New airbenders in the city? I bet we can find that guy before Mako does. <i>(Asami tosses a set of car keys over to Korra from off-screen and Korra catches it, looking at the keys uncertainly)</i> You know I'm not very good at this.      <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(cut to a close up of Asami who smiles)</i> You're the Avatar, master of all the elements. You should know how to drive. Besides, <i>(flips her hair)</i> it's <i>relaxing</i>.     <br><br><i>(Camera fades to a shot of Asami looking terrified as the Satomobile moves.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> Clutch! <i>(the vehicle brakes and jerks suddenly)</i> Clutch! <i>(the car jerks again)</i> <br><br><i>(Cut to a full view of the Satomobile as it keeps inching forward and jerking. Another vehicle brakes suddenly behind them and horns. Cut to a frontal shot of the girls.)</i>                <br><br><b>Asami:</b> That's the brake. <i>(looks to Korra)</i> Let's try again. <i>(Korra glances at her friend nervously)</i> You ready? <br><br><i>(The vehicle behinds them horns in an "ahwooga" noise. Korra gives a salute, surprising Asami a bit. The girls laugh and the car still honks impatiently.)</i>             <br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(turns the ignition key)</i> How long do you think talking to Mako is going to be like pulling teeth?       <br><b>Asami:</b> Well, Mako <i>(the Satomobile behind decides to change lanes and move past them)</i> has never been the most <i>(switch to profile shots of the girls as an old man in the Satomobile glares at them)</i> "in touch with his feelings" guy. <i>(Korra begins to drive forward)</i> But, it'll get better eventually.           <br><b>Korra:</b> So when I was gone, did he tell you that we broke up?           <br><b>Asami:</b> Yeah. We all knew. Sorry.             <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(blushes)</i> That's pretty embarrassing.  <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(gets uncomfortable)</i> Actually, I need to tell you something about that, <i>(awkwardly)</i> and I should've told you this sooner, but...While you were gone, I... kind of... kissed him. I'm sorry. <i>(looks to Asami)</i>              <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(laughs)</i> No wonder he's so nervous around us.              <br><b>Asami:</b> You're not mad?         <br><b>Korra:</b> No! I mean, I kissed Mako when he was going out with you, so. <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(frowns)</i> You what?           <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(aghast)</i> I'm so sorry! I thought you knew!       <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(gives a sly smile)</i> I'm just kidding. I knew a long time ago.     <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(relaxes her posture and laughs)</i> Well, whatever happened with Mako, I'm glad it hasn't come between us. <i>(switch back to a frontal shot of the girls)</i> I've never had a girl friend to hang out with and talk to before, except for Naga. <i>(looks to Asami)</i> This is nice.      <br><br><i>(Asami notices something in front of them and she exclaims.)</i>    <br><br><b>Asami:</b> Vine! Vine!          <br><br><i>(Korra tugs on the steering wheel and the Satomobile swerves, stopping just in time in front of a huge vine habitat. A porcupine-like spirit materializes on top of the vine and Asami gasps.)</i><br><br><b>Fruithog:</b> Hey! Watch where you're going!       <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(points to the spirit)</i> What are you doing <i>(stands up)</i> living in the middle of the road in the first place?       <br><b>Fruithog:</b> <i>(puts a hand on its chest)</i> Don't ask me, Avatar. <i>(points to Korra)</i> <i>You</i> made the world this way, we're just living in it.  <br><b>Korra:</b> Look, I don't have anything against spirits, but <i>(points to the Spirit Wilds)</i> these vines are causing <i>major</i> problems all over the city.          <br><b>Fruithog:</b> Spirits? Vines? <i>(turns away)</i> We're all the same. Seems like the Avatar would <i>know</i> that. <i>(walks away and disappears)</i>       <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(Korra sits down in the driver's seat in thought)</i> Korra, you okay?          <br><b>Korra:</b> I think that spirit just gave me an idea how to get rid of these vines. <i>(puts a hand on her chin)</i> But I'm gonna need a lot of water.       <br><i>(Cut to Tenzin sitting down on a hill overlooking Avatar Aang Memorial Island.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> It's like a dream, Dad. After 170 years, new airbenders.         <br><b>Ikki:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Dad? <i>(Tenzin turns to the side. Switch to a full view of Tenzin as his children run up to him. Ikki leaps onto Tenzin's lap while Meelo sits on his father's shoulders)</i> When a new guy gets airbending, <i>(Jinora takes a seat beside Tenzin)</i> does that make him our brother?          <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Well, in a way, all airbenders are our family. <br><br><i>(Camera zooms in a little closer on them.)</i><br><br><b>Ikki:</b> Does that mean I have to share my room? Because I like my personal space.          <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Of course not. But we might have to get used to not being the only airbenders around any more.        <br><b>Meelo:</b> I hope we have enough for an army. <i>(jumps off Tenzin's shoulders)</i> I wanna be a commander like Uncle Bumi.        <br><b>Jinora:</b> Air Nomads don't have armies, Meelo.             <br><b>Tenzin:</b> But maybe there will be <i>(tears well up in his eyes)</i> enough to fill the temples again.      <br><b>Jinora:</b> <i>(looks worriedly at Tenzin)</i> What's wrong, Daddy?     <br><b>Tenzin:</b> I just wish your grandfather were here to see this.    <br><br><i>(Cut to Meelo with his grandfather's statue behind him in the background.)</i> <br><br><b>Meelo:</b> Will you be Airbender President?      <br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(cut to Tenzin as he shakes his head)</i> No. But I think the new airbenders will need lots of help and guidance to understand what it means to be a part of our nation. <i>(switch back to Meelo who listens in awe)</i> That's a <i>big</i> responsibility.   <br><b>Meelo:</b> <i>(smiles)</i> Don't worry, Dad. <i>(walks towards Tenzin with his arms wide open)</i> We'll help you.<br><br><i>(Return back to a full shot of the family as Meelo embraces his father. Ikki and Jinora join in the group hug.)</i>         <br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> I know you will. <i>(Tenzin puts his arms around his children)</i>          <br><br><i>(Scene changes to an apartment complex covered in vines in Republic City. Camera pans down to Korra with her glider standing on a bridge along with Bolin and Lin. Cut to a close up of Korra.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I hope <i>(people can be seen approaching her from the back)</i> this works.     <br><br><i>(Camera pans to the side to show Raiko and a few reporters behind her as the trio on the bridge turn their heads towards them.)</i> <br><br><b>Korra:</b> What are you guys doing here?           <br><b>Raiko:</b> I was alerted that you had a new plan to wipe out these noxious weeds. <i>(gives a smile)</i> So I thought you'd want everyone to be here to watch.  <br><b>Male Reporter #1:</b> <i>(raises his hand)</i> Avatar Korra! <i>(cut to Korra who is irritable)</i> Do you really think-      <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(interrupts and puts her hand up)</i> No questions! Just stand there. Silently!      <br><br><i>(Switch to a full view of the bridge as Korra walks forward. Mystical music begins to play. Cut to a frontal shot of Korra with her eyes closed. Return back to a view of the bridge as two streams of water come out from the river and head up towards the vines. Return back to a view of the bridge as the vines completely retreat into the water along with the water helixes. Cut to a profile shot of Korra bowing.)</i>         <br><br><b>Korra:</b> Go in peace.          <br><br><i>(Korra exhales and running footsteps are heard. Camera pans left to the reporters behind her.)</i><br><br><b>Male Reporter #2:</b> How did you know what to do? <i>(Korra turns to them with a look of disbelief)</i>           <br><b>Male Reporter #1:</b> Will you send the spirits away now?               <br><b>Female Reporter #1:</b> How soon can we expect public water service to resume? <br><br><i>(The ground and camera shakes suddenly and vines suddenly pop out from the water. Korra looks up and cut back to a view of the bridge as vines return back to encase the complex. The vines are thicker and more in number this time. The creepers also head towards another apartment complex on the other side of the bridge and we cut to a child looking out the window as the vines move up the building. The little boy reels back in shock.<br><br>Switch to a full view of the complex as the vines completely cover it and brings the building down slightly. Return back to the bridge as the reporters scramble.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Look out! <i>(Korra grabs her glider.)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to Raiko as two bodyguards quickly pull him way. Cut to Lin and Bolin running up to the collapsing complex and they earthbend two support pillars to stop it from falling. Switch to the inside of the complex looking out at the entrance as Korra bursts the door down with airbending. Cut to a view of the citizens inside the first floor. Cut to a profile shot of Korra.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Let's go, people. <i>(the residents run and scramble past her)</i> Hurry!  <br><br><i>(Cut to the outside of the complex as the people quickly leave. Korra opens her glider and flies up. She lands on a vine where the little boy from before looks out the window. Korra extends a hand to the boy and she gazes up, gasping. Switch to a view from the bottom looking up as part of the roof tears away from the building and starts to fall. The boy jumps into Korra's arms.)</i>           <br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(holds the boy)</i> Hang on!      <br><br><i>(The Avatar jumps down with her glider in hand and we cut to the ground as they land. Korra lets go of her staff and rolls on the ground before moving her arms up. Korra uses airbending to catch the falling roof and the citizens scramble. She slowly lowers her hands in an attempt to set the roof down as gently as possible. The roof makes contact with the ground with a thud. Cut to an overhead view of the carnage as Bolin and Lin walk up to Korra. Switch to a close up of the trio and the both earthbenders have their arms crossed.)</i>      <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(dryly)</i> I think that could've gone better.      <br><br><i>(Cut to commercial break)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode returns to a shot of the meditation pavilion in Air Temple Island near evening. Cut to a back view shot of Korra seated on the floor of the pavilion in the lotus position. Tenzin walks into frame behind Korra.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Can't talk. Meditating.        <br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of Korra with her eyes closed.)</i>   <br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> You must be at the end of your rope. You <i>hate</i> meditating.        <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(opens her eyes and slumps her shoulders)</i> I thought that if I <i>really</i> tried I might be able to contact my <i>(stands up)</i> past Avatars, <i>(walks up to the railing)</i> someone who knows something to help me. But I can't. They're gone, and I'm all alone. <i>(Tenzin walks up to her and Korra turns around)</i> Did I ruin everything by leaving the spirit portals open?     <br><b>Tenzin:</b> You didn't ruin anything. You did what you thought was best for the World, <i>(walks to Korra and rests a hand on her shoulder)</i> and now things have changed. Change can be good or bad. Depending on your point of view.     <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(sighs and shrugs off his hand)</i> I know <i>(walks forward slightly)</i> the people's point of view. It's bad.               <br><b>Tenzin:</b> You're not the President, Korra. Your job isn't to fix the daily problems of every person in Republic City. Your responsibility is to bring <i>balance</i> to the entire World. And that means no matter what you do, <i>some</i> people <i>(Korra sits back on the floor again)</i> are not going to be happy about it.      <br><b>Korra:</b> Great.            <br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(walks up to Korra)</i> In the other hand, <i>(sits next to the Avatar)</i> some people will be <i>very</i> happy. Like me. <i>(Tenzin turns to his student and she looks up at him)</i> What you did during Harmonic Convergence may have brought back the Air Nation. And that can only be good for restoring balance. That is the act of a <i>great</i> Avatar.          <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(looks away in thought)</i> It's scary. I have all this power and all these people depending on me, <i>(hugs her knees to her chest)</i> but I don't know what I'm supposed to be <i>doing</i> half the time. <i>(cut to a back view shot of the two in the pavilion)</i> It seems like I should be... wiser.             <br><b>Tenzin:</b> True wisdom begins when we accept things as they are. You started a new age, Korra. <i>(running footsteps are heard)</i> There's no going back to the past.  <br><br><i>(Bolin's legs enter the screen.)</i>        <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Mako called! <i>(cut to a frontal shot of Bolin)</i> The cops found the new airbender guy. But when they tried to bring him in, <i>(twirls his fingers in a circular motion)</i> he ran away and climbed to the top of Kyoshi Bridge and he won't come down. Ooh! Sorry. Did I interrupt an Avatar wisdom session?       <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(walks up to Bolin)</i> Avatar wisdom is a thing of the past, <i>(rests a hand on his shoulder)</i> Bolin. Come on! <i>(walks off and Tenzin follows)</i>   <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(rubs the back of his head)</i> Oh, okay. Is that a good thing?      <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(off screen)</i> Depends who you ask. <i>(Bolin runs off-screen)</i>    <br><br><i>(Cut to an aerial view of Kyoshi Bridge as Oogi flies into screen carrying Tenzin, Korra, and Bolin on its back. Korra and others join them.)</i><br><br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(raises a megaphone and speaks into it)</i> Come down immediately, <i>(camera angle changes to a view of the bridge)</i> or we will be forced to take action.         <br><br><i>(Cut to Daw at the top of the bridge standing on one of the ledges. I don't know what I'm doing, and I don't wanna <i>hurt</i> anyone. <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(softens)</i> Tell me about it. Rough day, huh? I'm having kind of a rough day myself. <i>(points down)</i> You mind if I sit down here? <br><br><i>(Cut to Daw as he continues to make frightened sounds.)</i> <br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Look, <i>(cut a frontal shot of the two as Korra sits down)</i> I know you're scared. You've gone through a big change, and it's kind of my fault. <i>(switch to a slight aerial shot of them)</i> But you're not alone. There are other airbenders <i>(Daw looks to her)</i> and they wanna help you. Actually they're really excited to meet you.      <br><b>Daw:</b> I don't wanna be an airbender. Please! <i>(reaches his hands towards Korra and shuffles his feet along the edge to her)</i> You're the Avatar. Make it <i>stop</i>! <i>(he notices how near he is to the edge and he gasps, immediately pressing his back against the support column)</i>         <br><b>Korra:</b> I'm sorry, I can't. But I promise you, things <i>will</i> get better if you just give it a chance. <i>(Daw looks to her again)</i> Let me take you over to Air Temple Island and we can talk this through, okay?              <br><br><i>(Korra stretches her hand out to Daw and he attempts to take it. As he does so, the camera cuts to his feet and one of them slips off the ledge. Camera immediately zooms out to the bottom of the bridge looking up as Daw falls down with a scream. Korra immediately throws herself off the bridge and dives down towards Daw. Catching him by the waist, Korra opens her glider just in time before they touch the ground and they drift upwards. Cut to a full shot of the bridge as the onlookers applaud and Korra lands near the police cordon. Tenzin walks up to the new airbender.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Daw, this is Tenzin. He's going to help you.     <br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(gives a bow)</i> It is absolutely my pleasure to meet you, Daw. I've never met a new airbender before. Well, at least no one whose diaper I didn't have to change.    <br><b>Daw:</b> Actually I just fell off a bridge, so I could use a fresh diaper right about now.  <br><br><i>(Cut to Korra and Tenzin as he raises an eyebrow. A sound is heard off-screen and they both look up. Cut to the police cordon as a cop metalbends one barricade inwards to allow Raiko to enter.)</i>      <br><br><b>Raiko:</b> We have a crisis every other day now, thanks to you.         <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(walks up to face the President)</i> Listen, I know you're having a tough time getting used to these changes, and I'm <i>sorry</i> for that. The vines and the spirits are here to stay.           <br><b>Raiko:</b> Well, you know who's not here to stay? <i>(points to Korra)</i> You! <i>(Korra is taken aback)</i> I order you to leave this city. Cut to a close up of Korra who smiles.)</i>    <br><br><b>Korra:</b> I can see my path now. Who knows who's out there right now, <i>(both of them walk off and we cut to an aerial view of the bridge)</i> discovering the gift of airbending for the first time? <br><br><i>(Scene changes to an area with various peaks and cliffs. A metal bridge slowly extends out from one peak to the other. Cut to the other peak as the bridge makes contact with it. Many feet enter the screen. Zaheer is facing the wall with his arms raised and placed behind his head.)</i> <br><br><b>White Lotus Guard:</b> Hope you still like rice. <i>(places the food tray through a slot at the bottom of the gate)</i>  <br><b>Zaheer:</b> Have you ever read the poetry of the great airbending Guru Laghima?            <br><b>White Lotus Guard:</b> What?             <br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(cut to a close up of Zaheer's bearded jaw as he speaks)</i> Guru Laghima lived four thousand years ago in the Northern Air Temple. It is said that he unlocked the secret of weightlessness and became untethered from the earth, <i>(camera switches to a close up of his green eyes)</i> living his final forty years without ever touching the ground.           <br><b>White Lotus Guard:</b> <i>(cut to the outside as the guard raises his eyebrow)</i> Is that how you plan to escape, <i>(smiles wryly)</i> with something you picked up from an old airbender children's story?<br><br><i>(The guard turns to walk away but when he doesn't hear a reply, he stops, frowning, and turns back. Return to the inside of the cell looking out to the prison entrance. The other White Lotus members continue to stay in defensive positions.)</i><br>           <br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(camera zooms out to show more of Zaheer's face as he speaks)</i> Laghima once wrote, "Instinct is a lie. told by a fearful body. Hoping to be wrong."      <br><b>White Lotus Guard:</b> What's that supposed to mean?           <br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(the camera zooms out enough to finally show Zaheer's mug)</i> It means that when you base your expectations only on what you see, <i>(slightly parts his arms behind his head)</i> you blind yourself to the possibilities of a new reality.<br><br><i>(Zaheer quickly turns around and pulls his arms back, airbending the guard to the barred gate.)</i>           <br><br><b>White Lotus Guard:</b> Ugh!<br><br><i>(Zaheer quickly propels himself towards the bars with airbending. Switch to a shot of the other guards as they start to bend.)</i><br><br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Ah, ah, ah. <i>(they stop bending and we cut to an overhead shot of the area outside the prison)</i> You wouldn't wanna singe your friend, would you?  <br><b>White Lotus Guard:</b> How? You're not a bender!      <br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(cut to a close up of the perspiring guard)</i> Nature is constantly changing, like the wind.   <br><br><i>(Zaheer moves one of his hands down and we cut to the guard's waist as Zaheer rips the keys dangling from it. Switch back to the inside of the cell as Zaheer unlocks the bars and opens it inwards. He airbends and pulls the main guard into the cell. Zaheer immediately dashes out. Camera immediately cuts back outside as Zaheer slides along the ground to avoid a firebending attack. The man then kicks out his legs with airbending to knock two guards off their feet. The guard bends again but Zaheer lands on his shoulders and twists his arms, making the guard stop bending. Zaheer then tosses him into the cell with his legs.<br><br>Cut to a close up of Zaheer as he dodges a slab of earth and we switch to an overhead view of the platform outside as one guard bends a wall towards Zaheer but as usual, he dodges. Zaheer then scales up the prison structure and a second firebender guard attacks him. Camera switches to a scenic view of the peak as Zaheer leaps off the prison and lands near the edge. He kicks the secibd firebender guard into the cell with airbending. The remaining two guards, the last firebender and the earthbender from before attack Zaheer one after the other but Zaheer bobs and weaves.<br><br>Switch to a close up of the platform as the earthbender kicks up a slab of stone and sends it to Zaheer who is scaling the prison structure again. Zaheer quickly jumps up to avoid the rock. The firebender guard kicks a stream of fire at Zaheer and the airbender quickly pushes himself off the prison and back to the ground. He slides along the ground to avoid another fire attack and Zaheer trips the guards with airbending. Zaheer then airbends them into the cell. <br><br>Camera changes to the back of the cell where the two guards are slammed against the wall to join their fallen comrades. The sound of a gate closing is heard. Switch to a view of the inside of the prison looking out to Zaheer standing outside.)</i> <br>     <br><b>Zaheer:</b> Now you might wanna ration <i>(the main guard stirs and lifts his head up)</i> that bowl of rice. <i>(cut to a close up the main guard with a fallen bowl of rice beside him on the floor with spilled grains)</i> You've got three weeks until the next shift change. <i>(cut to a close up of Zaheer)</i> It's the dawning of a new age, <i>(camera gradually zooms in on him)</i> the end of the White Lotus, and soon, the end of the Avatar.     <br><br><i>(Zaheer turns away and we switch to an overhead view of the peak as he walks to the edge and looks down into the void below. Without hesitation, Zaheer leaps off the edge. Cut to the bottom of the peak looking up as Zaheer slowly makes his way down by jumping on the various ledges scattered along the cliff face while using airbending to cushion his falls.)</i> <br><br><br><br>[End Credits]

So too is the mysterious Zaheer, who escaped from his remote prison thanks to his new ability. Now exiled from Republic City, Korra has made it her mission to find all the new airbenders. But will she and Tenzin be able to bring back the Air Nation? <br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode opens up to an aerial shot of a Future Industries airship slowly gliding its way to Air Temple Island. We can see a bunch of people on the ground walking to the courtyard to receive the airship. Camera pans across the airship's spinning propellers. Cut to the ground as a couple of Air Acolyte men hold on to a couple of tethers to slowly guide the ship in. Cut to the back view of the cage and it changes to the inside of the cage to reveal an armless woman looking haggard and her cheeks are sunken.)</i><br><br><b>White Lotus Guard #2:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> We're under attack! <i>(the woman opens her eyes)</i> Look out!   <br><br><i>(Switch to a view from inside the cell looking up and we can see a stream of fire being bended from the upper walkways followed by a gust of air. Cut to a close up of the upper walkway as a White Lotus guard is thrown off by Zaheer in his disguise uniform. Zaheer then propels himself upwards with airbending. View changes to a close up of the woman's eyes as she carefully observes.      <br><br>Cut to the upper walkway again as Zaheer lands and kicks a guard over the railings. Ghazan jumps in and lands beside Zaheer, throwing a barrel in the air. Zaheer jumps up and and kicks the barrel away. Camera follows the barrel as it gets sliced in half with airbending and water falls out of the container. Cut to a close up of the armless woman as she quickly stands up and uses the water to form water arms. She shoots a water arm forward, knocking the door to her cage open and she swings herself up, using the water appendages as an extension of herself.<br><br>A guard firebends at the cage but the waterbender swings herself away. She then propels herself up to the walkway and knocks two guards out with her water arms. As the woman lands, she quickly cartwheels away to avoid a fire blast and she swings under the walkway. Cut to a scenic view of the middle of the prison as fire enters the screen but the woman dodges. Another guard earthbends a chunk of rock at her and she shoots her arm forth, breaking the rock and also knocking the earthbender back. A firebender on the top floor bends at her and she swings herself around the walkway.<br><br>View changes to Zaheer and Ghazan holding their ground. Ghazan throws a lava shuriken off-screen to intercept a blast of fire. The armless woman swings herself up to her friends. Cut to a close up of the end of her water arm as it turns into a sickle and she uses it to grab a guard's waist. She uses her other arm to grab another guard's neck. The waterbender throws one guard over the railing and another on the walkway, knocking him out cold. The woman stands up and we cut to an overhead view of her gazing at her prison cage. Zaheer and Ghazan run up to her.)</i> <br><br><b>Ming-Hua:</b> <i>(turns around to Zaheer and gives a little smile)</i> I never thought I'd be so happy to see your <i>(glances to Ghazan)</i> ugly mugs again.  <br><b>Ghazan:</b> Great to see you too, Ming-Hua.               <br><b>Ming-Hua:</b> <i>(to Zaheer)</i> I'm flattered, you busted me out before that girlfriend of yours.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(switch to a close up of Zaheer as he smiles)</i> We're getting her next.       <br><br><i>(Cut to the inside of the airship as everyone sits dejectedly around the table with the map on it.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> Well, I guess we should just go to Ba Sing Se and try our luck there.     <br><b>Korra:</b> I don't know what to do. I just thought more people would be excited about coming with us.      <br><b>Bumi:</b> Well, <i>(extends both palms out)</i> maybe you gotta do more to get them excited. You need to add a little <i>(shakes his hands)</i> razzle dazzle. <i>(places his hands on the table)</i>  <br><b>Bolin:</b> Yeah, razzle dazzle. We could put on some sort of airbending street performance. <br><b>Bumi:</b> I was going to say we could cover Tenzin's robe in sequins, <i>(points to Bolin)</i> but that's even better. <br><br><i>(Bolin and Bumi give hopeful smiles to someone off-screen. Cut to Korra and Tenzin leaning back in their chairs, unamused.)</i>    <br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(to Tenzin)</i> It sounds ridiculous, but it <i>might</i> work.          <br><b>Tenzin:</b> I'm willing to try anything at this point.<br><br><i>(Return back to an excited Bolin.)</i>         <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(fist pumps)</i> Yes! That is the kind of enthusiasm I like to hear.  <br><br><i>(Cut to a village by a cliffside as the airship docks at the edge. The team has disembarked, leaving Tenzin on the stairs. A crowd has gathered in front of the ship.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Come one, come all and witness the amazing airbenders! <i>(cut to a close up of Bolin with a fake moustache on his face and an intricate megaphone in hand)</i> An airbending show that will leave you <i>(whispers)</i> breathless <i>(hollers)</i> with wind! First up, the tattooed master himself. You know him as the son of Avatar Aang. <i>(camera pans to the stairs behind him and Tenzin's back is to the audience)</i> He shaves every hair on his head, every single day. <i>(cut to a back view of Tenzin)</i> It's the one, the only guy with an arrow pointing to his nose- <i>(Tenzin turns towards the audience and pulls off his robes, revealing his shirtless form)</i> Tenzin!             <br><br><i>(Tenzin waves his arms around and forms his air cycle that hasn't been seen since Book 1. He moves the cycle along the ground in front of the audience and the crowd applauds. Switch to an overhead view as Tenzin stops bending and stands up with both hands out.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Now, now, <i>(walks to the crowd)</i> ladies and gentlemen, ladies and gentlemen, please be quiet. <i>(cut to a close up of Bolin as he looks worried)</i> I have some serious news. We've heard that an escaped firebending convict has been spotted near here. <i>(everyone starts to whisper)</i> Now, I don't want to panic anyone, <i>(goes up really close to a couple in front)</i> but if you see a <i>firebender</i> <i>(Cut to Mako with his arms crossed behind a couple of people in the crowd. He doesn't look too happy.)</i> with a <i>red scarf</i>...       <br><br><b>Guy in Crowd:</b> I see him. He's right there!           <br><br><i>(Mako steps forward, out into the open.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(flatly)</i> I am the escaped convict, and you will all reap my fire. <br><br><i>(Switch to a view of the crowd as Mako raises his fist and bends a small flame of fire. The crowd whispers in fear. Cut to a close up of Bolin.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Oh, no, who will help us?           <br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> I will! <i>(cut to Korra with her arms on her hips as she hams it up)</i> With my airbending skills.      <br><br><i>(Korra moves her arms around and creates a gust of wind which becomes a little vortex that sucks Mako up into the air. Mako gasps with surprise. She releases him and he almost drops to the ground before he gets caught on a bed of air. Korra makes the vortex typhoon again and spins Mako around.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Whoa! Aah! Oh! Aah! Aah! Hey! Let me go! <i>(cut to the top view of the vortex to show Mako as he looks panicked)</i> This is not what we rehearsed! Korra!         <br><br><i>(Cut to Korra who chuckles as she is enjoying herself. She looks backwards and the camera pans to the side to reveal Asami who laughs in amusement too. Cut to a view of Oogi as it sails through the air.)</i>    <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> With the power of airbending, even this beast can float like a feather! <i>(cut to Bumi on the ground as he thrusts out four gusts of air from his palms)</i> Look what can be done in only a few short weeks of practice. <i>(Jinora flies above the crows with her glider and bobs and weaves for a moment before twirling her glider in the air and landing gently on top of a column)</i> No, no, don't worry, folks, she might be young, but she is in full control. <br><br><i>(The crowd applauds for Jinora and we switch back to an aerial view of the group.)</i>  <br> <br><b>Bolin:</b> Ladies and gentlemen, if you or anyone you know is an airbender, <i>(Bumi and Korra give a wave)</i> please send them our way. Master Tenzin and Avatar Korra would love to teach them all they know.     <br><br><i>(Switch to Korra giving Tenzin a hopeful smile. If you're looking for airbenders, you just found one. <i>(camera zooms out to the back of Korra and Tenzin's heads as the boy thrusts his palms out and airbends twice)</i> I want to join you guys.   <br><br><i>(View changes to the back of the Kai's head looking to Team Avatar who smile with delight.)</i><br> <br><b>Bolin:</b> Get outta town!           <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(she walks up to Tenzin and smiles)</i> We got our first recruit.   <br><br><i>(Both of them grin and then look at the camera hopefully. Cut to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b>    <br><br><i>(Episode returns to a full shot of Team Avatar talking to Kai.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Just to be totally clear, we're going to be heading to Ba Sing Se, <i>(camera zooms in on them)</i> then the Northern Air Temple to live as nomads and rebuild the Air Nation. All that sound good to you?   <br><b>Kai:</b> <i>(repeats without thought)</i> Yeah, Ba Sing Se, rebuild the temple, Air Nomad whaddyado- I'm in. Let's go right now.       <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(jumps for joy)</i> This is going to be so great! You are gonna love it- <i>(raises his eyebrows)</i> Uh, ah- Real quick, what's your name?  <br><b>Kai:</b> Kai. <i>(to Tenzin)</i> So when do we hit the road?               <br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(raises a hand up as a 'stop' gesture)</i> Hang on a second, Kai. Where are your parents? <i>(cut to Kai who looks saddened)</i> We can't have you come with us without their permission.       <br><b>Kai:</b> <i>(looks down)</i> My parents are... <i>(sighs)</i> gone.  <br><br><i>(Switch to Korra looking at Tenzin worriedly. Camera pans right to Mako and Bolin.)</i>  <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> You're an orphan?       <br><b>Kai:</b> <i>(nods and sad music begins to play)</i> It happened about a year ago. My hometown was raided by outlaws, but my parents fought back against them. <i>(camera pans across the other who listen intently)</i> I was so scared, but they told me not to worry. They would protect me. And they did. My parents saved me <i>and</i> the entire village, but they died in the fight. <i>(cut to Korra and the brothers as tears well up in Bolin's eyes)</i> Mom and Pop meant everything to me. They were my whole life.    <br><br><i>(Bolin sniffles and wipes a tear from his eye.)</i><br><br><b>Kai:</b> Ever since then, I've been on my own and on the run. Those <i>same</i> outlaws are <i>still</i> after me.       <br><b>Bolin:</b> Well, you don't have to be on the run anymore. Right, guys? Tell him.               <br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(solemnly)</i> I'm so sorry about your parents. I know we could never replace them, <i>(rests a hand on Kai's shoulder)</i> but we're here for you.     <br><b>Korra:</b> We'll keep you safe. <i>(gestures to the ramp)</i> Come on. <i>(everyone except Bolin walk up the ramp)</i>            <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(rests an arm across Kai's back)</i> When you board this airship, you're gonna leave your old life behind and start a new path. That's some big brother advice. <i>(he and Kai walk up the ramp to board the ship)</i> Just think of me as your big brother.      <br><br><i>(Kai smiles gleefully as they leave. The revving of motorcycle engines can be heard and five motorcycles can be seen pulling up to the area where the team was just at.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Guys, I think we got trouble. <br><br><i>(Cut to the rest of the gang as they turn around with worried faces. Cut back to the inside of the ship.)</i><br><br><b>Kai:</b> <i>(frightened)</i> The outlaws- they're after me. <i>(grabs Korra's arm)</i> L-let's get out of here!     <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(surprised)</i> We're not running from anyone. <i>(Korra furrows her brows with determinationa)</i><br><br><i>(Cut to the outside of the ship focusing on the doors as they slide open to reveal Korra in a defensive posture.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> If you want Kai, you'll have to go through me!  <br><br><i>(Korra pushes herself off and out of the airship with airbending. The deputies immediately launch their rocks to Korra but the Avatar breaks them with a blast of air. Korra earthbends an underground snake towards the Sheriff, knocking him backwards to a nearby fountain while the rest of his deputies remain unconscious on the ground near him.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(stands up and frowns)</i> Your days of harassing an innocent boy are over. <i>(walks to the Sheriff)</i> You outlaws are going to prison.<br><br><i>(Cut to the Sheriff who is surprised)</i><br><br><b>Sheriff:</b> Outlaws? Innocent boy? <i>(looks down at his badge)</i> I'm a sheriff and these are my deputies. <i>(cut to Korra who is shocked and we can see Jinora and Tenzin behind her)</i> And this kid is a thief. <i>(Korra widens her eyes and view returns back to the Sheriff)</i> Whatever he told you is a lie. We've been chasing him for months.           <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(her expression of shock changes to anger and she looks back to her team mates)</i> Where's Kai?         <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(off screen)</i> Right here. <i>(Camera pans to the left to reveal Mako with Kai's satchel in one hand and holding onto Kai's collar in the other. They walk towards Korra.)</i> I found him slipping away.      <br><b>Kai:</b> I was going to the bathroom. <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(lifts up a satchel for emphasis)</i> With your sack of gold?       <br><br><i>(Mako tosses the sack towards the lawmen. The bag lands on the ground at Korra's feet and gold and jewellery fall out from it. Camera pans up as Korra has an unreadable expression on her face.)</i><br><br><b>Kai:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> I told you, I found that on the road!<br><br><i>(Pan out to a full view of Team Avatar, the Sheriff and his colleagues surrounding Mako and Kai.)</i>       <br><br><b>Mako:</b> Enough with the lies, kid. I want the truth.           <br><b>Sheriff:</b> <i>(arms akimbo)</i> The truth is, <i>he's</i> the outlaw. <i>(Korra turns her head towards the boy)</i> He spent his entire life as an orphan until <i>(Two deputies step forward, forcing Mako to let go of Kai. The deputies stand on each side of Kai, grabbing hold of his arm)</i> he got adopted by a real nice family about six months ago. <i>(switch to a close up of the Sheriff and Korra as she turns towards him)</i> And how did he repay them? By taking their entire life savings. <i>(turns to Korra)</i> We've been after him ever since.           <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(to Kai)</i> Is that true?         <br><b>Kai:</b> <i>(pleads with puppy dog eyes)</i> The person who stole that stuff was the <i>old</i> me. Making a change. <i>(turns away)</i> Don't you worry about me.     <br><br><i>(Kai walks up the plank and the camera follows him up the ramp to reveal Jinora shyly waiting for him in the middle of the walkway.)</i>  <br><br><b>Jinora:</b> Hi, I'm Jinora. <i>(cut to a close up of the two as Jinora blushes and we can see Tenzin walking into the airship in the background)</i> If you need any help with airbending I could show you what I know.  <br><b>Kai:</b> <i>(tugs on his suspenders)</i> Thanks. <i>(Tenzin appears in the doorway again)</i> That's real nice of you.    <br><b>Tenzin:</b> Jinora! <i>(the two children are startled and they look at him)</i> We're leaving now.          <br><br><i>(Jinora smiles at Kai. And now you're telling me their leader is an <i>airbender</i>?  <br><b>White Lotus Guard #3:</b> We can track them...     <br><b>Lord Zuko:</b> We don't need to track them. <i>(turns away from the guard)</i> I know exactly where they're going. <i>(Zuko begins to walk off screen and the White Lotus guard follows. Cut to a back view shot of the two as they walk through a brightly lit doorway.)</i> Notify the new chiefs of the Northern Water Tribe that an attack on their prison is imminent. <i>(camera zooms past Zuko and the guard to reveal a big, imposing red dragon waiting on the other end)</i> And send word to Lin Bei Fong in Republic City. The Avatar must be protected.  <br><br><i>(Camera angle changes to full side view shot of the scene as the dragon lowers its head so that Zuko can climb on it. The dragon lifts its head and lets out a roar, spreading its majestic wings.)</i><br><br><b>Lord Zuko:</b> To stop them.         <br><br><i>(Return back to the side view shot as the dragon takes off and begins to fly towards the camera as exciting, mysterious music plays in the background. Cut to a back view shot of the dragon as it rapidly flies further and further away from the camera. As it reaches the horizon, the episode ends.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

You're a great teacher.     <br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Jinora as she blushes and walks off with her uncle in hand. Demanding. <i>(Korra looks concerned)</i>  <br><br><i>(Bolin excitedly runs up to the deck's railings beside Korra.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> This is it, Mako! We made it! This is where Dad grew up! <i>(waves Mako over)</i> Come here, look! Look!     <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(walks up to his brother)</i> Okay, calm down. I'm looking.          <br><br><i>(Soothing, hopeful music plays as the scenery changes to the fields outside the walled city. The airship is slowly making its way towards the walls. Cut to Korra who looks excited.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I wonder how many airbenders are down there.         <br><br><i>(Cut to the front of the ship looking at the wall as the Sun's glare obscures the camera's view. When the airship finally manages to pass over the wall, the music abruptly changes to a depressing tone. The Lower Ring is dirty and crowded with shacks and apartments and we can see smoke streaming out of the chimneys. Cut to a close up of a beggar on the ground as the airship passes by overhead. Switch to a view of a group of citizens lining up to collect water from a polluted stream.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Ugh. <i>(cut to Mako, Bolin, and Korra as they reel back in disgust)</i> The Lower Ring looks terrible. <br><br><i>(Bolin claps a hand over his nose and looks like he's about to puke. Mako pulls his scarf over his nose.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(his voice is muffled)</i> Yeah, I can smell it from here. Camera also rapidly pans backwards to reveal that there are a lot more people inside the apartment.)</i>    <br><br><b>Chow:</b> Hey, everybody! Look who's here! San's kids, Mako and Bolin!     <br><br><i>(Camera pans across the various relatives in the room.)</i>    <br><br><b>Uncle:</b> No way.        <br><b>Aunt:</b> Come in.              <br><b>Cousin:</b> Welcome.              <br><br><i>(Mako and Bolin wave shyly and the family members stand up to greet them. A graying elderly woman walks towards the brothers.)</i><br><br><b>Yin:</b> Is it true? <i>(she clasps both hands together with hope)</i> After all these years?     <br><b>Chow:</b> Boys, <i>(walks to his mother and rests a hand on her back)</i> this is your grandmother, Yin.     <br><b>Yin:</b> <i>(happily)</i> Oh, it is so wonderful to finally meet my long-lost grandchildren. <i>(She rushes up to them to hug them both and they return the affection by embracing her as well. Yin pulls away and speaks)</i> Where is San and your mother? <br><br><i>(Cut to the brothers as they are surprised and both look at each other with sadness.)</i> <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Wait, you mean, <i>(cut to Yin with the rest of the family behind her)</i> you don't know? <br><br><i>(Yin's hopeful expression fades away. Sad music plays as the camera returns back to the brothers. They look downcast.)</i>    <br><br><b>Mako:</b> I'm sorry. They were killed when we were little.      <br><br><i>(Camera goes back to Yin again as everyone's expression changes to sadness. Yin looks down and tears well up in her eyes at the mention that her son and daughter-in-law are dead.<br><br>Scene changes to the airship parked on the ground in a barren town. Korra and Asami have disembarked and are heading towards a building to collect the tax money. Cut to a close up of Korra as suspicious music plays when she looks around. Cut to a view of a nearby buildings as the occupants scurry away with their children and close the windows and doors.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I don't like the looks of this. Let's hurry up and get out of here.      <br><br><i>(Cut to the inside of the building as an Earth Kingdom guard tugs and slides the door open to reveal the two teens.)</i><br><br><b>Earth Kingdom Guard:</b> You here to pick up the tax shipment?           <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(gestures to the airship behind her)</i> Go ahead and load it on the airship.         <br><br><i>(Four guards load up sacks of coins into a wheelbarrow. Cut to a view from behind Korra's and Asami's heads as the guards wheel the tax towards the airship. An explosion is heard and camera pans to the nearby cliffs as a red flare is seen shooting towards the sky. Cut back to the guards who have noticed the signal and they glance around worriedly. Camera returns back to Korra and Asami as they look concerned. The revving of motorcycle engines can be heard off-screen. Camera zooms out to behind the girls again as they look down the square. Cut to a wooden fence as various bikes jump over it. Some of the occupants are carrying dangerous weapons like spears and spiked maces. Cut to the front of the gang as they ride forward with a metal truck behind them. View changes to three of the guards fleeing. The remaining one holding onto the wheelbarrow hesitates for a while before dropping the handle and running away as well. Cut back to Korra and Asami as the latter puts on her electric glove.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> So much for our escorts.      <br><br><i>(View changes to the back of the girls as we see the gang approaching them.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Maybe we should've brought everybody else.         <br><br><i>(Cut to commercial break.)</i><br>     <br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b> <br><br><i>(Episode returns to the bikers laughing gleefully. Cut to Korra and Asami as they are surrounded by them. They circle around the girls for a while before braking harshly, sending clouds of dust up into the air. Cut to the back of a shirtless, muscular guy who has shaved most of his hair short but sports a very long lime green ponytail. He wears shoulder armor and elbow guards on his right arm.)</i><br><br><b>Gombo:</b> Step away from the gold, <i>(View changes to a frontal shot of the man who has his face painted white like a skull. He has a long, black beard too but the middle section of his beard is dyed lime green as well.)</i> ladies, and you won't get hurt. <br><br><i>(Camera focuses on Korra and Asami as they look serious and stand their ground.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(raises an arm up in a defensive posture)</i> Sorry to disappoint you, but we're taking this gold back to Ba Sing Se.       <br><br><i>(Cut to an aerial view of the confrontation as Gombo walks towards the ladies.)</i><br><br><b>Gombo:</b> Aw, we love gals with spirit. Suit yourself.         <br><br><i>(Cut to Gombo as he attempts to kick Korra's head but she ducks in time and cartwheels, sweeping the man of his feet. Korra then bends a trail of earth to the bikers and pops up two columns from the ground, sending the motorbikes flying into the air. View cuts to a biker trying to escape but is thrown into the air by the earthbending. Switch to a view of Korra with the gangsters in the air and she bends another trail of earth off-screen.<br><br>Switch to a view of a biker wielding a pipe approaching Asami and the heiress frowns before rushing forward. She leaps into the air and the frame rate slows down as she wraps her legs around the biker's torso. Frame rate returns to normal as she forcefully throws the biker of his seat and the motorbike gets flipped over from the force. Asami lands and stands in an attacking posture as another biker heads towards her. However, a wall of earth suddenly appears in front of him and the biker collides into it. Cut to Asami as she looks to Korra since the Avatar was the one who bended the wall. <br><br>View changes to a biker and his passenger and we cut to the biker's point of view as he heads towards a sack of gold and one of the bags is splayed open, spewing gold coins onto the ground. Camera angle changes to the fallen wheelbarrow as the passenger uses his spear and pierces through a gold sack, carrying it along with them. Korra stops them by bending a gust of air and knocks them away.<br><br>Cut to Asami running towards a pair of gangsters and the passenger swings his spear at Asami. The teen jumps up, over the spear and past their heads. Frame rate slows slightly as she extends her gloved hand out and touches the passenger's shoulder, electrocuting him. Frame rate returns to normal as the man screams and falls off the bike, dropping his spear. As Asami lands on the ground, she seizes possession of his spear. His companion in front swings his bike around to face Asami.<br><br>Cut to Korra dodging a couple of kicks and camera angle changes to a full view of Gombo swinging his legs around in an attempt to land a hit on Korra. The Avatar continues to bob and weave before kicking out a column of earth at him and he is knocked back. Switch to an aerial view of the scene as Gombo gets up and runs off. Cut to Gombo running up to the metal truck and jumping onto the side to grab on.)</i><br><br><b>Gombo:</b> Retreat! Retreat! <br><br><i>(View changes to a lone biker who looks afraid and he revs his engine to turn away. Cut to Gombo and the rest of the gang inside the truck with the back doors splayed open.)</i> <br><br><b>Gombo:</b> <i>(raises arms)</i> You're on the wrong side of this fight, Avatar! <i>(cut to a back view shot of the girls)</i> That gold belongs to the people, not the Queen!         <br><br><i>(View changes to a frontal shot of Korra who looks a sad and doubtful.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Why do I get the feeling he's right?    <br><br><i>(Location changes to the Western tundra in the Northern Water Tribe. A blizzard is currently ongoing and in the distance, we can see a shadow of the secret prison. Cut to the inside of the prison entrance with two White Lotus guards standing guard at each side of the entrance. The metal doors open outwards to reveal the twins, Tonraq, and Zuko.)</i><br><br><b>Eska:</b> Why didn't anyone tell us <i>(the guards proceed to stand at attention upon seeing them)</i> we have a secret prison we could have been throwing people in?       <br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of the siblings.)</i><br><br><b>Desna:</b> <i>(looking around)</i> I'd like to put my tailor in here. He never gets my cuffs right. <i>(he lifts his arms up and looks at his sleeves)</i> They're so creasy.          <br><br><i>(Cut to the elevator as guards stand at their positions. A cabin slides up into view and the doors open. Zuko's feet step into screen followed by the twins. View changes to a top view of the elevator shaft as the cabin descends and the cables holding the car moves.)</i><br><br><b>Lord Zuko:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> We built this place secretly with your father <i>(cut to a frontal view of everyone inside the lift)</i> to hold a very <i>special</i> prisoner. She's a powerful firebender named P'li who can create explosions with her mind. Ironically, I hired a guy with a similar ability to kill the Avatar <i>(Tonraq's eyes shift to the side towards Zuko and he raises an eyebrow)</i> myself once. <i>(there's a few seconds of silence before Zuko turns towards Tonraq with a defeated expression)</i> Didn't work.          <br><b>Eska:</b> <i>(speaks up)</i> Don't feel bad. I tried to kill Korra <i>(Tonraq look back at his niece with an unamused expression)</i> after she ruined my wedding. It happens.         <br><br><i>(The elevator comes to a stop and Tonraq turns serious.)</i>  <br><br><b>Tonraq:</b> Let's just focus on keeping this woman in prison.<br><br><i>(The elevator doors slide open and light fills the cabin. Cut to an overhead shot of the main prison area as the older men step out. Camera pans up to reveal an empty chasm with a piece of land in the middle. Two White Lotus guards can be seen guarding the prison. Cut to an overhead view of the chasm as a metal bridge with the four guests extends outwards to the prison.)</i><br><br><b>Lord Zuko:</b> The intense cold prevents her from firebending. <br><br><i>(View changes to frontal shot of the party. Fog comes out from their breaths when they speak)</i><br><br><b>Desna:</b> There's certainly no way anyone's breaking out of here. <br><b>Lord Zuko:</b> That's what we thought about the other three prisons. <br><br><i>(Cut to a back view of the four of them as they finally approach the cell.)</i><br><br><b>P'li:</b> <i>(shivers off-screen)</i> Must be something exciting going on. <i>(a shadow walks towards the cell door from within)</i> No one interesting has visited me in <i>thirteen</i> years.   <br><br><i>(Cut to Tonraq as he shoots the woman an icy look.)</i><br><br><b>Tonraq:</b> Don't get used to it. <br><br><i>(View changes to the window in the cell door as it zooms in slowly.)</i><br><br><b>P'li:</b> He's out, isn't he? Mmm, <i>(she bends down and we can only see her mouth)</i> I'm feeling warmer already.   <br><br><i>(The camera zooms in some more, revealing her cheeks but before her face can be revealed, the scene changes back to Yin's apartment in Ba Sing Se where a spread of food is laid out on the table. Bolin gobbles up the food greedily. Camera pans up to reveal everyone seated with their legs crossed around the table.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> This is so great. We've never had a family before. Now we've got... <i>(he picks up his spoon and starts to count around the room)</i> One, two, five, eleven... <i>(camera zooms out to reveal more of their large extended family)</i> A big family! Yeah!              <br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of the brothers as Mako turns towards his uncle.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> So why did Dad leave Ba Sing Se?           <br><br><i>(View changes to Chow and Yin.)</i><br><br><b>Chow:</b> Oh, he always had big dreams. <i>(Yin turns her head towards her son)</i> He couldn't wait to get out and see the world. <i>(he look to the side)</i> Your grandfather thought <i>(Yin turns her head back sadly)</i> it was ridiculous. <i>(view switches to the brothers as they listen intently)</i> He wanted San to stay home and work the fruit stand, <i>(camera returns back to Chow and his mother)</i> but San was determined to leave <i>(Yin continues to look really upset)</i> and they had a huge fight. <i>(Yin closes her eyes and turns her head away in shame and pain)</i> And that was the last time they ever spoke. <i>(he glances at his mother)</i> Oh, um, sorry, Mom.       <br><br><i>(Yin opens her eyes and looks at her grandchildren softly.)</i><br><br><b>Yin:</b> Come with me. <br><br><i>(She pushes a hand on the ground to stand up. Cut to her back view as the rest of the family looks on.)</i><br><br><b>Yin:</b> I have something to show you.  <br><br><i>(Soft, sad music plays and view changes to a mother and daughter airing out their laundry on the railing in the corridor. Camera pans up to reveal two windows as Yin is seated on the futon with a small chest on her lap and the brothers walk up to her.)</i><br><br><b>Yin:</b> This is the only letter <i>(cut to the inside of the room and Yin has pulled out a letter in her hands)</i> we ever got from San. It says he married a <i>beautiful</i> girl from the Fire Nation and had <i>(she pats the futon as a gesture to ask them to sit down)</i> two wonderful sons. <i>(Mako and Bolin take her non-verbal cue and take a seat on each side of her. Cut to a frontal shot of the trio.)</i> He sent this picture of you all on his birthday.        <br><br><i>(Mako looks at the picture sadly and Bolin has surprise on his face. Cut to a sepia tone photo of the brothers' family. On the left, their father is seated on the chair smiling at the camera while a young Bolin is on his lap, fidgeting a bit as his eyes are not looking at the camera. The earthbender inherited his dad's bushy eyebrows. On the right, their beautiful mother and Mako are standing and the mother has her hands on Mako's shoulders. Both are smiling at the camera. The firebender inherited his mom's thin eyebrow shape.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Look, Mako. Dad's wearing your scarf.      <br><b>Yin:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> I'm so sad that I never got to meet your mother, <i>(view changes back to a frontal shot of the three of them and Yin looks at Mako fondly)</i> but you have her eyes. <i>(Mako gives a wistful smile while Bolin has tears welling up in his eyes)</i> I know from looking <i>(Yin turns and looks at Bolin)</i> at you two <i>(Bolin sniffles and wipes away the tears with his hand)</i> that she must have been a <i>wonderful</i> bride for my boy.           <br><br><i>(Camera changes angles to a close up of Mako looking at his grandmother sadly. Then he tugs a bit at his red scarf and glances at it with nostalgia. He then pulls it off his neck. Cut to a frontal view of the trio again.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> I'm sure they would want you to have this.          <br><br><i>(He gently places the scarf on Yin's shoulders and his grandmother smiles. She looks at him for a short while before embracing her grandson. Bolin joins in the group hug with Yin sandwiched in the middle. Sweet, sad music continues to play. Camera angle changes to outside the window of the room as it slowly zooms out. The sun is setting, casting its golden glow on the apartment.<br><br>Cut to the inside of the badgermole throne room in the palace in Ba Sing Se.
