It's the best way to learn metalbending.     <br><br><i>(Wei bends another meteorite at Bolin and he gives a yelp before ducking. The earthbender sweeps one foot up, bending a small piece of rock from the ground and he sends it towards Wei. The rock smacks against Wei's forehead and he grunts, dropping the meteorite.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Oh, nice shot, Bolin. <i>(Wei grabs his face with both hands and makes little moans of pain)</i> But I thought you were supposed to be practicing metalbending, not <i>earth</i>bending.          <br><b>Wei:</b> <i>(rubs his red forehead)</i> Yeah, cheater. <i>(crosses his arms)</i>       <br><b>Bolin:</b> Mako, metalbending is extremely difficult. No one gets it right away, if they can get it at all! It's not normal!        <br><br><i>(He looks to the side and view changes to Korra with hands tied up against her waist by the cables. She spins around and kicks away a meteorite aimed at her. Korra kneels down and Wing enters the screen with a meteorite in hand but the Avatar whips a cable at him, knocking the boy off balance. The cables loosen and completely retract into the holder once Korra is done.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(jumps)</i> Whoo-hoo! <i>(flexes her biceps)</i> Metalbending champion!     <br><b>Bolin:</b> Oh, sure. She's the <i>Avatar</i>.           <br><b>Asami:</b> Guys, it's time to get cleaned up. Tonight's Opal's farewell dinner.     <br><b>Bolin:</b> Aw, now I gotta say bye to Opal? I'm the daughter of Toph and <i>(glances at Lin)</i> the only sister to Lin, and I had nothing to do with the attack last night.   <br><b>Aiwei:</b> <i>(turns to Lin)</i> She is telling <i>(Korra sighs with frustration in the background)</i> the truth.   <br><b>Korra:</b> This is a waste of time. Just bring in the next guard.  <br><br><i>(Another young male guard steps in and takes a seat.)</i><br><br><b>Aiwei:</b> Give me your name and tell me where you are from. <br><b>Hong Li:</b> I'm Hong Li. I was born and raised here in Zaofu.       <br><b>Aiwei:</b> Do you have any knowledge of the people who tried to kidnap the Avatar?      <br><b>Hong Li:</b> No.              <br><b>Aiwei:</b> <i>(leans forward and suspicious music plays)</i> Did you help the attackers enter Zaofu last night?     <br><b>Hong Li:</b> No, of course not.      <br><b>Aiwei:</b> <i>(calmly)</i> You're lying.         <br><b>Hong Li:</b> <i>(shocked)</i> What? No, I'm not!      <br><b>Su:</b> <i>(storms up to Hong Li)</i> How did they get in and out?! <i>(grabs him by the armor and pulls him out of the chair to slam him against the wall)</i> Where are they now?       <br><br><b>Hong Li:</b> <i>(fearful)</i> I don't know! I'm telling you I didn't help them.       <br><br><b>Su:</b> You're a traitor to the entire clan.       <br><b>Aiwei:</b> I suggest we search his place.<br><br><i>(Hong Li's eyes widen and quiver with fright. Location changes to an apartment complex. Cut to the inside of an apartment with Team Avatar and Aiwei searching for clues. Bolin walks to the kitchen and opens the oven before closing it in disappointment. He stands up and opens a small cupboard above. Cut to Mako's hands separating some papers on a desk and he picks up a small written note.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> I got something!          <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(mouth full of cookies)</i> What?   <br><br><i>(Bolin puts away the cookie jar and starts to eat.)</i>          <br><br><b>Mako:</b> It looks like it's from them. <i>(Cut to a close up of the writing on the note)</i> "Team assembled. Ready to rendezvous."      <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(hands a book to Aiwei)</i> And look at this.       <br><b>Aiwei:</b> <i>(takes the book and opens it as Mako leans over to look)</i> These are the guards' log books. All their schedules and routes are in here.     <br><b>Korra:</b> That guard knows everything. <i>(Aiwei closes the book)</i> We have to get him to talk.   <br><b>Mako:</b> Let's go confront him with this evidence right now.  <br><b>Aiwei:</b> No. <i>(the teens are confused)</i> Let's give him a little time to sweat it out. He will talk eventually.<br><br><i>(Aiwei walks off and Mako glances at the truth seer suspiciously. Location changes to an overhead view ofTeam Avatar checking out the cooled down moat from last night. Naga is perfectly fine now and she walks around to sniff the rocks. A few Zaofu guards watch over the crime scene.)</i>    <br><br><b>Mako:</b> I don't understand why we're not talking to that guard right now. <i>(camera changes to a close up of team on ground)</i> Every minute we waste here, those guys get further away. I mean, <i>(his friends gather around him)</i> how does a random guard get involved with a group of super criminals, anyway?     <br><b>Asami:</b> What do you mean?       <br><b>Mako:</b> That guard is only <i>eighteen</i> years old, and has lived in Zaofu his <i>entire</i> life. Zaheer and his gang have been in prison for more than <i>thirteen</i> years. <br><b>Korra:</b> I don't know, but we all saw the evidence. It's pretty overwhelming.       <br><b>Varrick:</b> <i>(stands up from the back of a metal shield just behind Mako and Asami)</i> Maybe a little too <i>(the teens reel back in surprsie)</i> overwhelming?           <br><b>Bolin:</b> Hey, Varrick! <i>(Zhu Li walks into screen with a few rocks in hand.)</i> What are you doing here?   <br><br><i>(Varrick shimmies over the plate and stands next to the youths.)</i> <br><br><b>Varrick:</b> <i>(raises one porous stone)</i> Collecting pumice stones with Zhu Li. That lavabender did a lot of damage, but he makes a <i>nice</i> exfoliating rock. And when you got calluses like mine, <i>(nudges Asami with an arm and she looks weirded out)</i> you take all the pumice stones you can get your hands on. Or in my case, <i>(Cut to a shot of Varrick's sole as Zhu Li vigorously scrubs it with a pumice stone)</i> feet!   <br><br><i>(Cut to the teens who are disgusted except Mako who is unamused.)</i>   <br><br><b>Korra, Bolin, and Asami:</b> <i>(simultaneously)</i> Ehh...           <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(walks up to Varrick)</i> What were you saying about the evidence?       <br><b>Varrick:</b> I was saying that I can smell a conspiracy when I see one. Look, if I was trying to set someone up, I would tell everyone he's guilty, and then plant the evidence in his apartment as proof.      <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(crosses his arm and gives him a look)</i> Oh. <i>(leans towards Varrick)</i> You mean exactly like what you did to me?       <br><b>Varrick:</b> Yes! <i>(raises both arms with glee)</i> Just like that. Remember how great that worked? <i>(Mako continues to glare at Varrick)</i> Well, not for you.          <br><b>Mako:</b> You're right. <i>(camera pans out to the group as Zhu Li continues to exfoliate Varrick's foot)</i> All the evidence points to this guard, but maybe he's just the fall guy.          <br><b>Bolin:</b> But for who?         <br><b>Mako:</b> For the only person who can truly keep a secret in this city, Aiwei. <br><br><i>(Cut to the other three teens who are a little skeptical and surprised but consider the plan anyway. Scene changes to an aerial view of the moat and camera pans off to the right to a house on a cliff. Cut to the inside of the home looking out the window as Bolin comically stands up before popping his head down. Cut to the outside of the house where Team Avatar are crouching.)</i>     <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> He's not home. Or he's hiding in there. <i>(gasps)</i> Or he's invisible.    <br><br><i>(Mako gives him a "Really?" stare.)</i>      <br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Probably just not home.       <br><b>Mako:</b> We have to get in there and find some evidence that links Aiwei to Zaheer, otherwise Su won't believe us. <br><br><i>(Cut to the door handle inside the house as it tilts down and the door opens inwards. Mako's frame walks in followed by Korra, Bolin, and Asami. Camera pans out to the living room area as the teens walk in. Cut to Asami flipping all the pages of an unfilled book.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> It's just an empty book.      <br><br><i>(Camera focuses on Korra as she looks at two books on a shelf. Putting them back down, she looks around behind her. Cut to the brothers as Mako opens a drawer in a desk and Bolin admires a bookshelf with some artefacts dotted throughout on them. Cut to a frontal shot of Bolin who is curious and he picks up a small, orange clay jar.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Oh, it's like a desert on a jar.          <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(turns to his brother)</i> Bolin, put that back. We don't want Aiwei to know we were in here if we can't find anything.      <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(puts the jar on a shelf beside a bigger pot)</i> Uh...  <br><br><i>(He pulls the jar away and hesitates.)</i>           <br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(takes the jar)</i> You forgot where it goes, didn't you?   <br><br><i>(He places it on the shelf near a yellow book. View changes to scuff marks on the floor and Mako bends down to investigate. His fingers feel the marks.)</i>        <br><br><b>Mako:</b> Look at these scuff marks. I think this bookshelf slides open. <br><br><i>(He stands up and begins to push. Cut to a view from behind the shelf as it opens to reveal Bolin looking down at the camera. Mako and Korra walk up to Bolin and the earthbender walks down a hidden staircase. Switch to Bolin's back view as there a mysterious door at the foot of the steps and he pauses.)</i>         <br><br><b>Korra:</b> What do you think is down there?         <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(optimistic)</i> Could be a storage cellar.  <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(smiles)</i> Or it could be how Zaheer got in and out.      <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Aiwei's coming back. <i>(Korra and the brothers look alarmed)</i> Quick!        <br><br><i>(Cut to the bottom of the shelf as various legs run up the stairs and back into the living room. Mako slides the shelf close but it is too near to the adjacent shelf. It is obvious that the shelf is not back to its original position. Mako scampers away from the evidence and we cut to a back view of Team Avatar as a door closes and Aiwei walks into the living room. He looks at the youths with astonishment.)</i>     <br><br><b>Aiwei:</b> <i>(frowns)</i> What are you doing in my house? <br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Aiwei as he looks like a deer in headlights. Cut to commercial break.)</i>         <br><br><br><br><b><u>Act III</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode returns to Aiwei confronting the group of teenagers in his house.)</i><br><br><b>Aiwei:</b> You are trespassing on the property of one of the highest-ranked officials in the city. You had better have a good explanation.       <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(pacifies Aiwei and his brother gives him a look)</i> We do, we do. We actually knocked on your front door, and we thought we heard you say... <i>(falsetto)</i> "Come in! I'm in the bathroom!" <i>(the other three teens glare daggers at Bolin)</i> I don't even know <i>(drops his posture down, defeated)</i> why I'm saying that. You know I'm lying. And you don't even sound like that.   <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(takes a step forward)</i> We came here because things weren't adding up, and we thought you might have some answers.          <br><b>Aiwei:</b> <i>(gestures to the sofa)</i> Sit. If you want to talk, let's talk over some tea. <br><br><i>(The youths glance at each other with puzzled expressions on their faces. Cut to an empty cup as clear, green liquid is poured into it. View changes to a wide shot of the room with the teens seated and the tea cups are on the table.)</i><br><br><b>Aiwei:</b> <i>(places the teapot aside)</i> So, <i>(walks towards the small flight of steps leading to his bookshelf with his back facing the teens)</i> what is not adding up, exactly? Hong Li was clearly lying, and we found evidence in his apartment.           <br><b>Mako:</b> But don't you think it's weird how young he is? How did he ever get mixed up with this group?       <br><b>Aiwei:</b> <i>(climbs the steps)</i> Perhaps through a relative. Or maybe he was bribed. <i>(Korra and Bolin have nervous sweatdrops on their temples)</i> We will find out those answers in time. But if it wasn't him, <i>(casts a side glance to the group)</i> who do you think it was?    <br><br><i>(Once again, the youths look at each other nervously)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> We don't know.        <br><b>Aiwei:</b> You don't think <i>I</i> had <i>(brings a hand up to move the jar Bolin touched back into position)</i> something to do with this, do you?    <br><br><i>(Bolin looks down, knowing that he messed up.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> We're just looking for answers.      <br><b>Aiwei:</b> And you think you found something, don't you?   <br><br><i>(Aiwei glances at the scuff marks on the floor.)</i><br><br><b>Aiwei:</b> <i>(glances to the side again)</i> You have no idea what is coming for you, Avatar. <br><br><i>(He brings his hands up, bending up a protective wall of metal to separate him and the teens. Mako firebends at Aiwei but the flames collide harmlessly against the wall as it is fully erected. Korra gives a grunt and punches against the wall, creating a sizeable dent but it doesn't give way. The Avatar pants from the exertion.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Come on! He's getting away!          <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(annoyed)</i> I'm still a little new at this, so back off!      <br><br><i>(She closes her eyes and takes a deep breath before bending the metal again, creating a deeper dent on the wall. Korra stands up and prepares herself for one last blow. View changes to the other side of the crumpled war as it finally tears open. Korra and company proceed to walk through the hole in the wall. They carefully descend the stairs and stop at the door. Cut to Korra's hand on the handle as she pushes it open to reveal a detonator attached to a can of blasting jelly. An explosion occurs soon after and the camera slows down a bit. Cut to the fire being reflected in Korra's eyes as she is dumbfounded. View pans out to the living room as the explosion rocks the house. <br><br>Cut to Kuvira patrolling atop a cliff nearby as she brings her hands up to shield herself from the impact. She glances down at the destroyed house. Cut back to the teens who have crouched down to the floor and Korra has airbended a protective shield around them. When it is safe, Korra stops airbending and she and Mako glance up.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(stands up)</i> Argh!              <br><br><i>(She and Mako walk into the secret room. View changes to the inside of the remains of the smoking room and the benders put their arms out protectively in front of them. After a few seconds, they relax their stances.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> He's gone.          <br><b>Korra:</b> Look. <i>(Cut to a hole in the wall at the end of the room completely covered by dirt)</i> He must've escaped through there. <i>(turns to Bolin)</i> Help me clear it out.  <br><br><i>(The duo swing their arms to the side and the debris parts in the middle.)</i>    <br><br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> What happened? <i>(view changes to the Bei Fong sisters entering the secret room)</i> We heard an explosion.     <br><b>Su:</b> Where is Aiwei?           <br><b>Korra:</b> Your trusted advisor was the one who betrayed us. <i>(Su is slackjawed)</i> He was lying about the guard.  <br><b>Su:</b> <i>(widens her eyes)</i> What? <i>(her eyes shift around side to side)</i> No.               <br><b>Korra:</b> We confronted him and he bolted through <i>(gestures to the hole in the wall)</i> here.   <br><br><i>(Lin takes a step forward and slams her foot on the floor. Camera changes to a black and white shot of Lin's earthbending seismic sight. The waves move out from her foot towards the gaping hole. Lin retracts her foot and camera returns back to its original colored shot.)</i><br><br><b>Lin:</b> He must have collapsed the tunnel behind him.     <br><b>Mako:</b> And he rigged an explosion to destroy any evidence that might have been here.      <br><b>Korra:</b> This is where Zaheer got in and out. Aiwei was the traitor.     <br><b>Su:</b> <i>(disappointed)</i> I... <i>(narrows her eyes)</i> trusted him.      <br><br><i>(Kuvira runs into the room.)</i>    <br><br><b>Kuvira:</b> Is everyone okay?       <br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(to the guard)</i>  Aiwei is a fugitive. Get all available guards to search the mountainside and find out where this tunnel exits immediately! <br><br><i>(The guard climbs up the stairs to leave the house. Lin lays a hand on Su's shoulder as a gesture of comfort. Scene changes to the front doors of Su's house. View switches again to everyone hanging around in Su's office-study. Running footsteps are heard off-screen and we soon see Kuvira enter the room, standing at attention.)</i><br><br><b>Lin:</b> What did you find?          <br><b>Kuvira:</b> We located the end of the tunnel, but there's no sign of him. Just some fresh tire tracks.  <br><br><i>(Lin gives a nod to the guard and Mako steps away from the table he was leaning against.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> He had an escape plan all ready to go.        <br><b>Su:</b> <i>(slightly hunched over on the sofa)</i> I trusted him with my life. I thought we were family, <i>(closes her eyes)</i> but it was all a lie. <br><b>Mako:</b> Whoever these guys are, they're more powerful than we thought. And more dangerous.       <br><b>Korra:</b> That's why we have to find them. We're going to hold off our search for airbenders and hunt down Aiwei. Naga can track his scent.       <br><b>Asami:</b> And I bet if we find Aiwei, we'll find Zaheer.          <br><b>Lin:</b> No. <i>(the teens are taken aback and Lin stands up)</i> We're not hunting this group. There could be other secret agents in other parts of the world looking for you right now. I'm taking you back to Republic City where I can protect you.  <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(raises an eyebrow slightly)</i> If I wasn't safe here, then I'm not safe anywhere! I have to stop them.      <br><b>Lin:</b> It's too dangerous. You are not going!          <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(irritated)</i> Stop trying to protect me. <i>(narrows her eyes)</i> I'm the Avatar, this is my job! <br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(talks back)</i> Don't lecture me about jobs! <br><b>Su:</b> Enough! <i>(stands up)</i> Korra, listen to Lin.      <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(surprised)</i> But. They-          <br><b>Su:</b> <i>(interrupts)</i> Please. Lin's only looking out for you. I promise you Aiwei and everyone he's working with will be brought to justice.   <br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(glances to the side)</i> Fine. If you really think it's best. <br><b>Su:</b> I do.             <br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(smiles and lays a hand on her sister's shoulder)</i> Thank you, Su.        <br><b>Su:</b> Everyone should get some rest tonight. I'll have my people prep your airship and you can leave first thing in the morning.   <br><br><i>(Wistful music plays and we cut to one of the guest house apartments. View changes to the inside of the room where the teens are not asleep but are seated on the chairs and steps in the living room. They obviously have a lot on their mind. There is a knock on the door, catching their attention. Cut to Su's back view outside the door and it opens to reveal Korra.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Su.              <br><b>Su:</b> You really think Naga could track Aiwei?     <br><br><i>(Su walks into the room and Korra takes several steps backwards.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Definitely.         <br><b>Su:</b> Then here. <i>(raises a single metal key)</i> There's a jeep packed <i>(Korra takes the key)</i> with supplies by the East gate. <i>(Korra looks at the key uncertainly)</i> It's all gassed up and ready to go.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(slightly astonished)</i> What? Why?          <br><b>Su:</b> Because I want you to hunt down Aiwei and bring him back to me.       <br><b>Bolin:</b> But you said-        <br><b>Su:</b> I said what Lin wanted to hear, and I bought you guys some time. <i>(gives the teens a soft smile)</i> Go. I'll deal with Lin in the morning.       <br><br><i>(Cut to a frontal shot of Korra with her friends behind her and she turns around to address them.)</i>  <br><br><b>Korra:</b> Let's get this guy. <br><br><i>(They smile. Cut to Su as Korra throws her arms around the older woman, giving her a hug. Su is shocked by the gesture.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Thanks.             <br><br><i>(Su returns the hug and smiles. Scene changes to an aerial view just outside the city. Naga and a jeep come into frame and move forward on the dirt road. Cut to a close up shot of Korra looking determined as she rides Naga. Asami is seen driving the jeep behind her.)</i><br><br>    <br><br>[End Credits]

After a harrowing battle, Korra was saved, but she soon discovered a shocking truth. Aiwei, Su's trusted advisor, has been working with Zaheer. This Truth Seer turned traitor managed to escape, but Su tasks Team Avatar with tracking him down. Now the hunted to becomes the hunter as Korra searches for answers.<br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode opens to a few rocks dotting the desert landscape and we can see some spirits casually mingling about. In the background, Team Avatar has arrived in a desert town and Naga is seen stopping to sniff the ground. Cut to a close up of the group as Asami pulls in the jeep behind Korra.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(looks up)</i> Aiwei's <i>definitely</i> been through here. <i>(pets Naga's side)</i> Nice tracking, girl.<br><b>Mako:</b> Let's ask around. Maybe someone's seen him.<br><br><i>(Cut to the inside of a tavern as Mako pushes the curtain aside at the entrance. A couple of customers glance at them. As the team walks in, something catches Bolin's attention from the side and camera pans to reveal a wanted poster of him on the wall.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Ooh, look, they have a mover poster of me! <i>(Mako looks at the poster with mild surprise)</i> Must be big Nuktuk fans. <i>(rubs hands together)</i> Yeah. <i>(he starts to walk forward)</i> I should go over <i>(Mako grabs Bolin by his sleeve)</i> and say hello.<br><b>Mako:</b> No, those are <i>wanted</i> posters, <i>(camera zooms out to reveal the wanted posters for the other three members on the team)</i> and there's one for each of us. <i>(Cut to a close up of Korra's poster as Mako reads the details off-screen)</i> "Wanted by Her Majesty, the Earth Queen, for crimes against the kingdom." <i>(Cut to Mako as he raises an eyebrow while Korra is fuming behind him.)</i> I'm guessing this is because we took her airbenders?<br><b>Korra:</b> They weren't hers to keep! I swear, if i ever see her pinchy <i>(Asami glances back into the tavern)</i> little queen face again, I am gonna- <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(interrupts with alarm)</i> Uh, guys. <br><br><i>(Camera pans across the various patrons of the bar and one guy pulls out his sword while another shows off his spear.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> We should get out of here.<br><br><i>(The teens leave the establishment and Korra does an "I'm watching you" gesture to the customers before she departs.<br><br>Scene changes to an aerial view of Su's house in the morning with the remnants of the battle lingering in the shot. View switches to Su talking to two guards on the bridge as Lin walks towards her sister.)</i><br><br><b>Lin:</b> Where is everyone? I've been waiting to leave for half an hour.<br><b>Su:</b> And good morning to you too, Lin. Now, don't get mad. Korra's fine. I'm just waiting to hear if she tracked down Aiwei yet.<br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(furrows her brows)</i> What? You let Korra go?! I thought we were on the same page about this, and then you go stab me in the back?<br><b>Su:</b> Oh, don't be so overdramatic. You can't control the Avatar's every move.<br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(storms off)</i> I can try.<br><br><i>(Exciting music plays and we cut to Naga running with Korra on her back. Camera pans out to an aerial view of Team Avatar making their way down a path on the road. The jeep follows closely and Naga runs up a small slope. View switches to Naga sniffing the ground near a bunch of rocks.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Naga found something.<br><br><i>(Korra gets off her mount and Naga sits. The Avatar earthbends a giant boulder aside to reveal a jeep hidden behind a small clearing. Naga then gives Korra a nudge and awaits a reward.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Oh, sorry. I forgot to bring treats, <i>(Naga whines and bends down as Korra affectionate rubs the polar bear-dog's face.)</i> but good girl.<br><br><i>(Naga whines once more and turns to walk away. Her tail slaps against Korra's face and the Avatar groans in shock. Asami and the brothers are seen walking up to the escape vehicle in the background. Korra hunches her shoulder's from Naga's cold shoulder attitude.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> This must be Aiwei's jeep. He can't be far.<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(walks to the edge of the slope)</i> Bolin and I <i>(Cut to a view of a town nearby in the background)</i> will investigate the Misty Palms Oasis and see if he's holed up there.<br><b>Bolin:</b> Yes, I love it when you talk like a cop!<br><b>Korra:</b> I'm coming too. <br><b>Mako:</b> No. You and Asami wait here in case he comes back. Besides, we don't want to call too much attention to ourselves.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(reluctantly)</i> Alright. <br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(excitedly)</i> Ooh. Mako, Mako, Mako, we should wear disguises and pretend we're going undercover. Cut to a close up of Sato as she pulls out a note.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> I don't know, <i>(smiles)</i> but I think I found a clue.<br><br><i>(Korra turns around and gets off her perch. View switches to Zaheer's feet as they shuffle.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Don't move, Zaheer. <i>(his feet stops)</i> You're gonna give me some answers.<br><br><i>(Cut to Korra in an offensive stance. Neither of us has our bending, and I'm not going anywhere. I'll answer whatever questions you have. You deserve that much. <i>(Korra is confused and relaxes her stance just a bit. Zaheer softens his expression to help convince her.)</i> What would you like to know?<br><b>Korra:</b> First off, who are you people, and why do you keep trying to take me?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> We are part of a secret society dedicated to restoring freedom to the World. <i>We</i> are the Red Lotus. <br><b>Korra:</b> Red Lotus? Are you related to the White Lotus?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> We are what the White Lotus was meant to be. But after the hundred year war, the White Lotus lost its true purpose. Its members came out of hiding and openly served the Avatar. They became nothing but glorified bodyguards who served corrupt nations. So a great man named Xai Bau broke from the White Lotus and began his own society.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(warily)</i> That's a great story, but it doesn't explain why you tried to take me when I was a kid.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> That was Unalaq's idea.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(her eyes are wide with surprise)</i> What? <i>(she takes a step back)</i> My uncle was part of the Red Lotus?<br><br><i>(Scene changes to a cave at night with the crickets chirping in the background. From the outside, we can see a campfire burning inside the cave. Cut to the inner part of the cave with Zaheer meditating in the lotus position and the rest of his friends are resting in the background.)</i><br><br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(whispers)</i> Avatar Korra. <i>(the trio turn towards him)</i> Misty Palms Inn. <i>(Ghazan and P'li lean forward to listen closely)</i> Find her. <br><b>P'li:</b> <i>(turns her head to the earthbender and waterbender)</i> You two go. I'll stay here and make sure Zaheer's body is safe.<br><br><i>(Without another word, Ghazan and Ming-Hua stand to leave the cave. Location changes back to Xai Bau's Grove and Korra has taken a seat in the lotus position on the grass in front of the rain tree.)</i><br><br><b>Zaheer:</b> I met your uncle when I was a teenager after we had both joined the Red Lotus. We learned about Raava and Vaatu and how Avatar Wan foolishly severed them, disrupting the balance of the World forever.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(frowns)</i> Avatar Wan wasn't foolish. He was trying to restore balance.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> He closed the portals, severing humans from spirits. Even you realize the error in his ways.<br><b>Korra:</b> So all along, you and my uncle planned to use me to open the portals and release Vaatu? That's why you tried to take me when I was a kid?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> Yes, and with members of the Red Lotus as your elemental masters, we could've taught you <i>so</i> much.<br><b>Korra:</b> Sounds like you wanted to brainwash me so I'd do whatever you wanted.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> No, Korra. All I wanted was to show the Avatar a better path for the World.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Korra who looks uncertain. Camera fades back to Korra with her eyes closed in the Physical World. Everyone else is resting but Mako stands beside the window and continues to keep an eye outside. He suddenly looks alarmed. Cut to his point of view of Ghazan and Ming-Hua walking around the swimming pool.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Uh, I don't know how, <i>(Bolin starts to wake up)</i> but Water Arm Lady and Lava Guy found us. <i>(Bolin gasps loudly)</i><br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(stands)</i> How?<br><b>Mako:</b> I just said I don't know how.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(shakes Korra's shoulders)</i> Korra, come on, wake up.<br><b>Asami:</b> What do we do? <br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(carries Korra)</i> Get Korra out of here. <br><br><i>(Cut to Naga and Pabu as they wake up. Camera pans to the left to reveal that Mako has placed Korra on Naga's back.)</i> <br><br><b>Mako:</b> Bolin and I will hold them off.<br><br><i>(View switches to Ming-Hua with Ghazan peering into a room. A door opens off-screen and camera angle changes to Mako opening the door in Aiwei's room. Naga runs out soon after with Asami holding the unconscious Korra. Asami glances at two Red Lotus members as they make their escape.)</i><br><br><b>Ming-Hua:</b> <i>(switch to a close up of Ming-Hua)</i> The Avatar!<br><br><i>(Cut to an alley leading into the sleeping area of the inn as Naga runs into it and off-screen. Three shards of ice fly in soon after and smashes against the building. Ming-Hua propels herself off the ground towards the alley and extends a water arm out but a burst of fire from Mako evaporates the liquid. Mako sends another fire blast and Ming-Hua swipes it aside. Bolin bends a trail of earth towards Ghazan who jumps back. The lavabender changes the earth into lava and sends it back to the brothers as they tuck and roll away from the lava. As they land in squatting position, the camera focuses on Ming-Hua and Ghazan who are smiling.<br><br>Scene changes back to Xai Bau's Grove.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> If my uncle came up with a plan to abduct me when was a kid, why wasn't <i>he</i> caught?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> He wasn't with us that night, and he covered up his involvement afterwards.<br><b>Korra:</b> So he betrayed you just like he betrayed me. <br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(closes his eyes and nods)</i> Yes. <i>(opens his eyes)</i> He allowed me and my friends to remain imprisoned while he pursued his own selfish goals. Unalaq becoming a Dark Avatar was never part of our mission.<br><b>Korra:</b> And what is your <i>mission</i> exactly?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> I want what you want, to restore balance to this World.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(gives a short laugh)</i> I don't think our ideas of balance are the same.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> Are you sure about that? You kept the spirit portals open, but why stop there? Bringing the spirits back should only be the beginning.<br><b>Korra:</b> What do you mean?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> The idea of having nations and governments is as foolish as keeping the human and spirit realms separate. You've had to deal with a moronic President and a tyrannical Queen. Don't you think the world would be better off if leaders like them were eliminated?<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(shocked)</i> No. <i>(hestitant)</i> I mean, I don't really agree with what they've done, but taking out World Leaders isn't the answer.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> It wasn't too long ago that the airbenders were nearly all wiped out thanks to the Fire Lord's desire for World Dominance. True freedom can only be achieved when oppressive governments are torn down.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(frowns)</i> But that won't bring balance. It will throw the world into chaos.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> Exactly. The natural order is disorder. Do you know who once said, "New growth cannot exist without <i>first</i> the destruction of the old"?<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(glares)</i> No.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> The wise Guru Laghima, an <i>airbender</i>.<br><br><i>(Korra's expression changes to that of doubt. Scene changes to Mako running and rolling across a wooden plank on the roof top while dodging Ming-Hua's water arm. He sends out a blast of fire but Ming-Hua intercepts the attack, creating steam. Before it can clear, she unleashes another attack at Mako, breaking the plank under his feet. The firebender jumps and rolls away. As he stands up, he ducks to avoid Ming-Hua's water arm and he throws up fire to block the second attack. <br><br>Mako jumps off the roof top as Ming-Hua slams her arm down into the rock at just where Mako was standing. Cut to the ground as Mako lands with a tuck and roll and quickly pushes himself off the ground to run away from Ming-Hua who jumps down and pursues him. Bolin comes into screen holding a slab of earth protectively in front of his body. A stream of lava comes in frame and shatters the earth shield. Bolin bends another chunk of earth at Ghazan who jumps against the chunk, making it crumble into dust. The lavabender goes after Bolin.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(taking a step back)</i> I can't beat this guy!  <i>(he earthbends a mound of earth as more lava collides again it)</i> It's like I'm giving him ammo. Want to trade?<br><br><i>(View switches to Mako as a water arm from Ming-Hua shoots out to attack his feet but he runs up the wall and does a quick cartwheel. While he's upside down, the frame rate slows down as Mako chops the water arm with his fire. Frame rate returns to normal as Mako lands on his feet and he punches more fire but a stream of water comes in and encases his hand in ice and he is pushed against the door behind him. Cut to a profile shot of Mako as Ming-Hua brings her face close and gives him a slasher smile. With him still attached to her water arm, she swings it out, causing Mako to fly about in an arc before smashing into a wooden door. <br><br>Bolin comes into frame and casts a quick glance at his fallen brother before turning his head back to Ghazan soon after. The earthbender bends up two slabs of earth but Ghazan jumps over the mound and turns them into lava. Ghazan bends up three lava chunks and sends them to Bolin. Cut to Bolin running alongside the pool as he dodges the lava rocks. He then dives into the pool and scene changes to underwater as more lava is sent into the water. Bolin kicks his legs and propels himself forward to avoid the attacks. He presses himself against the wall of the pool and two more lava slabs fly into the water. Cut to a close up of Bolin who is disoriented and looks like he's about to run out of air. Switch to his point of view looking up at Ming-Hua standing at the edge of the pool. The waterbender waves her arms around and encases Bolin in a bubble. Cut to a full view of Bolin inside the water sphere as he is slowly lifted out of the pool. Scene changes to an aerial view of the skirmish as Ming-Hua has both arms raised.)</i><br><br><b>Ming-Hua:</b> Go get the Avatar. I have these two under control.<br><br><i>(Ghazan runs off and he passes by an unconscious Mako who is laying on a pile of broken wood. A water arm reaches in and lifts Mako's body and Ming-Hua holds the brothers high up. Bolin pops his head out of the water sphere, gasping for air. <br><br>View changes to Naga running out of the Misty Palms Oasis and camera zooms in on Asami who was initially looking to the side but turns her head to the front suddenly and gasps. Naga attemps to stop running and we cut to an overhead shot of the polar bear dog stopping just short of a slab of earth in front of her. Three more slabs are bent on all sides soon after to form a pyramid, trapping Asami, Korra, and Naga inside. Asami yelps and Naga barks.<br><br>Camera cuts back into the Spirit World.)</i><br><br><b>Zaheer:</b> You know, being locked away for so many years, I was beginning to lose hope. <i>(stands up)</i> But when I awoke with airbending, I knew <i>I</i> would be the one to destroy the Old World and plant seeds for a New World to flourish.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(stands and looks concerned)</i> Zaheer, please. As an airbender, you could help make a positive difference in the world instead of destroying it.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> You're a very smart young woman, Korra. But you must realize that once change begins, it cannot be stopped, even by the Avatar.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(annoyed)</i> Enough with your philosophical mumbo jumbo. I want to know one thing. If you do capture me, what are you gonna do with me?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> You'll have that answer soon enough. The Red Lotus should have you by now. <i>(smiles)</i> See you in the Physical World. <i>(he dematerializes)</i><br><b>Korra:</b> Zaheer! <br><br><i>(The Avatar runs towards the spot where Zaheer recently vacated. Cut to a close up of Korra who looks worried and camera flashes back to the Physical World. Korra is muzzled and is wearing straightjacket. She looks down in surprise and camera cuts to an overhead shot of Korra bound and tied by various straps against a dolly.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Zaheer, you tricked me. Let me go! <i>(she looks to Asami who has her hands handcuffed above her head)</i> Asami, are you okay? Where's the rest of the Red Lotus?<br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(looking defeated)</i> What's the Red Lotus? And Zaheer didn't capture us. The Earth Queen's forces did.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Where are we? <br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(looks down)</i> I'm not sure. <i>(Cut to a full view of the cell)</i> Some camp by the desert? <i>(both of the girls look at the camera)</i> They're taking us back to Ba Sing Se.<br><br><i>(Camera pulls back through a slit in the cell door. Location changes to the cave the Red Lotus is hiding in.)</i><br><br><b>Ghazan:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> The Earth Queen's army snatched up the Avatar before I could.<br><br><i>(Cut to the floor of the inside of the cave as Mako and Bolin fall to the ground, tied up. Bolin has a bruise on one eye.)</i><br><br><b>Ming-Hua:</b> But we figured <i>(camera pans up to Ming-Hua and Ghazan)</i> you could find a use for <i>(smiles)</i> <i>these</i> two.<br><br><i>(Camera switches to an overhead view of the cave with Zaheer and P'li standing and looking down at the brothers.)</i><br><br><b>Zaheer:</b> Load them in the truck. <i>(Cut to a close up of Zaheer as he smiles)</i> We're taking a trip to Ba Sing Se.<br><br><br><br>[End Credits]

After confronting Zaheer, Korra learned he is part of a secret society whose mission is to take out all the nation's leaders and destroy World order. But before Korra could warn anyone, she and Asami were apprehended by the Earth Queen's forces. And the Red Lotus nabbed Mako and Bolin. Now both parties are headed toward Ba Sing Se.<br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode opens to a building in the desert and we can see a group of people walking towards an airship. The Earth Queen is in danger from a group of terrorists calling themselves the Red Lotus! <i>(turns her attention to the captain as she is pushed up the ramp leading into the airship)</i> I talked to one of them in the Spirit World yesterday. He- he's insane.<br><b>Captain:</b> <i>(with a toothpick between his lips)</i> Screaming about terrorists in the Spirit World? You're the one who sounds insane.<br><br><i>(The middle aged captain turns and walks into his ship and the hatch closes. The airship takes off the ground soon after. Cut to a hand locking a chain from Korra's dolly to the wall. Camera pans out to Asami looking at her friend being locked up. An airman wearing a bandana then walks to Asami and grabs the girl's chains to tie her to a bar on the floor.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> Do I <i>(kneels on the ground)</i> have to be chained to the floor the whole way? <i>(looks back at Arik pitifully)</i> It's going to be <i>so</i> uncomfortable.<br><b>Arik:</b> <i>(continues to loop the chain around the bar)</i> Sorry, ma'am. I'm under orders.<br><b>Asami:</b> Can't you just <i>(looks at the railing on the wall)</i> chain me to that railing? <i>(Arik turns and looks)</i> I mean, where am I gonna go? <i>Please</i>.<br><br><i>(Asami pouts and Arik reconsiders.)</i><br><br><b>Arik:</b> Well, as long as you're chained up, I guess it doesn't make a difference.<br><br><i>(Camera pans to Asami chained to the railing against the wall.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(smiles)</i> Thank you, Sir.<br><b>Korra:</b> Can I have some water? <br><b>Arik:</b> <i>(points a finger at Korra)</i> No water. We're also not gonna bring you any rocks or fire, so don't ask. <i>(places a hand on his chin)</i> I guess there's air, but there's nothing we can do about that. We're not opening your compartment until we reach Ba Sing Se.<br><br><i>(Arik turns to leave the room.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I hoped Mako and Bolin <i>(Arik slams the door shut off-screen)</i> would have shown up to save us by now. I wonder if they're okay.<br><br><i>(Scene changes to a truck driving along a desert road. Cut to the inside of the truck and we can see Zaheer is driving while his girlfriend is in the passenger's seat.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> If you think<i>(cut to the back of the truck where Ghazan and Ming-Hua are seated on a bench and looking at the brothers tied up together on the floor)</i> holding us hostage will give you some leverage to use against the Avatar, you're gonna be <i>very</i> disappointed.<br><b>Ming-Hua:</b> <i>(acidly)</i> Can't we just enjoy our time together in <i>silence</i>?<br><b>Mako:</b> And why did you need Korra alive back in Zaofu? You had her paralyzed, why didn't you just take her out when you had the chance?<br><b>Ghazan:</b> Look, all you need to know is that the World is about to change, for the better.<br><b>Bolin:</b> So you guys were, like, locked up for fifteen years, huh? That must have been, like, crazy boring.<br><b>Ghazan:</b> Actually, it was only thirteen years, but it felt like thirty.<br><b>Bolin:</b> I mean, what did you do with all that time? Did you sing songs, work on crafts?<br><b>Ming-Hua:</b> Not a lot of craft supplies in a <i>volcanic</i> prison cell.<br><b>Ghazan:</b> <i>(softens his expression)</i> And I must have renamed the constellations about a thousand times. When it rained, that was a big event.<br><b>Ming-Hua:</b> Oh, I would've killed for some rain. Mostly I just made up stories about the guards. <i>(her eyes glance up wistfully)</i> Who was having trouble with his girlfriend? Which one secretly wished he'd become a pastry chef?<br><b>Bolin:</b> Ooh, okay, that sounds like fun. Let me try that on you guys. <i>(glances at Ghazan)</i> You were raised by an older sister. Your mustache grew in when you were ten. And I'm sensing- just sensing- an unspoken attraction <i>(Ghazan and Ming-Hua look at each other awkwardly)</i> between you two.<br><br><i>(Ming-Hua gives Ghazan a sulking look and turns away, surprising the lavabender.)</i><br><br><b>Ghazan:</b> <i>(smiles at Bolin)</i> Two out of three. Not bad.<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(annoyed)</i> Bolin, will you stop making <i>friends</i> with the bad guys?<br><b>Bolin:</b> Sorry.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> Ghazan, gag those two. We're almost there.<br><br><i>(Cut a view of the truck approaching the outer wall of Ba Sing Se. Scene changes to the Earth Kingdom airship flying over the Si Wong Desert. Cut to Korra struggling against her dolly with all her might but the lock holds firmly.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(looks at Asami)</i> We have to find a way out of this prison before we get to the Earth Queen.<br><b>Asami:</b> Don't worry, I have a plan. These airships that Cabbage Corp sold to the Earth Kingdom are <i>way</i> cheaper than the ones Future Industries built.<br><br><i>(Asami plants both feet against the wall and pushes against it. Camera switches to a close up of the bars on the wall as Asami pulls it away with a grunt. She jumps over the bar so her hands are now in front of her instead of behind her. Asami tosses the bar in the air to get it into the right position.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(catches the railing and gives it a once over)</i> Now, that's just shoddy workmanship. <i>(walks up to Korra's dolly to inspect)</i> There's no way I can get these locks off. I need the keys. <br><br><i>(Miss Sato glances around the compartment before looking down at the floor with a smile. Using the railing as a lever, Asami pries off the metal tile from the floor and we can see pipes and light below.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(to Korra)</i> Give me five minutes, then start yelling for help.<br><br><i>(Asami bends down and puts the railing aside before crawling into the vents under the floor. Location changes to the Earth Queen's palace in Ba Sing Se. Cut to her throne room.)</i><br><br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> When is the Avatar scheduled for delivery?<br><b>Gun:</b> The airship already left Fort Bosco and should be arriving in a few hours.<br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> <i>Excellent</i>. <i>(laces her fingers together)</i> Bring her to me as soon as it lands.<br><b>Gun:</b> Yes, Your Majesty. But first there are some people here who captured two of the Avatar's friends. <i>(Cut to the queen who scowls)</i> They would like to present them to you personally.<br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> You know I don't meet with bounty hunters!<br><b>Gun:</b> <i>(shrugs a little)</i> And of course I told them that, but they say they have some information that might interest you about the location of your stolen airbenders.<br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> Really? <i>(gives a smile of amusement)</i> Fine, send them in.<br><br><i>(Cut to the brothers gagged and tied as they are shoved on the floor in front of the throne. Switch to a close up of the queen as she glares at them.)</i><br><br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> Ah, yes. I remember <i>these</i> two. <i>(view changes to the brothers and the feet of the Red Lotus members standing behind them)</i> We'll find an acceptable home for you in <i>prison</i> with the rest of the dissidents. <i>(camera pans up to a full view shot of the Red Lotus crew)</i> Now, I'm told you have some <i>information</i> for me. I hope this isn't just some <i>ruse</i> to try to increase your bounty.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> We don't want any bounty, Your Majesty. <i>(gestures an arm out to Mako and Bolin)</i> You can consider these two a <i>(smiles)</i> thank you gift for simply taking the time to talk to us.<br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> <i>(a little suspicious)</i> How very magnanimous. So, where are my airbenders?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(grins)</i> I'd be happy to tell you once you hand the Avatar over to me.<br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> Who told you that we have the Avatar?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(smirks)</i> How I know is not important. <i>(turns serious)</i> But if I found out, others will too. And that could put <i>you</i> in a difficult position.<br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> <i>(patronizing them with a hand on her cheek)</i> Is that so?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> Your Majesty, imprisoning the Avatar will cause the other nations to turn against you and demand her freedom. Before long, you'll be in the midst of a sticky international incident. <i>(gestures to himself)</i> But if you let me take her today, no one need ever know she was here, and you can get your airbenders back without interference. We both win.<br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> <i>(still being a little arrogant)</i> And what do you plan to do with the Avatar, should I see <i>fit</i> to grant your request?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> All I can say is that I have business with her. But she won't be bothering you again, <i>(Bolin and Mako look at each other worriedly)</i> I can assure you of that.<br><br><i>(Cut to the queen who ponders over the deal while tapping her long finger nails on the arm of the throne. She then sits up straight with a smile.)</i><br><br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> I find these terms agreeable. Gun, escort them to the antechamber until the Avatar's arrival. <br><br><i>(Gun gestures a palm out of the throne room and the Red Lotus leaves along with him. Cut to an overhead shot of the throne room.)</i><br><br><b>Queen Hou-Ting:</b> Send these two to the dungeon.<br><br><i>(Two Dai Li agents step forth and bend the floor under the brothers as they fall through the trap door. The siblings give a muffled yell and the ground closes above them soon after. <br><br>Scene changes to the Earth Kingdom airship still flying over the sea of sand in the Si Wong Desert. Cut to Arik standing outside the door of Korra's compartment)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Guard! <i>(Arik is alarmed and slides open the viewing slot into the cell)</i> Get in here! Something happened to my friend! She needs help!<br><br><i>(Arik's eyes glance left and right. We cut to his point of view looking into a relatively empty compartment unit.)</i><br><br><b>Arik:</b> Where is she?<br><br><i>(The airman is roughly shoved against the door and he slides down comically to reveal Asami behind him in a "chopping" pose. She bends down and we cut to the inside of the compartment as the door opens inwards. Asami no longer has chains on her wrists and she twirls the keys around her finger repeatedly in a circle. Cut to the ground as the straightjacket falls on it in a heap. Camera pans up to a freed Korra.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Nice work. <i>(removes the muzzle)</i> Now let's take control of this ship.<br><br><i>(She tosses the muzzle aside and scene changes to the cockpit where the captain relaxes with his feet on the dashboard while his co-pilot is at the steering wheel. Korra kicks the door open and the co-pilot rushes towards her but he is knocked back into the steering wheel with airbending. The wheel sparks as it is damaged from the impact. View changes to the outside as the airship shakes from the lost of control.)</i><br><br><b>Captain:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Mayday, mayday! <i>(cut to the captain talking into the radio as his co-pilot struggles to stand up)</i> The Avatar has escaped. <i>(the alarms buzz and flash red)</i> We're going down in Quadrant Four of the Si Wong Desert.<br><br><i>(The co-pilot runs towards Korra again and she unleashes another attack which slams the co-pilot back into his captain. We can see bits of the radio flying as well. Asami steps in and grabs the steering wheel.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> I think you might have been a little <i>(tugs the wheel back into position)</i> overaggressive with the airbending. <i>(cut to a frontal shot of Asami who looks a little distressed and Korra appears concerned behind her)</i> The controls are busted. <i>(she picks up the radio that is broken into two and are connected by frayed wires)</i> Also, you broke the radio.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(defensive)</i> Sorry, but it's not my fault this airship's a hunk of junk.<br><br><i>(View changes to the outside as the airship slowly descends.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Hang on to something!<br><br><i>(The airship angles downwards and crashes into a sand dune. Cut to an overhead view of the accident as a cloud of smoke is emitted from the airship before everything is still. Cut to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode returns to the airship crash site. Cut to a close up of the ship as the hatch on the roof opens to reveal Korra and Asami. Both of them look out into the desert.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> Well, they say any landing you can walk away from is a good landing. Cut to Mako seated on the bed and Bolin leaning against the bars in their cell. I could finally get some sleep. <i>(dismayed)</i> But now I really miss them.<br><br><i>(We return back to Mako and Bolin in their cell.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(looks at his brother)</i> Listen, Bolin, this is up to you. I believe in you.<br><b>Prisoner:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> I believe in you too, Bolin!<br><b>Bolin:</b> I appreciate that, Mako and <i>(looks at the mirror)</i> fellow... <i>(hesitates for a while)</i> prisoner man, but I've been trying and trying and trying, and I've never <i>(thrusts both hands in a "no" gesture)</i> been able to do it! Okay. <i>(gets into the horse stance)</i> Here I go. <i>(draws his arms in)</i> Metalbending! <i>(shoves both hands out towards the bars)</i> Agh!<br><br><i>(He makes strained battle cry noises but nothing happens. The prisoner with the mirror extends the object to the brothers' once more.)</i><br><br><b>Prisoner:</b> Hey, you guys didn't happen to bring any toilet paper, did you?<br><br><i>(Scene changes to Lin driving a jeep along rocky, desert path. The sandbenders look on with quiet amusement.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(humors)</i> You want to buy a slightly used sand-sailer?<br><br><i>(Everyone disembarks from the vehicle onto the wooden docks.)</i><br><br><b>Captain:</b> Thanks, Asami. You've got a good head on your shoulders.<br><b>Korra:</b> I'm sorry for getting us stranded out there. I didn't mean for that to happen.<br><b>Captain:</b> You know, whatever the conflict between you and the Queen is, I'm sure <i>(extends his hand out but it is made of a metal hook instead of flesh and bone)</i> it's above my pay grade. <i>(Korra shakes the hook hand)</i> You got a tough job. <i>(they end the handshake)</i> Good luck, Avatar.<br><br><i>(The captain gives Korra a salute and turns back to his crew)</i><br><br><b>Arik:</b> Captain, have we been in the desert too long, <i>(he points off-screen and the rest follow his line of sight)</i> or is that really a dragon over there?<br><br><i>(Cut to Zuko's red dragon intently eyeing a pair of camels tied up to a tree. The ropes on the camels are taut as the animals pull away from the dragon in fear. View returns back to the Captain and his team.)</i><br><br><b>Captain:</b> Ugh. Let's go get a drink.<br><br><i>(Everyone walks off-screen and camera angle changes to Korra watching them walk off. The sound of a dog grunting is heard and Naga tackles Korra down on the wooden planks.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(surprised)</i> Ah! <i>(Naga begins to lick her master's face and Korra laughs)</i> Easy, girl. Did you think we weren't coming back for you?<br><br><i>(Korra gives her mount an eskimo kiss with their noses. Cut to the curtains inside a tavern as it is pulled aside to reveal Korra and Asami. Jazz music plays and view changes to the inside of the establishment with Tonraq, Zuko, and Lin seated at a table at the back of the tavern. Korra and Asami runs up to them.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> What are you all doing here? <br><br><i>(Everyone at the table turns their heads towards the teens)</i><br><br><b>Tonraq:</b> <i>(stands up)</i> Korra, you're safe.<br><br><i>(Father and daughter share a hug.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Yeah, we made it out of the desert, <i>(looks to her friend)</i> thanks to Asami.<br><br><i>(Tonraq gives a nod of gratitude at Asami. Korra walks to Zuko as the ex-Fire Lord stands up to greet her.)</i><br><br><b>Tonraq:</b> Do you remember Lord Zuko?<br><b>Lord Zuko:</b> I met you when you were a very young girl. It's good to see you again, Avatar Korra.<br><b>Korra:</b> It's good to see you, Lord Zuko.<br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(gives Korra a little glare of annoyance)</i> Thanks for ditching me back at Zaofu.<br><b>Korra:</b> Yeah, sorry about that. But how did you all find us?<br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(dryly)</i> I am <i>(raises an eyebrow)</i> a <i>detective</i>, you know.<br><b>Asami:</b> Did you find Mako and Bolin?<br><b>Lin:</b> Some people at the inn saw them get captured by Zaheer's crew. <i>(Korra and Asami frown with concern)</i> We don't know where they are.<br><b>Tonraq:</b> Did you hear about the Earth Queen?<br><b>Korra:</b> What about her?<br><br><i>(The radio at the bar blares to life and everyone turns their attention to it.)</i> <br><br><b>Radio Broadcaster:</b> Once again, the Earth Queen's reign has come to an abrupt and violent end. <i>(camera slowly zooms in towards the bar)</i> Ba Sing Se has descended into chaos. <i>(cut to a close up of the radio)</i> Rioters and looters have overrun the palace.<br><br><i>(Cut to Korra looking down in quiet anger.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> The Red Lotus. <br><b>Tonraq:</b> <i>(scowls)</i> What's that?<br><b>Korra:</b> The name of the group that's been trying to capture me and just took out the Earth Queen. I'm afraid <i>(looks at her father with a soft look on her face)</i> this is only the beginning, Dad.<br><br><i>(Switch to a view of the Misty Palms Oasis bathed in orange light as the Sun is about to set.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]
<b>The Ultimatum</b><br><b>Written By:</b> Joshua Hamilton<br><b>Directed By:</b> Colin Heck<br><b>Storyboard By:</b> Eugene Lee, Natasha Presler-Wicke, William Ruzicka<br><b>Animation By:</b> Studio Mir<br><b>Transcriber:</b> Icy_Ashford <br><br><br><br><i>[Previously on "The Legend of Korra" sequence, including clips from "Long Live the Queen".]</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> Ba Sing Se has fallen! After Zaheer and the Red Lotus toppled the Earth Queen, the city descended into chaos. Meanwhile, Korra and Asami tried to escape their captors but crashed in the desert. After getting to safety, they met up with Lord Zuko, Tonraq, and Bei Fong. Back in Ba Sing Se, Zaheer freed Mako and Bolin, giving them a vital message to deliver to Korra. But will the brothers find her in time?<br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode opens to an aerial view of the Ba Sing Se palace and smoke emits from various parts of the palace grounds. An Earth Kingdom airship takes off from the landing area. Cut to a looter grabbing an intricate porcelain vase. View changes to another looter grabbing a vertical scenic painting of mountains and trees. Cut to Mako and Bolin walking out of the palace entrance as looters rush in. Bolin looks around in shock.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(looks around)</i> I can't believe it. The Upper Ring is in chaos.<br><br><i>(Switch to a trio of looters confronting a royal palace guard who is armed with a spear.)</i><br><br><b>Looter:</b> <i>(points at the guard)</i> Don't try to stop us. We're taking back what's ours.<br><b>Royal Guard:</b> Stop you? <i>(pulls off his hat)</i> I'm gonna join you. <i>(smiles)</i> I know where the <i>good</i> stuff is. <br><br><i>(The guard points his spear towards the inside of the palace and runs off. The looters follow him. Cut Bolin who steps back to allow a looter with a vase on his head and a small bench in hand to pass.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Should we do something? <i>(Another looter passes behind Bolin, carrying a changing screen.)</i><br><b>Mako:</b> This isn't our battle. <i>(walks off-screen)</i> We have to deliver Zaheer's message to Korra immediately.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(follows Mako)</i> Right. Okay. Find Korra, deliver message. <i>(Cut to an overhead view of the brothers and more looters rush up the stairs leading into the palace. We can see a more airships taking off in the background.)</i> Yeah, this should be easy. We just gotta get out of the city and get to the desert, then somehow find her in the vast, expansive wasteland <i>(Switch to a close up of the brothers as Mako scans the sky while Bolin slowly grows defeated)</i> that goes on for thousands and thousands of miles. <i>(sighs)</i> This isn't gonna be easy.<br><br><i>(View focuses on an airborne airship and we cut back to Mako.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> We need an airship.<br><br><i>(Scene changes to one lone airship left on the ground as the looters continue to head to the palace. View switches to the inside of the airship as Mako runs into it. Mako raises a hand up and Bolin runs smack into his brother's hand.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Ooh!<br><br><i>(Both of them look into the inside of the ship with mild surprise. Camera pans out to reveal four looters tinkering with the airship parts.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Excuse me, <i>(the looters turn to look at Mako)</i> may I have your attention please? I'm with the Republic City Police, and I need to commandeer this airship to help the <i>Avatar</i>.<br><br><i>(One of the looters peels off a panel from the the wall. Everyone ignores Mako and continues to raid the ship. Cut to a dismayed Mako while his brother quietly stares at the looters.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Let me give it a shot. Hey, the Queen's gold <i>(points out)</i> is on the third floor of the palace! <i>(the looters stop and smile)</i> Second door on the right! <br><br><i>(The raiders leave and Mako smiles at his brother.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(arms akimbo and feeling accomplished)</i> You just gotta know how to talk to them, bro.<br><br><i>(The brothers run to the controls and Bolin sits down in the pilot's chair. Mako is alarmed by the property damage.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> They took everything. <i>(picks up a couple of frayed wires)</i> I mean, who rips out a transmission radio?<br><b>Bolin:</b> Some folks just do not <i>(Mako throws the wires down angrily)</i> have respect For other people's property. <i>(cracks his fingers)</i> Now let's steal this airship! <i>(Bolin sticks a tongue out of his mouth and lands both hands on two different levers)</i><br><b>Mako:</b> You know how to fly this thing?<br><b>Bolin:</b> Technically speaking? No. But, come on, how hard can it be? <br><br><i>(A piece of broken glass pops out from its socket. Bolin pushes a lever forward and we immediately cut to the outside where the airship barrels down and scraps along the ground. The civilians begin to panic and they start to run away.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Up! Up!<br><b>Bolin:</b> I don't see any "up" button. I see levers and switches. Oh, <i>(the airship begins to pull up)</i> there it is.<br><br><i>(The airship finally takes off and scene fades to fires ravaging the Lower Ring of Ba Sing Se. Through the smoke, we can see the brothers' airship slowly making its way out. Cut to an overhead view of some citizens looking at an apartment complex burn down. Cut to Mako looking down from the window. Ash and ember float upwards and surround the airship.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> The whole city is falling to pieces.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(glances at his brother worriedly)</i> Mako, our family's down there.<br><br><i>(View changes to Bolin at the pilot's seat and Mako shoves him away, taking over the controls.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Move over. <br><b>Bolin:</b> Ahh!<br><b>Mako:</b> We're getting them out.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(sits up)</i> Oh, you think <i>(Mako adjusts a knob off to the side)</i> just because you dated Asami, you know how to fly this better than me?<br><b>Mako:</b> Yeah.<br><br><i>(Mako tugs on a lever and we cut to the airship speedily making its way to Yin's apartment and the surrounding buildings are covered in flames. Cut to Bolin who lands on the roof and then slides down a ladder. Cut to the inside of a window as Bolin pops his head in.)</i><br><br><b>Chow:</b> Bolin? <i>(Camera pans out to Yin's family gathered in the living room and the relatives turn to look at the earthbender)</i> What are <i>(stands up)</i> you doing here?<br><br><i>(Bolin climbs in through the window.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> I came to get you guys out. This whole block is about to go up in flames. <i>(Cut to a frontal shot of Bolin as he waves his hand towards the window and we can see Tu, his grandmother and some relatives seated on the ground.)</i> Come on, Mako and I have an airship on the roof. <i>(Bolin starts to move away)</i><br><b>Tu:</b> We can't. <i>(Bolin stops in his tracks and turns around to look at his cousin)</i> Grandma won't go.<br><b>Yin:</b> <i>(Cut to a close up of a stubborn Yin)</i> This place is my whole world. <i>(slams a fist down on her lap)</i> I will not leave. <i>(softens her expression)</i> Oh, but I'm so glad <i>(stands up and loops her arms around Bolin's elbow)</i> my little Bolin has come back to visit. Sit down. <i>(tugs her grandson forward but Bolin resists)</i> Would you like some tea?<br><b>Bolin:</b> Grandma, <i>(grabs Yin by the shoulders)</i> we don't have time for tea.<br><br><i>(Everyone turns to look at the flames licking the entrance to the apartment and the outline of the doors glow red hot.)</i><br><br><b>Chow:</b> Mom, please.<br><b>Yin:</b> <i>(looks at her son and waves both fists down)</i> No! I can't abandon the place where I raised my family. <i>(turns back to look at Bolin)</i> It's my home.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(holds Yin's hands and speaks gently)</i> Grandma, there's one thing that Mako and I have learned from all our years on the street. <i>(Cut to a close up of Yin with tears shining in her eyes)</i> It doesn't matter where you go. If you have your family with you, you'll always be at home.<br><b>Yin:</b> <i>(closes her eyes and speaks stubbornly)</i> I'm not going.<br><b>Bolin:</b> Fine! <i>(hoists Yin onto his shoulder)</i> You leave me no choice. <i>(gestures to the window)</i> We're rolling out!<br><b>Yin:</b> <i>(gasps)</i> Wait. <i>(view changes to the Earth Queen's portrait and Yin takes it in her hands)</i> Okay, let's go.<br><br><i>(View changes to the roof as the family climbs up the ladder and into the airship. Switch to the inside of the apartment complex as it is completed consumed by the inferno. An explosion occurs and glass breaks. The airship sails above the apartment to safety. Cut to a slight aerial view of the Lower Ring as the fire starts to spread. The airship flies into frame and continues to move forward. Scene cuts back to the inside of the airship with Bolin at the controls and Mako along with Tu standing behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Tu:</b> Thanks for getting us out of there. <i>(Tu starts to brag and Mako crosses his arms and raises an eyebrow.)</i> I mean, I probably could have handled it myself if you guys didn't show up, but thanks.<br><br><i>(The brothers smile and we cut to a close up of Yin hanging the Earth Queen's picture on a wall of the airship.)</i><br><br><b>Yin:</b> <i>(kisses at the portrait with her hands and puts them in a praying gesture)</i> May she rest in peace. <i>(Mako walks into frame with a map in hand and Yin turns towards him.)</i> This airship is nice. Is it our new home?<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(rests a hand on Yin's shoulder)</i> No, Grandma, I'm not sure where we're gonna take you. But right now, we need to find Korra.<br><b>Chow:</b> <i>(walks in)</i> Did something happen to the Avatar?<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(grabs the map)</i> I'm afraid so. <i>(Cut to a close up of the map being rolled open to reveal a map of the Earth Kingdom and its military bases)</i> Her airship went down somewhere in the desert. <i>(points to the desert on the map)</i> She was coming from a military base near the Misty Palms Oasis and heading <i>(points to the walled city on the map)</i> to Ba Sing Se. <i>(Cut to a full view of all the relatives listening to Mako's plan)</i> If we retrace her route back to the base, we should find the wreckage.<br><br><i>(Location changes to the Si Wong Desert shrouded in darkness but the Sun rises, illuminating its rays on the sand. Camera fades to a view of all the relatives gathered on both sides of the ship, looking out the window. Camera fades to a pregnant relative with a hand on her belly looking out the window and we can see her reflection in the glass. She looks a little despondent. Camera fades again to the outside of the ship looking in and we see the relatives at the windows slowly growing tired. A young girl yawns. Tu has a telescope in hand. Camera fades to the children sleeping either on the floor or in their mother's lap. Cut back to Tu still looking through the spyglass.)</i><br><br><b>Tu:</b> Guys, <i>(an older man beside him stirs)</i> it's the wreckage! <i>(Cut to Mako at the controls and he along with Bolin turn their attention to Tu)</i> I found it. <i>(switch to an over the shoulder shot of Tu as he points to ruins in the distance)</i> There.<br><br><i>(Cut to the shambles on the ground as the airship hovers above it)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> That's a Ba Sing Se airship, all right. But where's the rest of it? <br><br><i>(View changes to the brothers and Tu at the window.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> I don't know, <i>(points out and camera cuts to an aerial view of the wreckage)</i> but there are some tracks. <br><br><i>(Camera pans out to a winding curvy trail of the sandsailer's route from the previous episode. The airship follows and scene changes to Zuko's dragon sleeping outside the Misty Palms Oasis. It lifts its head up suddenly and beats its wings, flying off the ground with a roar. The airship roughly lands at the spot the dragon was on. Cut to an aerial view of the village as the airship creaks. We can see that Zuko's mount has perched itself on the walls of the Misty Palms Oasis. View changes to the controls of the airship. Mako's hair is messy, Bolin is splayed out on the control panel while Tu is on the floor rubbing his head.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> See? I told you, landing is hard.<br><br><i>(Mako looks at Bolin tiredly. Scene switches to a fish spirit flying down to the ice fountain and we see a myriad of spirits playing in the frozen water. The brothers walk in followed by their extended family.)</i><br><br><b>Female Relative:</b> <i>(gasps in awe)</i> Spirits!<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(jumps and stands on the side of the fountain to address his relatives)</i> Okay, guys, we think Korra found her way back here. <i>(Pabu squeaks and climbs up Bolin's legs)</i> Now let's split off into teams and scour the town. <i>(Pabu perches on Bolin's shoulder and he notices)</i> Yes, we'll need your help too, Pabu. <i>(Cut to a close up of Bolin)</i> Now just give me a second while I- <i>(gasps as he takes a look at Pabu once more)</i> Wait. <i>(grabs his fire ferret with both hands)</i> Pabu? <i>(he has tears in his eyes)</i> Pabu!<br><br><i>(Bolin swings his pet in the air for a short while before hugging the creature close to his body and yelling with joy. Pabu squeaks happily. Cut to a close up of Yin and Chow looking at Bolin with disbelief.)</i><br><br><b>Yin:</b> <i>(whispers to her son)</i> Why is Bolin hugging that big rat? <i>(Chow shakes his head and Yin puts both hands on her mouth)</i> Ew. <i>(turns away)</i> Now he's kissing it.<br><br><i>(Cut to Bolin kissing Pabu's snout.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> I'm never gonna let you go again.<br><br><i>(Cut to Tu pointing off-screen in alarm)</i><br><br><b>Tu:</b> Guys, look out! <i>(rushing footsteps can be heard)</i> Giant dog-beast thingy!<br><br><i>(The relatives disperse, leaving Mako alone as he turns to the side with his eyes wide open. Switch to an side view shot of Mako as Naga pounces on him, throwing the firebender down on the ground. The polar bear-dog licks Mako happily.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(puts both hands up in an attempt to stop Naga's licking)</i> Okay, all right, Naga. <i>(Bolin runs up to his brother)</i> It's good to see you too. <i>(Cut to a close up of Mako's face as Naga licks all of it)</i> Ahh, stop. <i>(turns to the side and Naga licks Mako's ear)</i> You're licking my mouth.<br><br><i>(Naga finally stops and Mako sits up, coughing and wiping his lips against the back of his glove.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Asami! Korra! <br><br><i>(Mako looks up with surprise. View switches to both girls running out from an establishment.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> You guys are okay! <br><br><i>(Mako pushes himself off the ground and both brothers rush up to them. Bolin comically slides in and gawks at Zuko with admiration. Zuko and Lin look at the earthbender's antics.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Oh, my gosh. <i>(whispers to Mako behind him)</i> It's Lord Zuko. <i>(starts to squee)</i> I can't believe it.<br><br><i>(Bolin whimpers and flails about as he tries to reach out to touch Zuko but stops himself. Mako pulls his brother back.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Uh, forgive my brother. <i>(bows to Zuko)</i> We're just really honored <i>(Bolin bows as well)</i> to meet you, sir.<br><b>Lord Zuko:</b> <i>(returns the bow)</i> It's a pleasure to meet you as well.<br><br><i>(Cut to Asami looking on and Yin walks in and takes Asami's hands in her grasp.)</i><br><br><b>Yin:</b> You must be the Avatar. <i>(Asami smiles nervously)</i> Mako told me so much about you. <i>(Asami cringes a bit but maintains the smile)</i> You are even more beautiful than I imagined. <i>(Mako walks to his grandmother with Korra beside him and Asami looks up.)</i><br><b>Mako:</b> Uh, actually, <i>(Asami gives another nervous grin)</i> that's Asami. <i>(he gestures to Korra)</i> This is Avatar Korra. <i>(Yin releases her hold on Asami and turns to the Avatar)</i> Korra, this is my Grandma, Yin.<br><br><i>(Korra extends a hand out for a handshake but Yin holds Korra's arm with both hands and examines them.)</i><br><br><b>Yin:</b> You are very... muscular for a woman. <i>(smiles)</i><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(awkwardly)</i> Um, thanks. You too?<br><br><i>(Yin holds Korra and Asami in each hand.)</i><br><br><b>Yin:</b> What lovely young women. <i>(Korra smiles at Yin)</i> Mako, why aren't you dating any nice girls <i>(all three teens widen their eyes in shock)</i> like them?<br><br><i>(There is a brief silence as Korra and Asami smirk while Mako still looks apprehensive.)</i><br><br><b>Asami:</b> <i>(breaks the silence)</i> Uh... so what happened to you two? Where have you been?<br><b>Mako:</b> We were captured by Zaheer and taken to Ba Sing Se. <i>(turns to Korra)</i> We were there when the Earth Queen was overthrown.<br><b>Korra:</b> What? <i>(turns to Bolin as he walks in)</i> How did you escape?<br><b>Mako:</b> Zaheer let us go.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(glances at Bolin)</i> Why would he do that?<br><b>Bolin:</b> Because he wanted us to find you and deliver a message.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of a concerned Mako.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Zaheer is headed to the Northern Air Temple as we speak. He said he's gonna wipe out the new Air Nation and everyone in it, unless you turn yourself over to him.<br><br><i>(Camera switches to a profile shot of Korra as she widens her eyes with horror. Cut to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b> <br><br><i>(Episode returns to Team Avatar and the adults gathered around in a circle.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(sadly)</i> Zaheer's threatening innocent lives, just to get to me.<br><b>Tonraq:</b> He <i>(Lin, Bolin, and Mako turn towards him)</i> could be bluffing. <br><b>Mako:</b> He's <i>(Lin & Bolin turn to the firebender)</i> already taken out the Earth Queen. I don't think he bluffs.<br><b>Korra:</b> We need to radio Tenzin and warn him that the Red Lotus is coming.<br><b>Mako:</b> I agree. Unfortunately, We don't have a radio on the airship.<br><b>Tonraq:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> There's a portable radio in the jeep, <i>(cut to an overhead shot of the whole group)</i> but the signal will never make it to the Northern Air Temple.<br><b>Lin:</b> We need to get to a place that has a strong radio transmitter. The Metal Clan will have one.<br><b>Korra:</b> Let's go. We'll radio Su on the way. <i>(looks down)</i> Hopefully she can get ahold of Tenzin at the air temple by the time we get to Zaofu.<br><br><i>(Location changes to the airship and Zuko's dragon flying towards the docking platform in Zaofu. View changes to the docking bay itself as Su waits for everyone to disembark from the airship. Cut to a close up profile shot of Su with her hands clapsed together and looking worried.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Did you <i>(camera pulls out a bit as Korra, Tonraq, and Lin walk up to the matriach)</i> have any luck getting through to Tenzin?<br><b>Su:</b> <i>(frowns slightly)</i> No one's answering. <i>(perturbed and hunches over slightly)</i> What if Zaheer is already up there? I should never have let Opal go.<br><b>Lin:</b> <i>(walks up to her sister and rests a hand on Su's shoulder)</i> It's going to be okay, Su.<br><b>Su:</b> I hope so.<br><br><i>(Cut to a hand adjusting a couple of dials on the radio. There is some static followed by silence on the other end of the radio.
