Meanwhile, Varrick and Bolin escaped from Baatar Jr. and are on the run. But will they make it back to the city in time to warn everyone about Kuvira's new spirit energy super weapon?<br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode opens up to a shot of a rock sculpture on Air Temple Island. Or Bolin?<br><b>Korra:</b> I don't know. <i>(look down, ashamed)</i> I guess I didn't know what to say.<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(crosses his arms and leans back into his seat)</i> A "hello" would have been nice.<br><b>Wu:</b> Mako, if it makes you feel any better, she didn't write me either.<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(annoyed)</i> Why would she... <i>(sighs and looks away)</i> Never mind.<br><b>Korra:</b> I'm sorry I didn't stay in touch, but I'm back now. I wanted to come back, but I never felt ready until now.<br><br><i>(Wu slams his empty glass on the table, catching their attention. Switch back to a full view of the table as Wu stands up.)</i><br><br><b>Wu:</b> As much as I'm enjoying this little catch-up, my royal bladder is about to explode. <i>(snaps his fingers)</i> Mako? <i>(brings his elbow up)</i> Come on, I need you to stand guard.<br><b>Mako:</b> I'm not gonna hold your hand every time you have to empty your royal bladder. Go to the bathroom on your own for once.<br><b>Wu:</b> Fine. <i>(walks dejectedly off-screen)</i><br><b>Korra:</b> Do you always go to the bathroom with him?<br><b>Mako:</b> I don't go "with him" with him. <i>(raises both hands out)</i> I just stand there in the general vicinity while he- <i>(stops and slumps back into his seat)</i> I don't want to talk about it.<br><br><i>(Location changes to the gleaming gold and polished bathroom with an attendant standing near the sinks with a towel draped over his arm. Well, we'll put a focus group on it. <i>(the flashback of Jinora and the other airbenders creating a tornado in "Venom of the Red Lotus" plays)</i> Bolin teaches the airbenders to create a giant tornado. <i>(a shot of Nuktuk being carried by a giant bird is shown)</i> Then he flies around in the sky, <i>(a memory of Zaheer being sucked into the tornado in the Book 3 finale plays)</i> pushes Zaheer into it, turning him into wind forever! <i>(more clips of Nuktuk are shown)</i> But Bolin doesn't realize that the universal interplanetary <i>(a scene of the planets aligning from "Harmonic Convergence" is shown)</i> combination zero hour- talk about a ticking clock- is almost upon him! <i>(a clip of Juji firing lasers from his eyes plays on the screen)</i> And when Juji shoots his laser eyes at the Evil Unalaq, <i>(flashback to Unalaq watching Vaatu being set free in "Harmonic Convergence")</i> the beams accidentally fly into the magic spirit doorway! They bounce off Vaatu, setting him free, and hit Bolin, <i>(a shot of Giant Korra standing up in Yue Bay from "Light in the Dark" is played but this time, Korra's face is replaced with Bolin's mug)</i> turning him into a giant! <i>(the memory of Vaatu flying towards Unalaq and merging with him in "Darkness Falls" is shown)</i> But when Vaatu is set free, the Evil Unalaq, who has always been an annoyingly clingy person, is so close to Vaatu that they combine into one <i>(a shot of UnaVaatu growing in size in "Darkness Falls" plays on the screen)</i> horrifying monster! <i>(the memory of Giant Korra and UnaVaatu duking it out in Yue Bay is played on the screen)</i> Giant Bolin and the Evil UnaVaatu fight toe-to-toe, zapping each other with their laser beams as they stomp around Republic City. <i>(the memory of UnaVaatu encasing Giant Korra in the spirit cleansing helix is shown)</i> It looks like the Evil UnaVaatu might win, but thankfully, <i>(in the flashback, Jinora starts to descend towards the giants in a ball of light)</i>Bolin's spiritual mojo <i>(the memory cuts to Jinora who now has neon purple and green colored butterfly wings on her back)</i> is so strong that he attracts the Queen of the Fairies! <i>(Jinora opens her arms and the light spreads)</i> With her help, <i>(a shot of Giant Korra doing the spiritual cleanse on UnaVaatu is shown and he slowly disappears into particles of light)</i> Bolin turns UnaVaatu into magic dust and sprays him into the sky. And that's where the stars come from. <i>(a memory of the dragon-bird saving Korra from "A New Spiritual Age" is shown but this time, the dragon-bird has Bolin's face)</i> Oh, yeah, and he turns into a dragon, and he goes into the Spirit World and saves the Avatar. <i>(return back to the present with Varrick standing triumphantly on the deck)</i> The end!<br><br><i>(Cut to Baraz and Ahnah smiling fondly. A hand enters the frame, clapping. Camera pans across the prisoners as they applaud. What happened to him, huh? <i>(paces about the deck)</i> And-and-and-and stars are magic fairy dust? <i>(walks forward and grabs Baraz's shirt)</i> Are you guys crazy? <i>(sticks his head towards Ahnah)</i> Are you crazy?<br><b>Baraz:</b> It's just a mover. <i>(Bolin lets go of Baraz)</i> Don't overthink it. It's like a ride.<br><b>Varrick:</b> <i>(appears behind Bolin with his arms wide open)</i> Never let the truth <i>(drapes an arm on Bolin's shoulder)</i> get in the way of a good story, kid.<br><br><i>(Varrick smiles at the actor while Bolin frowns as the Nuktuk theme song is played in the background.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
<b>Beyond the Wilds</b><br><b>Written By:</b> Joshua Hamilton<br><b>Directed By:</b> Ian Graham<br><b>Storyboard By:</b> Chris Palmer, William Ruzika, Steve Ahn, Johane Matte, Carli Squitieri<br><b>Animation By:</b> Studio Mir<br><b>Transcriber:</b> Icy_Ashford<br><br><br><br><i>[Previously on "The Legend of Korra" sequence, including clips from "Korra Alone", "The Battle of Zaofu", and "Reunion".]</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> Korra is safely back in Republic City, but Bolin and Varrick are still on the lam. Weeks ago, Korra removed the remaining poison from her body, but the memory of Zaheer's attack still torments her. And after being defeated by Kuvira, she questions if she will ever fully recover. Meanwhile, Kuvira has been secretly harvesting spirit vines from The Swamp. But how close is she to completing her spirit energy weapon?<br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b> <br><br><i>(Episode opens up to a shot of the Spirit Wilds of Republic City. Oh! <i>(the vine pulls him higher into the air and the tourist's hat falls off his head)</i> Oh!<br><br><i>(Return back to Ryu with a protective hand raised behind him.)</i><br><br><b>Ryu:</b> Everyone back! <i>(discards his cards and runs off-screen)</i><br><b>Ryu's Mom:</b> This tour is exciting! <br><br><i>(Switch back to the tourist in the vine's hold as Ryu does an airbending "slice" but his attack collides against the vine without doing any damage. Switch to a shot from behind the couple's backs looking up at Jinora.)</i><br><br><b>Jinora:</b> Korra! The vines! Cut to commercial break.)</i><br><br><br><br><b><u>Act II</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode returns to the entrance gate of the Spirit Wilds as tourists climb onboard a tram that would take them away. Near the entrance, a small cordon is set up by the police and camera cuts to a close up of Lin addressing her colleagues.)</i><br><br><b>Lin:</b> Get everyone out of here! Put up a perimeter. <i>(one group of policemen leave)</i> Cancel all tours. <i>(Korra and Mako run up to Lin)</i> Somebody get ahold of Tenzin. <i>(the rest of the policemen disperse)</i><br><b>Korra:</b> We got to get in there and find Jinora.<br><b>Lin:</b> I don't think anyone should be going in there right now.<br><b>Korra:</b> I know I'm not the old Avatar I used to be, but I can do this.<br><br><i>(Lin thinks about Korra's request with her hands on her hips before a vine shoots out from the Wilds, past the entrance and snaring itself on the light cable dangling from the entrance. It pulls the lights down before slamming itself against a building. Cut to the trio as Lin looks at Korra, concerned.)</i><br><br><b>Lin:</b> Be careful.<br><br><i>(Location changes to the inside of the now visibly darkened Spirit Wilds. Korra and Mako cautiously tred on the vines on the ground.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Jinora!<br><b>Mako:</b> Hello? Anyone? <br><br><i>(Switch to a frontal shot of the two as a creaking noise is heard off-screen.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(looks to the side)</i> Wait. <i>(Korra looks in the same direction as Mako)</i> Do you hear that?<br><br><i>(Switch to a view inside a building, looking out of the window where the duo are standing as they cautiously stare at the window panes. Return back to the outside as the panes shatter and a vine shoots out to attack the pair. Mako firebends while Korra does a spinning kick, sending a blast of airbending at the vines. A vine grabs Mako by the waist and hauls him back. Korra quickly cuts him free with firebending and he falls to the ground. The Avatar quickly runs off with her friend in tow as the vines continuously reaches out for them.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Come on!<br><br><i>(Cut to the inside of an abandoned building as a hole is earthbent in the wall. Korra quickly runs in while Mako stays at the opening, firing off two attacks at the vines. He slowly retreats backwards as the vines start to come in. Korra quickly earthbends a wall to seal the hole. Switch to a back view shot of the two in their bending postures and Mako relaxes, glancing at something glowing behind them.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> Korra, look. <i>(Korra turns around and widens her eyes. Cut to cluster of green, luminescent pods hanging from the ceiling.)</i> What are those?<br><br><i>(Both of them walk forward and investigate. Switch to an aerial view of Korra looking up at the pods and we can see human silhouettes encased in them. The floor beneath the pods is wet and the duo stop in their tracks. The Avatar looks down and we switch to a profile shot of her as she rests a hand on a pod which becomes translucent, revealing Jinora's sleeping form within. Korra widens her eyes with realization.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> It's Jinora and the rest of them. Their spirits are trapped in the Spirit World.<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(bends a fire dagger in his palm)</i> Let's get them out.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(rests a hand on Mako's shoulder)</i> Don't! <i>(Mako stops firebending)</i> You'll provoke the vines. <i>(glances back at Jinora's pod)</i> Let me try.<br><br><i>(Mako takes a few steps back and mystical music begins to play. Switch to a back view shot of the two as Korra uses the water on the floor and waterbends a double helix around the pods, attempting to do the spirit purification technique. The helixes glow golden and the camera focuses on the opaque pod of Jinora. Nothing is happening. Return to the back view shot of the pair as Korra's arms shake from the strain. Cut to a frontal shot of Korra with her eyes closed, deep in concentration. She struggles for a few seconds before opening her eyes and dropping her hands, allowing the water to crash back onto the floor.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(grunts)</i> They won't open. Maybe if I meditate into the Spirit World, I can free them.<br><br><i>(Switch to a frontal shot of the couple as Mako watches Korra take a seat in the lotus position on the floor. Camera quickly zooms in on Korra's face and the screen flashes white before zooming out. Korra has her eyes closed but she is now standing in the canyon where she fought Zaheer. Cut to a profile shot of Korra as she opens her eyes and looks around.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Wait... This isn't the Spirit World.<br><br><i>(A gust of air catches her attention, blowing her hair around and she turns back. Camera pans up to reveal Zaheer floating in the air.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Zaheer! No!<br><br><i>(Zaheer bends two gusts of air at Korra who brings up her arms to shield herself from the attack. She is knocked backwards and rolls along the top of the cliff. Korra stops at the cliff and she stands up, punching her arms forward with a firebending attack but she drops her arm, clutching it with pain and falling to the knees.)</i><br><br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(cut to a close up Zaheer from her memory)</i> You can't fight me and the poison.<br><br><i>(Cut back to Korra as she looks up with despair.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> No, I got it out.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(return back to Zaheer taunting her in the air)</i> You'll never get it out!<br><br><i>(Zaheer airbends again and we return back to Korra as his attack encircles her and it begins to suffocate her. Korra gasps and we return back to the present as she inhales sharply and slumps forward with perspiration dotting her arms and head.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(alarmed)</i> Korra! <i>(runs forward and rests his hands on his friend's shoulders)</i> What's wrong?<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(switch to a profile shot of Korra's face as she pants)</i> It's Zaheer.<br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(cut to Mako as he looks confused)</i> What are you talking about?<br><b>Korra:</b> He's been haunting me <i>(sits up)</i> ever since I fought him. I can't get any peace. <i>(switch to a back view shot of the two)</i> It's like he's blocking me <i>(Mako stands up and holds Korra's hand as he helps to pull her up)</i> from meditating into the Spirit World. <i>(they release their hands after both of them are standing up straight)</i><br><b>Mako:</b> <i>(supportive)</i> I'm here for you. What do you need?<br><br><i>(Scene changes to Mako, Korra, and Tenzin outside at the entrance gate of the Spirit Wilds. The airbending master is pinching his nose bridge.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I want to face Zaheer.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> Korra, he's too dangerous. Even when he's locked up, he can't be trusted.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(cut to a frontal shot of Korra as she turns serious)</i> I need to if I want to save Jinora and the others; there's no other way.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(switch to a shot of Tenzin)</i> There is another way. I'm calling your father. He can lead an expedition into the Spirit World from the Southern Portal.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(return back to Korra as her expression turns downcast)</i> You've lost faith in me too, haven't you? <i>(looks down)</i> No one thinks I'm capable of anything anymore.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> It's not that at all.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(pleads softly)</i> I know I can do this.<br><br><i>(Switch to a profile shot of the scene.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> I'm just so worried for Jinora. I can't imagine if something happened to you too.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(takes a step forward and rests a hand on Tenzin's arm)</i> Tenzin, please... I'll be okay.<br><b>Tenzin:</b> <i>(turns his head to the side and speaks with his eyes closed)</i> Zaheer's imprisoned <i>(looks at Korra in the eye)</i> deep in the mountains outside the city. I'll call Raiko and get the clearance.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(embraces her mentor)</i> Thank you.<br><br><i>(Location changes to an aerial shot of Air Temple Island. Cut to Bolin walking down a pathway surrounded by trees and greenery. He now sports a jacket based off The Rocketeer and he wears his hair without any gel.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Pab-pabs, <i>(switch to a view from the ground looking up at Bolin)</i> where are you?<br><br><i>(Pabu appears with a squeak, on a branch in a tree above him. Bolin turns around and Pabu chitters excitedly. Switch to a profile shot of Bolin with his arms wide open as the fire ferret jumps off the branch and lands in Bolin's arms.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Pabu! <i>(hugs his pet and spins in a circle as he laughs)</i> Oh, I missed you so much! <i>(holds Pabu out in front of him)</i> So I don't know if you've heard, but Opal's kind of mad at me. <i>(Pabu squeaks)</i> I was hoping you could help me win her back.<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Pabu as he chitters. Return back to Bolin as he looks delighted.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Awesome! Yes, I have an idea.<br><br><i>(Scene changes to Opal reading a book on the steps of a building. Cut to a close up of Opal as Pabu runs around Opal before stopping in front of her and stands up with its paws on her knees.)</i><br><br><b>Opal:</b> Hello, Pabu. <i>(the fire ferret chitters some more)</i> Well, it's good to see you too. <i>(cut to her point of view as she pulls off a small roll of paper from the ribbon)</i> What do you got there?<br><br><i>(Cut to a close up of Opal's face as she unrolls the parchment and reads it quickly, alarm forming on her face.<br><br>Scene changes to Opal running down a pathway with Pabu in tow and she stops, looking around. But now that you're here, don't you want to just sit back, relax, <i>(picks up the basket of steamed buns)</i> try some of my homemade steam buns- <i>(Pabu picks up a steam bun with his paws)</i> Pema's recipe- <i>(puts down the basket)</i> and watch Pabu <i>(holds Pabu out in front of him)</i> do some of his World famous backflips <i>(flips Pabu in the air)</i> for entertainment? <i>(catches Pabu and the steam bun falls back into Pabu's grasp)</i> Ha-ha! <br><br><i>(The fire ferret chitters happily and we switch to a shot of Opal who doesn't look amused.)</i><br><br><b>Opal:</b> <i>(sarcastically)</i> Oh, steam buns- my favorite. This will totally make me forget that you worked for Kuvira, the person who captured my family and is probably torturing them right now. <i>(cut to a close up of Bolin with nervous sweat dotting his forehead)</i> So, yeah, let's just sit down <i>(cut back to Opal as she becomes furious)</i> and have a great picnic because we're so in love! <i>(turns away and takes a few steps forward before turning back)</i> I'm sorry you had to see that, Pabu.<br><br><i>(Switch to a shot of Bolin looking down sadly as his pet takes a few bites from the steamed bun.<br><br>Location changes to a shot of City Hall.)</i><br><br><b>Raiko:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> Thank you both for coming.<br><br><i>(Cut to the inside of Raiko's office as he address Asami and Varrick, who is now wearing his old Water Tribe clothes.)</i><br><br><b>Varrick:</b> It's nice to be welcomed back with open arms.<br><b>Raiko:</b> <i>(cut to a close up of Raiko as he adjusts his glasses)</i> Actually, I brought you here out of necessity. I think if I see Zaheer chained up, <i>(looks down)</i> I'll finally realize that he's not a threat anymore.<br><br><i>(Switch to an overhead shot of the two as they walk forward. The elevator comes to a stop and the doors slide open to reveal two more sentries standing at their positions outside a metal gate. Everyone gets off the elevator. switch to a shot of the two sentries as they bend their knees and pull their arms back. The gate clangs into place and the sentries stop bending.)</i><br><br><b>Guard:</b> Approach the wall.<br><br><i>(Switch to a back view shot of Korra and Mako. Cut to the other side of the gate as the camera slowly pulls back and the gate slides into place, fully revealing Korra. Korra is still on the edge and takes a step back.)</i><br><br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(laughs heartily)</i> I guess it didn't work. <i>(cut to Zaheer as he looks at the Avatar with a menacing grin)</i> You still seem scared.<br><br><i>(Change to an over the shoulder view from behind Zaheer as Korra backs away fearfully.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> This was a mistake. <i>(turns away)</i><br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(stands up straight)</i> I know why you're here. <i>(Korra stops in her tracks)</i><br><b>Korra:</b> You don't know anything about me!<br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(cut to a frontal shot of Zaheer's face as he cocks his head to the side)</i> You can't go into the Spirit World. <i>(Switch to the back of Korra's head as she turns to the side to look at Zaheer. Cut to a profile shot of the confrontation.)</i> I spend most of my time in the Spirit World, <i>(Korra turns around to face Zaheer again)</i> and it's well-known that the Avatar's Spirit hasn't been there for a few years.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>You</i> can meditate into the Spirit World from here? <i>(glances around the cell)</i> Doesn't feel very spiritually charged.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> This is your problem. Republic City is flowing with spiritual energy, and you can't even tap into it.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(cut to Korra who is angered)</i> No, my problem is <i>(points an accusatory finger at Zaheer)</i> you. You poisoned <i>(her arm shakes)</i> me! <i>(throws her hand down)</i> You ruined me! <i>(cut to Zaheer as he listens passively)</i> People used to think I was unstoppable, but now they don't think I'm capable of anything!<br><b>Zaheer:</b> Blaming me is a crutch to make you feel better, <i>(turns away from the Avatar)</i> but it's not helping you recover.<br><br><i>(Return back to a profile shot of Korra.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(voice shaking slightly)</i> I thought seeing you face-to-face would put an end to all of this, <i>(looks down dejectedly)</i> but maybe it's time I realize I'll never be the same.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(cut to a frontal shot of Zaheer with Korra behind him)</i> Neither of us are the same as before. I learned to fly, <i>(looks down as his fettered wrists)</i> but now I'm bound in chains. You have all the power in the World and the freedom to use it, but you choose to hold yourself down.<br><b>Korra:</b> I'm not holding myself down, but my powers have limits.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(turns around)</i> You're wrong. That poison should've killed you, but you <i>(furrows his brows)</i> were able to fight it off. You think your power has limits; I say it's limitless.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(cut to a close up of Korra as she glances down dismissively)</i> Whatever. Before, you were always talking about chaos and freedom. Then you took out the Earth Queen and created the worst dictator the Earth Kingdom has ever seen. Thanks for that.<br><br><i>(Switch to a close up of Zaheer as he widens his eyes and his expression changes to surprise.)</i><br><br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(glances down thoughtfully)</i> I've heard rumors about her, but I didn't know she achieved so much power. She needs to be stopped.<br><br><i>(Return back to a profile shot of the scene.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> Well, I can't stop her unless I get over this block.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> I think I can help. <i>(switch to a close up of Zaheer)</i> Let me lead you into the Spirit World.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(change to a shot of Korra's face which still has cold sweat on it)</i> No way. <i>(looks to the side)</i> I can't trust you.<br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(camera returns back to Zaheer)</i> Maybe not. But if you had any other options, you wouldn't be here now, would you? <i>(return back to the previous shot of Korra)</i> We may have been enemies once, but for now, our interests align. <i>(Korra widens her eyes with realization)</i><br><br><i>(Cut back to a profile shot of the area and Zaheer returns back to his lotus position in mid-air. Cut to Korra as she looks down.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> I've come this far. What have I got to lose? <br><br><i>(Korra sits down in the lotus position inhales sharply. Return back to the profile shot of the two of them.)</i><br><br><b>Zaheer:</b> Focus on the sound of my voice, and clear your mind.<br><br><i>(The prison cell background changes to the blue and green tinged spiritual plane. The background then changes to a frontal shot of Korra cringing from the memory. The flashback of Zaheer attempting to suffocate Korra plays out on the screen. In the foreground, faded profile shots of Korra and Zaheer appear on both sides of the screen. Don't fear what might have been.<br><b>Korra:</b> I have no control!<br><br><i>(Korra and Zaheer both fade away from the screen and the memory turns into Korra falling down the eye of the tornado, screaming.)</i><br><br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(off-screen in an ethereal voice)</i> Don't be afraid. Hold on.<br><br><i>(Korra makes contact with the ground and seemingly passes through it. The ground shatters and turns into various spirits and camera pans down to reveal Korra seated in the lotus position in the Spirit World meadow with its gingko-like trees behind her.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(opens her eyes)</i> I made it... <i>(looks around and we switch to a profile shot of Zaheer standing in front of Korra, but unshackled)</i> And you led me here. <i>(pushes herself off the ground)</i> Do you know where Jinora and the others are?<br><b>Zaheer:</b> <i>(cut to a close up of Zaheer)</i> No, but you do. <i>(his apparition fades away)</i><br><br><i>(Korra's body and eyes glow blue with the Avatar Spirit and Raava's symbol shines on Korra's torso.)</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(looks down at her heart with glee)</i> Raava, I missed you. Where have you been?<br><b>Raava:</b> <i>(from within Korra)</i> I have always been inside of you.<br><b>Korra:</b> Can you help me find Jinora?<br><br><i>(The wind whistles and Korra is quickly transported through the lush green landscape, past a barren land, until she reaches a dark forest which has a green sphere containing all the suspended souls of the people who got taken from the Spirit Wilds in Republic City. )</i><br><br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(off-screen)</i> How do I release their spirits?<br><br><i>(Cut to a shot of Korra standing in front of the sphere.)</i><br><br><b>Raava:</b> You must bend the energy within.<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(looks down at her hands)</i> But I'm powerless in the Spirit World.<br><b>Raava:</b> No, you're most powerful here. <i>(switch to a close up of Korra)</i> In the Spirit World, you're connected to <i>all</i> the spiritual energy.<br><br><i>(Korra walks forward and camera changes to a scenic shot of the sphere. Cut to Korra's hand touching the sphere and its surface glows translucent. Cut to a close up of Korra with her eyes closed in concentration. She then opens her eyes and they glow with the Avatar State. Return back to a shot of the sphere as it slowly glows golden from the bottom up, making the sphere opaque. When the glow reaches the top, the sphere dissipates into shiny green particles. Cut to a shot of Ryu's spirit as the sphere disintegrates. Switch to a full shot of the sphere as the souls gradually float up towards the sky. The camera changes to an overhead shot of all the souls making their way home.<br><br>Camera flashes white and we cut back to the pods in the Spirit Wilds. The pods melt away to reveal Ryu's mother and Tourist #1. More pods around them slowly disintegrate. Cut to Jinora's pod as it opens up to reveal herself covered in green slime. She opens her eyes and takes a deep breath. Camera pans up to Ryu's pod as it fully melts away.)</i><br><br><b>Ryu:</b> <i>(groans as he wakes up)</i> Uh... I feel all spirity.<br><br><i>(Scene changes to the vines outside the entrance gate of the Spirit Wilds and they are pushed apart like a curtain by Ryu and Jinora. Jinora rushes forward happily.)</i><br><br><b>Jinora:</b> <i>(gasps)</i> Dad!<br><br><i>(Cut to Lin and Tenzin outside the entrance as the latter catches his daughter who jumps into his arms. Tenzin twirls his oldest child around in a circle before gently setting her down on the ground. Cut to a close up of Tenzin and Jinora.)</i><br><br><b>Tenzin:</b> I'm so glad you're safe. What happened? How did you get out?<br><b>Jinora:</b> Korra saved us.<br><br><i>(Jinora smiles at her father and Tenzin returns the gesture with a soft smile of his own.<br><br>Scene changes to Mako and Korra walking out of Zaheer's mountain prison.)</i><br><br><b>Mako:</b> So... How are you doing?<br><b>Korra:</b> <i>(softly)</i> I feel whole again. I feel good. <i>(stops walking)</i><br><b>Mako:</b> Do you think you're finally able to forget about <i>(cut to a close up of the duo as the doors to the prison slowly close behind them)</i> what Zaheer did to you?<br><b>Korra:</b> No. <i>(turns around to face Mako)</i> But I am finally able to accept what happened, <i>(smiles at Mako)</i> and I think that's gonna make me stronger.<br><br><i>(Location changes to Lin and Opal loading up supplies on Opal's air bison on Air Temple Island. Bolin runs into the frame and we cut to a frontal shot of Opal with Bolin behind her.)</i><br><br><b>Bolin:</b> Where are you going?<br><b>Opal:</b> <i>(angles her head towards Bolin)</i> We've got some family business <i>(turns away)</i> to take care of.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(with his hands clasped together)</i> All right, listen, before you go, I just want to tell you that I understand how you feel. I know there's nothing I could do or no big gesture that can make up for all my mistakes, <i>(switch to the back of Opal's head as she reacts to his words by glancing down)</i> but that doesn't mean I'm gonna stop trying to win you <i>(Opal glances to Bolin sadly)</i> back, because... <i>(cut to a close up of Bolin as he speaks sincerely)</i> I love you.<br><b>Opal:</b> <i>(return back to a shot of Opal with a faint blush staining her cheeks and she looks away from Bolin)</i> Thanks for saying all of that. <i>(switch to a shot of Opal with Bolin behind her and the earthbender turns to walk away)</i> You know, <i>(Bolin stops in his tracks)</i> there is one thing you could do to win me back.<br><b>Bolin:</b> <i>(enthusiastically)</i> What is it? Yes, I'll do anything!<br><br><i>(Cut to a full shot of the scene as Lin watches her niece and Bolin from the saddle.)</i><br><br><b>Opal:</b> Come on a secret mission with us.<br><b>Bolin:</b> Where to? <br><b>Opal:</b> Zaofu. <i>(cut back to Opal as she speaks seriously)</i> We're going to rescue my family.<br><br><i>(The camera focuses on Bolin now who is at first surprised but his expression changes to stoic determination.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>

Meanwhile, Bolin, Opal, and Lin are on a mission to rescue su beifong and her family, who are being held captive by Kuvira.<br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode opens up to an aerial view of Zaofu, now with its domes removed. <b>Kuvira's Gambit</b><br><b>Written By:</b> Joshua Hamilton<br><b>Directed By:</b> Colin Heck<br><b>Storyboard By:</b> Eugene Lee, Hyun Joo Song, Natasha Wicked, Olga Ulanova<br><b>Animation By:</b> Studio Mir<br><b>Transcriber:</b> Icy_Ashford<br><br><br><br><i>[Previously on "The Legend of Korra" sequence, including clips from "Operation Beifong".]</i><br><br><b>Shiro Shinobi:</b> Bolin, Opal, and Lin rescued the Bei Fongs and Zhu Li from Kuvira. Now they're racing to Republic City to alert everyone about the Earth Empire's imminent attack. Meanwhile, Korra and Team Avatar have been preparing for just such an event. Prince Wu is leading an evacuation effort while Asami and Varrick are creating flying mecha-suits. But with Kuvira planning to strike in only two weeks, will they be ready in time?<br><br><br><br><b><u>Act I</u></b><br><br><i>(Episode opens to a shot of Zaofu in the day. But our mission is not yet complete. <i>(scene changes to two soldiers in a tent listening to Kuvira on the radio)</i> There is a grave injustice that must be corrected. As you all know, after the hundred year war, Avatar Aang, <i>(scene changes to another campsite with three soldiers listening to Kuvira on their radio)</i> along with Fire Lord Zuko stole Earth Empire land and formed the United Republic. <i>(cut back to an unoccupied Republic City on the map behind Kuvira)</i> This land belongs to the people of the Earth Empire <i>(camera pulls back to completely reveal Kuvira's face)</i> and it's time to take it back. Lifting her head up, she opens her eyes with steely resolve.)</i><br><br><br><br>[End Credits]<br>
